title: Onboarding Specialist (Hospital Onboarding Experience Required)
description:
**Elevate Patient Financial Solutions** has an exciting career opportunity available as a/an Onboarding Specialist. This position will be a remote based role. The Full Time schedule for this role will be **Monday through Friday 8 AM to 5 PM.**  

  

**Job Summary**
The Onboarding Specialist will be the administrative expert and provide front-line support to recruiters, hiring managers, employees, and applicants for any process related issues. The Onboarding Specialist will work in collaboration with Recruiters and Leadership to support various aspects of Talent Acquisition, such as overseeing pre-employment background checks, occupational health requirements and reviewing new hire paperwork. The primary function of this role will be responsible for ensuring new hires are in compliance with client occupational health requirements and company new hire expectations. Success in this position requires exceptional communication skills throughout each step of the process.
  

**Essential Duties and Responsibilities**
* Coordinates onboarding process such as background checks and occupational health requirements.
* Ensure timely completion of new hire pre-employment, to include background checks, secondary checks, health screenings and other requirements needed.
* Accurately creates and manages new employee personnel files.
* Responsible for requesting and ensuring new hire paperwork is completed and filed appropriately in the employee folder.
* Responsible for data entry of new hires in HR system.
* Serves as a dependable point of contact for candidates and hiring managers for candidate status.
* Available by phone and email to provide assistance as needed.
* Builds and fosters relationships with Recruiters, Hiring Managers, employees, applicants, and client contacts to ensure a positive onboarding experience.
* Provide general administrative support to Talent Acquisition team.
* Assists with special projects as needed.
* Other duties as assigned.

**Qualifications and Requirements**
To perform this job successfully, an individual must perform each essential duty satisfactorily. The requirements listed below are representative of the knowledge, skill, and/or abilities.
* High School Diploma or GED
* 3+ years related experience in new hire onboarding processes
* 2+ years related experience with occupational health related onboarding
* Proficient in Microsoft Word, Excel, Outlook
* Previous applicant tracking system experience is preferred.
* Demonstrated ability to maintain confidentiality and professionalism under any situation is critical.
* Effective problem-solving skills.
* Proven ability to follow through in an organized and effective way
* Ability to effectively communicate with all parties inside and outside of the organization.
* Detail oriented and highly organized with proven superior time management skills
* Proactive team player with strong work ethic.
* Remote and Hybrid positions require a home internet connection that meets the company’s upload and download speed criteria.

**Benefits:**  

ElevatePFS believes in making a positive impact not only within our industry but also with our employees –the organization’s greatest asset! We take pride in offering comprehensive benefits in a vast array of plans that contribute to the present and future well-being of our employees and their families.
* Medical, Dental & Vision Insurance
* 401K (100% match for the first 3% & 50% match for the next 2%)
* 15 days of PTO
* 7 paid Holidays
* 2 Floating holidays
* 1 Elevate Day (floating holiday)
* Pet Insurance
* Employee referral bonus program
* Teamwork: We believe in teamwork and having fun together
* Career Growth: Gain great experience to promote to higher roles

The salary of the finalist selected for this role will be set based on a variety of factors, including but not limited to, internal equity, experience, education, location, specialty and training. This pay scale is not a promise of a particular wage.
The job description does not constitute an employment agreement between the employer and Employee and is subject to change by the employer as the needs of the employer and requirements of the job change.

title: Human Resources Manager
description:
Description:

Brella Productions, a Creative Production Agency for Corporate Events and Training, is hiring an experienced, HR Manager with a background in supporting a remote/hybrid workforce. This position will be almost exclusively remote. In this growth focused role, you will be leading all HR functions, including all phases of employee lifecycle, HR policies, compliances, payroll and benefits and performance management.


You will be coming into a well-established, culture centered HR Department tailored to our remote-centric workplace. We have exceptional management buy-in on the importance of employee development and inclusion. Our current HR leader is transitioning after 20+ years in HR at Brella and we want our next leader to continue the phenomenal work of making our company a place where creative team members thrive. If you are interested in joining our team and making a meaningful impact on Brella’s success, please apply today.

**Key Responsibilities and Tasks:**

**Recruiting and On-boarding:**

* Lead the recruiting and selection process.
* Manage digital on-boarding process in HRIS and related software. Includes facilitation between manager, trainers, and technical team to ensure new hires have all documentation, equipment, orientation and training mapped out and prepared from Day 0 through end of on-boarding (typically 6 months).

**Strategic and Compliance Management:**

* Develop and implement HR strategies and initiatives aligned with the overall business strategy.
* Support current and future business needs through the development, engagement, motivation, and preservation of human capital.
* Develop and monitor overall HR strategies, systems, tactics, and procedures across the organization.
* Ensure equitable and competitive compensation and benefits plans.
* Act as administrator and ensure compliance with federal, state, and local employment laws and regulations, and recommended best practices.
* Maintain knowledge of trends, best practices, regulatory changes, and new technologies in human resources, talent management, and employment law.
* Consult with training, coaching, benefits, legal and other HR advisors as needed.

**HRIS, Payroll and Benefits Management:**

* Act as administrator of HRIS. Includes digital management of employee data, ATS, payroll processing, employee benefits enrollment and management, compliance tracking, and employee facing HR documents and policies.
* Act as employee benefits administrator. Assess current and future benefit needs, advantages and costs and present recommendations to executive leadership.
* Schedule year-round educational outreach on employee benefits.
* Audit employee benefit and compensation changes for payroll.
* Maintains historical human resource records in compliance with federal, state and corporate requirements.

**Performance Management:**

* Regularly meet with managers for employee progress reviews and performance assessments. Discuss individual performance development goals, issues, and opportunities. Develop training support plans as needed.
* Assess corporate/team/individual training needs to develop or procure training programs.
* Regularly meet with employees for progress reviews and assessments, discussing any problems or grievances they may have.
* Support a clear, equitable and inclusive workplace through education and coaching; hearing and resolving employee grievances; counseling employees and supervisors.

**Company Culture and Communication:**

* Promote a positive and open work environment of learning, discussion, and growth. Ensure all team members have a respected voice in the organization and the opportunity and means to flourish.
* Plan remote friendly team and culture building activities and events.
* Manage employee newsletter and other HR communications.


Requirements:
* Proven working experience of 5+ years as an HR generalist or manager.
* Skilled in using productivity software and HRIS systems such as: Paylocity, Quick Books, ClickUp, Microsoft Excel, Slack, and standard benefit portals.
* Excellent active listening, negotiation, and presentation skills.
* Strong interpersonal and analytical skills.
* Ability to have hard conversations with empathy.
* Proven work experience in a remote only or hybrid-remote environments.
* In-depth knowledge of benefits, labor law and HR best practices.
* Familiarity with training facilitation.
* Comprehensive knowledge of talent sourcing and recruiting techniques.
* Ability to handle and analyze data with confidentiality.

title: Mortgage Recruiter
description:
**Company Overview**


We are looking for ambitious and driven individuals to grow with us. We operate in a fast-paced, dynamic environment where everyone on the team strives to be the "best of the best".


Inspired by hometown values and committed to being responsible and caring for each other, we exist for the benefit of our customers.


Mutual of Omaha Mortgage is a full service lending division offering a complete line of residential Forward and Reverse mortgages. We employ a knowledgeable staff of experienced Mortgage Bankers with an operations team that is second to none!

**The Work:**


We are seeking an individual who is detail oriented and willing to join a fast pace, time sensitive and constantly changing environment.


This position will be in charge of high level sales recruitment, recruiting for technical roles (Salesforce, System Administrator position etc.) and Corporate Administrative roles. You will collaborate closely with hiring managers to understand their staffing needs and develop effective recruiting strategies to attract top-tier candidates. The ideal candidate will have a strong understanding of the mortgage industry, excellent communication skills, and a proven track record in recruitment.  

  

Compensation will consist of a base pay (60-80K) + bonus per hire depending on source and role.

**Key Responsibilities:**

* Collaborate with hiring managers to understand staffing needs and develop comprehensive recruitment plans.
* Source and attract top talent through various channels, including job boards, social media, networking events, and referrals.
* Screen resumes, conduct interviews, and evaluate candidates to assess their qualifications, skills, and fit for the organization.
* Manage the entire recruitment process from initial contact to offer acceptance, ensuring a positive candidate experience throughout.
* Build and maintain a pipeline of qualified candidates for current and future hiring needs.
* Stay abreast of industry trends and best practices in recruitment and talent acquisition.
* Utilize recruitment metrics and analytics to measure the effectiveness of recruiting strategies and make data-driven decisions.

**Qualifications:**

* Minimum of 2-3 years of experience in recruitment, preferably in the mortgage or financial services industry.
* Strong understanding of the mortgage lending process and terminology.
* Proven track record of successfully recruiting and hiring top talent.
* Excellent communication and interpersonal skills, with the ability to build rapport and establish relationships with candidates and hiring managers.
* Highly organized with exceptional attention to detail and the ability to manage multiple priorities in a fast-paced environment.
* Proficiency in applicant tracking systems and other recruitment tools/software.


We are highly respected in our industry and are growing our office with long term employees who are striving for a career.

title: Talent Acquisition Specialist
description:
**About Us:** Prometric is a leading provider of technology-enabled testing and assessment solutions to many of the world’s most recognized licensing and certification organizations, academic institutions, and government agencies. We support more than 7 million test takers annually at our testing locations in 180 countries around the world. With over three decades of experience working with clients of all sizes across a multitude of industry sectors, our mission is to design and deliver the highest quality and most innovative testing solutions anytime, anywhere.
  
  

The Talent Acquisition Specialist at Prometric will own the talent acquisition process and overall strategy for the US Test Centers and Nurse Aide Recruitment. This position requires expert organizational skills, a go-getter mentality, and the ability to multitask in a high-volume recruiting environment. This position requires a true "sourcer" who can quickly find qualified candidates to fill these important roles. The ability to "think outside the box" to find cost-effective ways to attract candidates is an absolute must. You will be responsible for the full recruitment life cycle, from creative job marketing, sourcing, interviewing and job offers. The individual will be proactive in ensuring that Prometric is in a position to have a robust pipeline of talented individuals.
  
  

Prometric is a trusted test development and delivery provider to more than 300 organizations worldwide. On their behalf, we securely deliver an average of 7 million exams per year to people who are seeking to improve their lives. Whether by starting a new career, further developing their skills to improve on an existing one, adding to their qualifications for a promotion, taking school entrance exams or simply for professional development, people taking tests want a reliable, convenient and hassle-free experience. Prometric serves as an industry gatekeeper, ensuring that people legitimately earn the credentials they seek to achieve, and thereby guaranteeing a fair testing experience for all who come through our doors.
  
  

**Responsibilities:**  

* Lead end to end recruitment for Test Center and Nurse Aide positions.
* Conduct phone, virtual and/or in-person interviews and maintain a complete record of interviews and new hires
* Reporting on and tracking key recruiting metrics
* Timely dispositioning of candidates and requisitions
* Define and use internet recruitment strategies, innovative social media, and non-traditional sources for attracting talent including but not limited to: job board sourcing, virtual hiring events, social media recruiting platform usage, etc.
* Drive strategy and framework for talent acquisition for Test Centers.
* Establish, track and iterate measurements focusing on the effectiveness of the Talent Acquisition function; such as time to fill and cost per hire
* Act as a strategic partner to all functional leaders assisting with hiring plans, resource allocation and communications/advertising to decrease time to fill
* Assist in diversity and college recruitment strategy
* Partner with outside agencies when required
* Other projects as assigned


**Experience:**  

* Bachelor degree preferred or relevant experience
* 3+ years of high volume recruitment experience
* Strong customer service, communication (both written and verbal) and interpersonal and organization skills
* An ability to juggle multiple projects and priorities, meet deadlines and maintain professionalism under pressure.
* Willingness and ability to be both hands on with all levels of the organization as well as serve as a strategic partner to hiring managers


Prometric is an Equal Employment/Affirmative Action employer. We do not discriminate in hiring based on sex, gender identity, sexual orientation, race, color, religious creed, national origin, physical or mental disability, protected Veteran status, or any other characteristic protected by federal, state, and local law.

title: Human Resources and Benefits Administrator
description:
Rancho Health MSO provides administration services that support our physicians and clinic staff. Our family physicians serve Riverside, Ventura and San Diego Counties with the highest quality of care. We pride ourselves on going beyond the exam room to make our community healthier and happier.


Our Human Resources department is looking for a dynamic, experienced, and versatile HR professional to join our team. We are a very close-knit team of 4 and this position is a key role in our department. If you are looking to continue your career in HR Administration and enjoy providing extraordinary employee service, come join our team!


The intent of this job description is to provide a summary of the major duties and responsibilities performed in this job. Incumbents may be requested to perform job-related tasks other than those specifically presented in this description.


The Human Resources and Benefits Administrator is an HR professional providing essential administrative support within the HR department, with a primary focus on managing benefits programs and ensuring smooth HR operations. Key responsibilities include Benefits Administration, HRIS Management, Personnel File Maintenance, and Supporting HR Initiatives. This role is crucial in supporting the HR department and ensuring employees receive the necessary support for their benefits and HR-related needs. The ideal candidate possesses strong organizational skills, attention to detail, multitasking abilities, and excels in accurate data handling and providing excellent communication and customer service.


**Essential Job Duties:**


* Benefits Administration:
	+ Administer and maintain company benefits programs, ensuring compliance with policies and regulations.
	+ Manage benefits invoice reconciliation with vendors to ensure accurate billing.
	+ Inform and guide employees on benefits eligibility, coverage, and provisions.
	+ Compile and maintain benefits records and documentation.
	+ Assist employees with inquiries and questions regarding benefit programs.
* HRIS (ADP WFN) Administration:
	+ Execute onboarding, offboarding, and status changes in the HRIS (ADP Workforce Now).
	+ Respond to employee inquiries related to HRIS matters.
	+ Generate ad hoc reports for HR leadership.
* Onboarding Administration:
	+ Process all new hire documents for all counties, facilitating the pre-employment process and collecting necessary forms to upload into ADP WFN.
	+ Participate in New Hire Orientation and prepare meeting materials.
	+ Track all new hires through the onboarding process.
	+ Collaborate with hiring managers to ensure a smooth and positive onboarding experience for new employees.
* Offboarding Administration for all counties:
	+ Communicate with management, employees, and relevant departments (e.g., payroll, IT, revenue cycle) during offboarding processes.
	+ Process separation paperwork and packages for departing employees.
* HR Email Inbox Administration:
	+ Manage and respond to HR-related inquiries and emails promptly and professionally.
	+ Provide accurate information to employees regarding HR policies, benefits, and other HR-related matters.
* HR Department Credit Card Reconciliation:
	+ Reconcile department credit card expenses and maintain accurate records for financial tracking.
* Special Projects:
	+ Participate in various HR projects, including audits, open enrollment (OE) processes, and HRIS projects.
	+ Collaborate with HR team members to ensure successful project implementation and completion.
* Adobe: Form Creation, Editing, Manipulating, Issuing:
	+ Utilize Adobe software to create, edit, manipulate, and issue HR forms and documents.
	+ Ensure all documents are accurate, up-to-date, and comply with company standards.
* Payroll Change Reporting:
	+ Make changes in HRIS, track forms, update spreadsheets, and report HR changes to payroll.
* Personnel File Management, Filing, Mailing, Scanning:
	+ Manage and maintain employee personnel files in an organized and confidential manner.
	+ Handle filing, mailing, and scanning of HR documents to ensure efficient record-keeping.

**Required education and experience:** The requirements listed below are representative of the knowledge, skills, and/or ability required.


**Minimum Education (or substitute experience) required:**

* High school diploma or equivalent; additional specialized training or certification in HR is a plus.
* AA in business administration, human resources, or another related field.
* 3-5 years of relevant experience in HR operations, benefits administration, and HRIS management.


**Minimum Knowledge and Skills Required:**


* Proficiency in using Adobe software for form creation and document editing.
* Proficiency in using Microsoft Office.
* HRIS administration experience (ADP Workforce Now highly preferred).
* Strong organizational skills with the ability to prioritize tasks and meet deadlines.
* Excellent communication skills to effectively interact with employees at all levels.
* Discretion and respect for handling confidential employee information.
* Strong attention to detail and accuracy in data entry and record-keeping.
* The ability to work independently and within established procedures.
* The ability to manage work and time to meet tight deadlines is required.

title: Full Cycle Recruiter
description:
**Joyful Jobs**

**Full-Cycle Recruiter**

**About the Organization:**

Joyful Jobs is seeking a recruiter to join our team! Founded in July 2021, Joyful Jobs provides fast, flexible, affordable talent acquisition services catered to small and medium-sized businesses and nonprofits. We function as an outsourced partner to our clients, who typically only need to make a handful of hires per year and typically don’t have a dedicated HR/recruiting team in place. Our team currently consists of our Founder/CEO and a virtual assistant for marketing/business development, but we plan to continue slowly growing by 1-3 team members per year as we expand our services and client base.

**Position Summary:**

Reporting directly to the Founder/CEO, the Recruiter position is responsible for managing 3-6 job requisitions from start to finish. This includes intake meetings and ongoing communication with clients, posting jobs, actively sourcing candidates, reviewing resumes, and conducting phone screens. The successful candidate will strongly align with our mission and values and be passionate about serving our clients.

**Duties & Responsibilities:**

* Conduct intake meetings with clients when a new job requisition opens
* Post assigned jobs on sites including but not limited to Indeed, LinkedIn, SmartRecruiters ATS, Craigslist, Handshake, ZipRecruiter, and other job boards
* Source and send messages to passive candidates on sites such as Indeed and LinkedIn
* Review all applications for assigned jobs within 2 business days and deactivate or engage candidates as appropriate
* Conduct phone interviews with candidates meeting qualifications for assigned jobs
* Share promising candidates with clients, coordinate next steps as needed, and communicate other relevant updates about the job
* Maintain “short list” of top candidates to engage for future opportunities that arise
* Keep job status documents up-to-date with current information about sourcing strategies completed or in process and candidate interviews
* Work with internal team on collaborative efforts and projects
* Assist Founder/CEO with miscellaneous tasks as needed to support growth of and improvements to the agency (ie, building SOP documents, brainstorming revisions to client onboarding process, etc)
* Utilize software and databases including Microsoft 365 (especially Outlook, Word, Excel, OneDrive, and Teams), Google Drive, Slack, and Trello
* On occasion, attend job fairs or networking events/meetings on behalf of the company
* Other duties as assigned by the Founder/CEO

**Required Qualifications:**

* Must have full-cycle recruiting experience including sourcing, screening, interviewing, scheduling, and coordinating with hiring managers
* Must have experience recruiting white-collar roles such as marketing, operations, finance, accounting, HR, IT, sales, business development, and administrative, at varying seniority levels from coordinator to executive
* SUPERB customer service inclination and skills
* Excellent written and verbal communication, organizational skills, and attention to detail (for real, we will definitely look for this in our selection process!)
* 50+ WPM typing speed and generally tech-savvy
* Some basic knowledge of Microsoft 365 products (minimally, Word and Excel)
* Not afraid to take initiative, but also knows when to ask questions or await direction
* Enjoys thinking creatively to most effectively recruit and screen candidates for unique roles and/or clients with particular culture fit needs
* Passionate about building relationships with candidates, clients, and team members alike
* Able to think objectively, holistically, and without bias to discern the good candidates from the great ones
* Always happy to pick up the phone when necessary, but knows how to effectively combine verbal and written communication depending on the situation
* Friendly and easy to talk to while remaining professional
* Commitment to contribute towards a respectful and inclusive culture where differences are appreciated; the ability to work with all individuals regardless of race, color, gender, sexual orientation, sexual identity, age, religion, marital/family status, disability, national origin and military status

**Preferred Qualifications:**

* Strongly preferred: recruitment experience for an agency, small-to-medium-sized business, or nonprofit
* Business degree
* Located in Tucson, AZ

We know there are great candidates who will not fit everything we have described above or who have important skills we have not considered. If that’s you, do not hesitate to apply and tell us about yourself. The above statements are intended to describe the general nature and level of work being performed by an employee assigned to this job. This is not intended to be an exhaustive list of all responsibilities, duties and skills required of personnel incumbent in this position.

**Why work with us?**

* Get in on the ground floor of a very small but successful startup, with possible opportunities to grow your career as the company expands
* Work for a mission-driven Founder/CEO who is passionate about making the world a better place, including dedicated support of your career goals
* Flexible work hours (mostly remote) with a culture that prioritizes work/life balance and mental health

**Position Location:** Ideal candidate is based in Tucson, AZ - work will be primarily conducted remotely, but prefer ability to attend occasional in-person meetings with team and clients

Job Type: Part-time

Pay: $16.00 - $20.00 per hour

Expected hours: 10 – 25 per week

Experience level:

* 10 years
* 11+ years
* 2 years
* 3 years
* 4 years
* 5 years
* 6 years
* 7 years
* 8 years
* 9 years

Schedule:

* 4 hour shift
* 8 hour shift
* Choose your own hours
* Day shift
* Monday to Friday
* No nights
* No weekends

Experience:

* nonprofit recruiting: 1 year (Preferred)
* Recruiting: 2 years (Required)

Work Location: Remote

title: Talent Acquisition Manager
description:
**Prior experience in talent acquisition leadership capacity in ABA field is required for this role** 

Mindcolor Autism was founded in 2019 with the goal of providing compassionate, individualized Applied Behavior Analysis (ABA) therapy to families impacted by autism. We are a mission driven company and pride ourselves on having a unique culture centered around strong ethics, teamwork and transparency. By closely working together with team members and families, we can achieve the best outcomes.

We are looking for a Talent Acquisition Manager to join our growing team! This role is an opportunity to be an integral part in leading our talent acquisition strategy and ensuring we have the right talent in place to support the success of our team members and clients!

**Job Description:**

* Develop and maintain talent acquisition strategies that align with the business’ needs and attract a diverse pool of high caliber talent
* Regularly review existing recruiting systems / processes and identify areas for improvement
* Establish and maintain relationships with hiring managers to stay abreast of current and future hiring needs. Work with hiring managers to leverage hiring best practices and facilitate a competency based candidate review and selection process
* Oversee the process of creating job descriptions and advertising openings using various outlets including recruiting websites, social networks, and community job boards
* Perform searches for qualified candidates according to relevant job criteria using computer databases, networking, internet recruiting resources, cold calls, and team member referrals
* Recruit and perform talent acquisition activities such as resume reviews & phone screens, conducting & arranging candidate interviews and providing recommendations on the selection of applicants to hiring managers
* Utilize online and offline resources to increase our pipeline of qualified Registered Behavior Technicians (BTs and RBTs) and Board Certified Behavior Analysts (BCBAs) candidates
* Review, analyze and deliver appropriate reports, metrics and updates to business leaders on recruitment initiatives, including metrics on DEI and hiring results.
* Oversee the talent acquisition team, to include the overall daily workflow of the department
* Ensure compliance with federal, state, and local employment laws and regulations, and company policies

**Job Requirements:**

* Bachelor’s degree
* 5+ years recruitment experience, preferably in ABA therapy or healthcare
* 2+ year of management experience, including development of processes and recruitment initiatives
* Exceptional relationship management and interpersonal skills
* Proven direct sourcing experience, including excellent research skills that result in the creation of unique talent pools of qualified candidates
* Demonstrated ability to create, execute and measure multiple sourcing strategies
* Strong external network of recruitment contacts to leverage best practices a plus
* Ability to think strategically, independently and creatively, and take ownership of critical issues.
* Excellent project management and organizational skills with a strong attention to detail. Proven ability to manage time, priorities and projects
* Proficiency with the MS Office / Google G-suite including in-depth knowledge of Word and Excel with the ability to pick up new systems and software easily
* Experience developing a system to track and engage with candidates with or without an ATS

**Salary/ Benefits/ Additional Information:**

* $80,000.00 - $110,000.00 per year
* Medical/Dental/Vision
* Life Insurance
* PTO accrued on a bi-weekly basis
* Health and Wellness flex days
* Company paid holidays
* 401(k) with company contribution
* IT reimbursement
* Paid parental leave
* Working Advantage Employee Discounts

Pay: $80,000.00 - $110,000.00 per year

* Paid time off

title: Operations HR & Customer Success Coordinator
description:
**Tired of working in a soulless culture where you're underappreciated? Then don't. Join the experts on PLAY.**

**You know what we like about you?**

* You've got hustle, good instincts and a compulsive urge for organization
* You have true caring for people and a passion for bringing fun to others
* You're detail-oriented. You dot the "I"s and cross the "T"s in your work
* You believe that a team of extraordinary people, in the right culture, can change the world
* You like getting your hands dirty, tackling challenges and solving problems that help the company grow. (It also doesn't hurt that you enjoy sports.)


So why use your talents where you're not appreciated or where the company cares more about the bottom line than the customer? Meanwhile, we're out here bringing people together, organizing sports leagues and fun team building events for individuals, groups and companies that want to bring their employees together.


At ZogLife, we believe life is better with real personal connections, caring communities and a sense of play. With that as our guiding light, we've built ZogSports, the nation's leading adult recreational sports company, serving six markets and tens of thousands of players every year. And now, we're looking for a **full-time Operations HR & Customer Success Coordinator** to join the ZogSports team to help us grow our leagues nationwide.

**What's the role?**


ZogSports is America's most popular adult social sports community, with operations in New York, New Jersey, DC, Los Angeles, San Francisco and San Jose. As many people return to the office or as our customers look for reasons to leave their apartments, ZogSports leagues have been relaunching at a fast pace in all of our markets. To support the growth and scaling of the business, we are hiring an **Operations HR & Customer Success Coordinator** to report to our Vice President & ZogSports General Manager.


The **Operations HR & Customer Success Coordinator** will have the ability to learn and grow in a fast-paced environment and work with a dynamic team. You will be well-supported, much appreciated, and an integrated team member from day one.


**What you'll be doing:**

* ***Field Team Hiring***- Source, hire, onboard and train field team, working directly with human resources and legal teams.
* ***Training Curriculum C******reation*** - Create a new training curriculum for field team including sports-specific and other skill training
* ***Field Team Training & Development*** - Implement the new training curriculum through a series of in-person and online trainings, which may be individual or in groups
* ***Field Team Management*** - Work closely with Field Team members, especially the Field Manager staff to focus on customer satisfaction and quality of product through ongoing training
* ***Operations*** - Work with field team and operations staff to organize equipment and logistics for league play
* ***Customer Service*** - Support customer service team with answering emails and tickets and occasionally interacting with customers to reach resolution as needed

**What else is important?**

* Ability to work from home with a typical M-F 10am-6pm schedule and occasional work from shared workspace with other team members. Also, frequent on-site visits including evenings and/or weekends

**Requirements, Skills, Knowledge and Experience**

* BA or BS degree or a minimum of 2 years of relevant work experience
* Experience with hiring and onboarding at significant volume
* Experience with indirect and/or direct people management
* Excellent organization skills and attention to detail
* Excellent written and verbal communication skills
* Excellent interpersonal and customer service skills
* Ability to function efficiently in fast-paced environment
* Creative and effective problem-solving skills
* Confidence to make decisions of importance
* Exercise sound judgment
* Ability to handle multiple projects at one time and work both independently as well as within a team
* Comfortable with technology, especially Microsoft Office Suite (mainly Excel, Outlook and Word) and videoconferencing platforms (e.g., Zoom)
* Live within commuting distance of New York City

**How you will grow and learn:**


Running a business * - Learn about operating profit and making decisions in order to scale the business
* Managing people - Learn how to interview and hire A-level players, be a coach, ask great questions and give objective feedback.
Taking risks * - Learn to take calculated risks without a fear of failure

**Why should you apply to ZogLife?**

* **We care about our employees.** ZogSports makes Crain's *Best Places To Work* list for a reason. Caring is a ZogSports core value and as a result every ZogLife full-time employee currently receives:
	+ Medical insurance coverage (with possible contribution from the employee; coverage starts on 1st day of employment)
	+ Participation rights (as dictated by the plan) in ZogLife retirement plan during employment with employer profit-share contribution
	+ Unlimited Paid Time Off
	+ Paid holidays when the office is closed (11 in calendar year 2023)
	+ 2-week winter break when the office is closed
	+ Early Fridays (office closes at 2pm)
	+ Work from home stipend
	+ Learning stipend
	+ Paid parental leave
	+ Free play in ZogSports leagues

*Please note: These benefits are subject to change at any time.*

* Our culture is fun, energetic, and encourages you to be yourself and explore your potential
* This is a great gig where you'll have a ton of responsibility, flex your creativity, grow your sales and business skillsets, and have fun coming to work every day

**ZogLife Core Values:**


We expect all team members to internalize and adhere to our core values of:

**Fun:** We facilitate other people's fun and have fun making it happen

**Team Player:** Through the spirit of camaraderie, we share ideas, efforts and resources to accomplish our goals

**Caring:** We care about the company, each other and the work we do. We care about our customers, their experience and the communities in which we play

**Reliable:** We do what we say, meet our commitments and provide a consistent customer experience with relentless organization

**Own It:** We take ownership and do whatever it takes. We are go-getters who identify and creatively solve problems

**Continuous Improvement:** We are committed to getting better every day in everything we do as individuals and as a company

 **TO APPLY:**

**Please include your resume** **and** **cover letter with your application**

* Compensation for this job an annual salary of $60,000 - $65,000
* Due to the great number of resumes we receive daily, we regret that we are unable to respond individually to each person interested in our company, or answer inquiries regarding the status of a particular resume. If there is interest in interviewing you, a representative from ZogSports will contact you in the near future. Thank you for submitting your resume to ZogSports.


ZogSports is an Equal Opportunity Employer

 **More About ZogLife**


ZogLife is a family of brands including ZogSports and ZogCulture that all believe in the same WHY:

 **We believe that life is better with real personal connections, caring communities and a sense of play.**

 **We're about community**. ZogLife organizes recreational sports leagues and corporate programming to bring our WHY to participants throughout the U.S. Charity is an integral part of ZogSports' leagues, and we've donated over $3.4MM to charities selected by winning teams.

title: HR Generalist
description:
\\*\\* This role is open to remote employees in select US states: Colorado, Utah, Texas, Missouri, Michigan, and Georgia.

**About AVL Growth Partners**


AVL Growth Partners is a fractional services firm supporting rapidly growing small and medium-sized enterprises. We step in as our clients’ dedicated team of experts to provide the right level of support while they grow and scale with our expert guidance. While our services originated in Finance and Accounting, we have recently branched beyond that niche and now offer clients expert HR services. This role will work fractionally with clients, specifically in a Human Resources capacity.

 **Position Overview**


As a Human Resources Generalist, you will play a pivotal role in supporting the overall HR function of our client’s organization. You will work closely with our clients’ employees and leadership as well as AVL HR leaders to provide guidance and support on various HR-related matters, fostering a positive work environment and ensuring compliance with company policies and applicable labor laws. Your responsibilities will be guided by senior AVL HR leaders and could encompass compliance, employee relations, performance management, benefits administration, and other HR-related tasks.

 **Key Responsibilities**

**Onboarding:**+ Assist in facilitating the onboarding process for new employees, ensuring a smooth integration into the company.
**Employee Relations:**+ Act as a point of contact for employees, addressing and providing direction on their inquiries, concerns, and HR-related matters.
+ Mediate and resolve level one employee conflicts and grievances, fostering a positive work environment.
+ Monitor and promote employee morale and engagement, suggesting initiatives for improvement.
**Performance Management:**+ Assist in the implementation and management of performance appraisal processes.
+ Collaborate with client management and AVL HR leaders to provide guidance on performance improvement plans and employee development strategies.
**Payroll & Benefits Administration:**+ Oversee and administer employee benefits programs, including health insurance, retirement plans, and other company offerings.
+ Educate employees on available benefits and support them in resolving benefits-related issues.
**Compliance and Policy Adherence:**+ Ensure compliance with relevant labor laws and regulations, updating policies and documents as needed.
+ Assist in maintaining HR policies and procedures, ensuring their effective implementation.
**Training and Development:**+ Identify potential client training needs within the client organization and work with AVL HR leaders to develop plans to address identified gaps. coordinate employee development programs.
+ Assist and coordinate delivery of HR-related training sessions for employees and management.
**HR Reporting and Data Management:**+ Maintain accurate HR records and employee databases.
+ Generate HR reports and analytics to support decision-making processes.
**HR Projects and Initiatives:**+ Participate in HR-related projects, such as employee engagement surveys, talent acquisition strategies, and diversity and inclusion initiatives.

 **Requirements & Qualifications**

* Bachelor's degree in Human Resources, Business Administration, or a related field (or equivalent work experience).
* 4+ years of proven experience as an HR Generalist or similar role, with a comprehensive understanding of HR best practices and employment laws.
* PHR certification highly preferred
* Strong interpersonal and communication skills, with the ability to build relationships and effectively communicate with diverse audiences.
* Problem-solving and conflict-resolution skills, coupled with high empathy and professionalism.
* Detail-oriented and highly organized, capable of managing multiple tasks simultaneously.
* Proficiency in various HRIS (Human Resources Information Systems) and applications.
* Knowledge of HR metrics and reporting.
* Familiarity with recruitment processes, onboarding procedures, and performance management techniques.

**Traits that support being successful in our environment**

* Quickly being able to migrate from one task to another efficiently and effectively.
* Strong proactive communication skills with a variety of stakeholders.
* Ability to effectively manage time with tasks, due dates, and expectations.
* Self-starter with the ability to work independently without issue
* Agile in the way work is completed to meet competing client needs
* Ability to understand your audience and adjust accordingly

**Compensation**

* Compensation for this position is based on experience and technical proficiency.
* AVL offers optionality with the number of hours worked weekly (Looking for desired hours between 10-20 hours/week to start)
* The hourly base pay rate is between $35-$45 per hour


The HR Generalist role is essential in ensuring a smooth and efficient HR operation within the organization. As a team player passionate about employee well-being and development, you will contribute significantly to maintaining a productive and engaging work environment for all employees.

  




yqIovOPOOK

title: Talent Acquisition Partner
description:
**Now Hiring! Talent Acquisition Partner**
------------------------------------------

  

Research Triangle Park, NC (Remote)


Pay Range: $83,200 - $114,000

 **The world needs creative solutions. We need YOU!**

 **Where the chemistry happens…**


As a Talent Acquisition Partner, you will be responsible for consultative recruitment of outstanding talent. You will partner with site leadership and hiring managers to understand their business and talent needs in order to ensure the highest quality candidates are presented in the most time effective manner. You will collaborate across sourcing, candidate care and diversity strategy, leveraging critical thinking and influencing skills to resolve complex and challenging situations.

**As a Talent Acquisition Partner, You Create Chemistry By...**
---------------------------------------------------------------

* Developing and executing a staffing strategy for assigned businesses focused on creative sourcing methods to identify high-potential, diverse talent.
* Proactively identifing and developing solutions to talent pipeline challenges and partner with talent attraction, candidate care, and diversity strategy resources as needed.
* Being responsible for building and implementing creative sourcing partnerships with external solution providers.
* Being responsible for leading regional strategic projects to provide sustainable Talent Acquisition solutions.
* Anticipating changing needs of hiring managers and the businesses he/she supports and adjusts strategy accordingly.
* Being adept at building and maintaining a strong internal network with key stakeholders.
* Effectively balancing process excellence and strategic effectiveness.
* Being accountable for performance targets (i.e. conversion ratio, recruiting effectiveness, hiring manager and candidate satisfaction).
* Enabling optimization of hiring decisions in the context of the broader talent strategy.
* Challenging and educating hiring managers on talent assessment, business/talent risks of hiring certain candidates, and talent assumptions.
**If you have...**
------------------

* Comprehensive behavioral based interviewing and candidate assessment skills.
* Demonstrated experience building relationships, consulting and influencing hiring managers in regard to candidate sourcing and selection, market demographics, and broadening search parameters to improve quality of talent pool.
* Experience developing and executing recruitment strategies in varied regional markets, preferably in a high volume, fast paced environment, with ownership over the candidate and hiring manager experience.
* Knowledge of current networking and sourcing trends including extensive use of LinkedIn and social media channels.
* Current knowledge of state and federal employment/labor laws and practices.

title: Human Resources Associate
description:
GAMEU offers programs that teach students of many ages and all abilities how to design and build their own video-games! We are experienced video game professionals who have worked for some of the top names in the industry, such as Microsoft, Sony, EA, LucasArts, Activision, and more. We combine the fun of video games with a safe, supportive environment that encourages a lifetime of learning and explorations. **We are looking to fill Remote positions. Applications will be accepted from candidates residing in the USA.**

GameU is committed to being an equal opportunity employer. We pride ourselves on providing a workplace based on inclusion and celebrating diversity.

**Hours:** This is a full-time, remote position.

**Job Summary:**

The Human Resource Associate will be responsible for the day to day management of GameU’s HRIS System and oversee the coordination/scheduling of training activities. The Human Resource Associate will also assist in the running of the daily functions of the Human Resource (HR) department including recruitment, training, benefits, and company policies and practices.

**Essential Functions (Duties/Responsibilities):** 

* Manage employee data and records within the HRIS system.
* Generate reports and analytics using the HRIS system.
* Provide technical support, troubleshooting and guidance to HRIS users.
* Assess training needs for current staff.
* Manage roll out of appropriate training and follow up on completion.
* Distribute electronic policies and procedures to staff and follow up as needed.
* Assist with performance management.
* Source training appropriate to the organization.
* Research, implement and coordinate effective training strategies for new hire onboarding training.
* Research state compliance requirements.
* Complete all employment/unemployment forms, including reference checks.

**Knowledge, Skills, and Abilities:**

* Excellent verbal and written communication skills.
* Excellent organizational skills and attention to detail.
* Excellent time management skills with a proven ability to meet deadlines.
* Familiar with Microsoft Office/Google Suite.
* Strong analytical and problem-solving skills.
* Ability to prioritize tasks.
* Ability to act with integrity, professionalism, and confidentiality.
* Ability and openness to research and learn.
* Proficiency with or the ability to quickly learn the organization’s HRIS and talent management systems.
* Comfortable and ready to participate in meetings, attend calls, and engage on camera while maintaining a professional appearance.
* Other duties as assigned.

**Education/ Experience:** 

* Bachelor’s degree in Human Resources, Business Administration, or related field required.
* Minimum three years of prior Human Resources experience required.
* Administrative Experience with ADP's WorkForce Now platform.

**Physical Requirements:**

* Prolonged periods of sitting at a desk and working on a computer.

**Compensation:**

Compensation for roles at GameU vary depending on a wide array of factors including, but not limited to, location, role, skill set, and level of experience. As required by applicable law, GameU provides the following reasonable range of compensation for this role: $52,000 - $60,000 per year. In addition, GameU provides a range of benefits for this role. Compensation will always be compliant with the wage requirements in the state of employment.

**California Residents-** For information about how we use your personal information, including information submitted for career opportunities, please review our Privacy Notice at https://game-u.com/california-applicant-privacy-notice.

title: HR Support Center Representative (Remote)
description:

The HR Support Center Rep 1 will resolve inquiries from employees, managers, retirees, and other customers and external parties. This person will strive to meet all expected service levels and business performance goals, performing a range of services and fully documenting all cases in the case management system.

title: HR Manager
description:
**Job Description**
===================


**HR Manager**


**Strategic Resources, Inc. (SRI)** is an international, ISO 9001:2015 Certified, CMMI Maturity Level 3 Rated full-service provider with more than 34 years' experience in the Federal, Military, and Commercial Marketplaces. SRI is seeking an experienced Full-time Proposal Manager.



**Overview:**



We are looking for an HR Manager to oversee all aspects of human resources practices and processes. The HR Manager is the go-to person for all employee-related issues. HR Manager duties will involve managing activities such as job design, recruitment, employee relations, performance management, training & development and talent management. Promoting corporate values and shaping a positive culture is a vital aspect of a complete HR Manager job description and specification.





**Responsibilities:**


* Develop and implement HR strategies and initiatives aligned with the overall business strategy.
* Bridge management and employee relations by addressing demands, grievances, or other issues.
* Manage the recruitment and selection process.
* Support current and future business needs through the development, engagement, motivation, and preservation of human capital.
* Develop and monitor overall HR strategies, systems, tactics, and procedures across the organization.
* Nurture a positive working environment.
* Oversee and manage a performance appraisal system that drives high performance.
* Maintain pay plan and benefits program.

Assess training needs to* and monitor training programs.
* Report to management and provide decision support through HR metrics.
* Ensure legal compliance throughout human resource management.

  

**Requirements and skills:**

* Proven working experience as HR Manager or another HR Executive.
* People oriented and results driven.
* Demonstrable experience with Human Resources metrics.
* Knowledge of HR systems and databases.
* Ability to architect strategy along with leadership skills.
* Excellent active listening, negotiation, and presentation skills
* Competence to build and effectively manage interpersonal relationships at all levels of the company.
* In-depth knowledge of labor law and HR best practices
* Degree in Human Resources or related field.

  

**Minimum Required Skills, Education, Experience & Abilities:**


* A bachelor’s degree in human resources, labor relations, organizational development, business, or related area; relevant work experience may be a substitute.
* Effective verbal and written communication skills.
* Demonstrated proficiency in the Microsoft Office suite.
* Experience with the human resources information system (HRIS) used by your company. Examples such as Workday, Cloud HR, Smart Recruiters, and others.

Knowledge of a broad range of human resource strategies and practices, including compensation, performance management, safety, hiring and employee relations; able to* these strategies and practices in compliance with employment regulations.
* Ability to create a culture of diversity, inclusivity, collaboration, and teamwork.
* Experience with analyzing data to guide strategic employment planning.

===========

Remote

title: Recruiting Analytics Operations Manager
description:
Remote, United States
Talent and Recruiting
About Netflix:
Netflix is one of the world's leading entertainment services with over 260 million paid memberships in over 190 countries enjoying TV series, films and games across a wide variety of genres and languages. Members can play, pause and resume watching as much as they want, anytime, anywhere, and can change their plans at any time.  

About the role:
At Netflix's Talent Acquisition Operations (TA Ops) Enablement team, our mission is to drive operational excellence and value generation by empowering our teams with robust, scalable and innovative infrastructure and solutions.  

We're in search of a dedicated Operations Manager to lead the Operational Data Solutions (ODS) program. ODS is a strategic pillar within Enablement and is dedicated to providing our internal customers with data solutions that enable them to navigate complex operational challenges.  

Given the early stage of ODS, you will play a pivotal role in shaping the program's vision and direction. Your foundational contributions will involve establishing the ODS program infrastructure, including a product development approach, delivery methodologies and performance metrics. As the team is projected to remain streamlined (totaling three members), you’ll also be hands-on, executing requests such as data pulls, report creation, analytics, and more, catering to diverse needs from Talent Acquisition and our Ops teams.  

Beyond delivery, you will be defining and steering the ODS product strategy and overseeing the entire product lifecycle. Your expertise in data and analytics will be key in ensuring that the solutions we develop are not only technically sound but also align with the practical needs of our customers.  

You will champion agile and lean methodologies within our team. This involves promoting a mindset of iterative development, rapid prototyping, and continuous feedback. Your leadership will ensure that the team remains flexible, responsive, and focused on delivering tangible value through user-centered products and services.  

In this role, your expertise in program management and agile product development, coupled with your understanding of operational data and business acumen, will be key in helping us realize the ODS mission and drive operational excellence across our teams.**Lead the strategic and programmatic operations of the ODS team**
------------------------------------------------------------------

* Build the programmatic infrastructure of ODS, including the ODS work system, work intake, product catalog, product development approach, etc.
* Develop Objectives & Key Results (OKRs) and operational metrics (e.g. Key Performance Indicators, Service Level Agreements) ensuring high-impact and efficient operations
* Develop and operationalize data governance-related policies, processes and standards to support our commitment to data quality and integrity
* Act as the primary point of contact for escalated issues within ODS, ensuring effective resolution of high-priority or complex problems
**Manage the end-to-end data solution development lifecycle**
-------------------------------------------------------------

* Lead the end-to-end management of data solution development projects, from initial concept through to deployment and user adoption.
* Lead the team through iterative solution development, focusing on building MVPs to test hypotheses and gather user feedback
* Establish and maintain agile, lean startup and user-centered development processes, ensuring efficient and effective design, development, testing, and implementation of data solutions
* Lead project and development management, including developing schedules, tracking key milestones, solution launch plans and contingencies for high-risk deliverables
**Develop and execute the ODS product strategy**
------------------------------------------------

* Formulate and execute a comprehensive product strategy for ODS data solutions and services
* Develop concise problem statements, success criteria, and Minimally Viable Product Experiments (MVPe), driving for scalable solutions while also delivering value as early as possible
* Manage and coordinate product roadmaps, ensuring alignment with organizational objectives and stakeholder feedback, and achieving measurable progress against OKRs and KPIs
**Who you are:**
----------------

* 3+ years of experience in TA Operations with a focus on data solutions including operational & performance metrics (e.g. time to fill, time to hire, quality of hire, candidate experience, cost per hire, conversion/efficiency/funnel metrics, headcount attainment, etc.) and modeling & forecasting (e.g. hiring demand forecasting, recruiting capacity modeling, interviewer capacity modeling, etc.)
* Product/Solution design methodologies (e.g. Lean Startup, Design Thinking, User-Centered Design, etc.)
* Iterative and incremental work methodologies (e.g. Agile, Kanban, Scrum, etc.)
* Data and reporting technical capabilities (e.g. SQL, Tableau, Looker, statistical methods, etc.)

Netflix provides comprehensive benefits including Health Plans, Mental Health support, a 401(k) Retirement Plan with employer match, Stock Option Program, Disability Programs, Health Savings and Flexible Spending Accounts, Family-forming benefits, and Life and Serious Injury Benefits. We also offer paid leave of absence programs. Full-time hourly employees accrue 35 days annually for paid time off to be used for vacation, holidays, and sick paid time off. Full-time salaried employees are immediately entitled to flexible time off. See more detail about our Benefits here.  

Netflix is a unique culture and environment. Learn more here. *We are an equal opportunity employer and celebrate diversity, recognizing that diversity of thought and background builds stronger teams. We approach diversity and inclusion seriously and thoughtfully. We do not discriminate on the basis of race, religion, color, ancestry, national origin, caste, sex, sexual orientation, gender, gender identity or expression, age, disability, medical condition, pregnancy, genetic makeup, marital status, or military service.*

title: Talent & Benefits HR Generalist - Remote
description:
**Talent & Benefits HR Generalist** **Remote- United States**

 **WHO WE ARE**



ETR (Education, Training and Research) is a national non-profit passionate about our mission to improve health and increase opportunities for youth, families and communities. We seek to promote equity and justice through understanding and addressing the ways health and education outcomes are influenced by the complex interactions between people and their environment. As a learning organization with a focus on mission-driven impact, we value diversity and inclusion of different perspectives and ideas, collaboration and continuous learning, both within the organization and in our partnerships. We are looking for people who share our passion for health equity, social justice and learning.

  




**THE IMPACT WE ARE LOOKING TO MAKE**

We envision a world where all people have the information, skills and opportunities to lead healthy lives. With the purpose of reducing disparities and increasing equity in health and education, we uplift and support our partners to do work across the country and around the globe in advancing health equity for youth, families and communities.

  




We achieve our vision and mission by linking innovation and research to practice. We drive the science through program development, applied research and evaluation and scale innovation through capacity building and dissemination.

 **HOW YOU CAN CONTRIBUTE**



Reporting to the Talent Acquisition Specialist II, the Talent & Benefits HR Generalist performs and supports full-cycle talent acquisition, benefits administration, and other human resources functions and activities. As an integral member of the People & Culture Team, this position will also be responsible for using best practices for the department and team to function effectively and efficiently. Responsibilities are carried out in a manner consistent with ETR’s mission, vision, values, and cultural norms. Key to this role is the ability to be flexible and strategically prioritize work based on team capacity and needs. Discretion in the use of confidential information is required at all times. T**his position works remotely and can be located anywhere in the United States.**

 **CULTURAL ATTRIBUTES**


* You possess excellent communication and relationship-building skills with colleagues, partners and clients with utmost integrity, courtesy and diplomacy.
* You are capable of embracing the ideas of others and seek to understand others’ points of view to further our shared mission and vision.
* You enjoy working independently as well as collaboratively to meet goals and deadlines. You are capable of using technology to effectively and professionally communicate with co-located and remote colleagues.
* You are self-motivated and capable of strategically prioritizing multiple tasks in a fast-moving environment.

You embrace a spirit of learning and curiosity in your work and proactively seek out answers and solutions to questions and challenges that arise.  
* 

  

**WHAT YOU’LL NEED TO BE SUCCESSFUL**


* Solid experience in **full-cycle talent acquisition/recruitment** with emphasis on identifying, engaging, and delivering a diverse and qualified candidate pool from marginalized and underrepresented communities and groups.
* Ability to engage talent and manage their experience and expectations throughout the hiring process.
* Ability to successfully advise and partner with hiring managers to ensure diverse, inclusive, and equitable hiring practices.
* Ability to track and update talent-related metrics to evaluate effectiveness and for inclusion into ETR’s Affirmative Action plan.
* Human Resources experience with emphasis on benefits administration.
* Demonstrated experience with organizing systems to address inefficiencies and redundancies.
* Familiarity with laws, regulations, and best practices applicable to recruitment and Human Resources.
* Highly proficient in Office 365 Suite (Teams, Planner, Outlook, Word, Excel and PowerPoint), Adobe Acrobat Pro; and working knowledge of ATS and HRIS.
* High level of skill, sensitivity and empathy concerning matters of diversity, inclusivity and
* Excellent written and verbal communication and interpersonal
* Excellent organizational and quantitative skills combined with attention to detail, accuracy, and the ability to complete assignments timely and independently.
* Demonstrates initiative and stays current in relevant fields.
* Ability to prioritize, multi-task, and remain
* Ability to meet short deadlines; willingness to work additional hours during peak and deadline
* Highly professional and developed people skills; ability to work with diverse groups of
* Ability to maintain confidentiality and use discretion in all
* Ability to travel as
* The use of a personal vehicle or rental car for ETR business will require a valid driver’s license and proof of auto insurance.


**Preferred:**


* Experience with ADP and BambooHR a plus.
* Participation in seminars and workshops around diversity in the workplace or relevant
* A tech-forward approach to operations and problem-solving with the ability to easily assess and acquire new technology skills and effectively integrate them with existing and new processes.

 **Location:** Remote – **United States.**

 **Starting Pay Range**: $76,200-$93,100 annually. The typical hiring range for this position is **$76,200 to $84,700** at 100% FTE. The starting salary is determined based on the candidate’s knowledge, skills, and experience.  



  

**WORKING AT ETR**



ETR employees enjoy a competitive salary, amazing 401(K) and health benefits as well as generous PTO and holiday pay. You will contribute to making a difference in the world!

  

  



For more detailed information about this position and ETR, please visit our website:

  



www.etr.org

  


**To apply for this position, please submit your resume and cover letter to:**

  




https://www.etr.org/about-us/careers/

 **ETR is proud to be an Equal Opportunity Employer**


**EEO and AA Employer/VET/Disabled**



ETR is an equal opportunity employer and supports a vision where all staff – *regardless of* *race,* *ethnicity, sexual orientation, gender* *identity,* *age, socioeconomic* *background, or* *religious affiliation –* feel there is space for a diversity of experiences to be represented, respected and valued.

title: HR Business Partner
description:
Headway’s mission is a big one - to build a new mental health care system everyone can access. We’ve built technology that helps people find great therapists with the first software-enabled national network of providers accepting insurance.



1 in 4 people in the US have a treatable mental health condition, but the majority of providers don’t accept insurance, making therapy too expensive for most people. Headway is building a new mental healthcare system that everyone can access by making it easy for therapists to take insurance and scale their practice.



Headway was founded in 2019 – since then, we’ve grown into a diverse, national network of over 25,000 mental healthcare providers across all 50 states who run their practice on our software. We’re a Series C company with over $225m in funding from a16z (Andreessen Horowitz), Accel, GV (formerly Google Ventures), Spark Capital, Thrive Capital, and Health Care Service Corporation.



We want your time here to be the most meaningful experience of your career. **Join us, and help change mental healthcare for the better.**


**About The Role**



Joining as the next HRBP at Headway supporting the Sales (Growth) teams, you will advise on all things People related: performance management, talent development, coaching, employee relations, and organizational design. You’ll use both qualitative and quantitative data to identify trends to inform innovative program design, ensuring employees are engaged and growing. In your work, you will uphold our values and amplify the success of our business and products through our most important asset: our people.


**You Will:**


* Drive People team relationships and processes for the Sales organizations including performance management, talent development, leadership coaching, employee relations and organizational design.
* Own select company-wide policies, processes or initiatives as we continue to grow, modernize and scale.
* Leverage qualitative and quantitative data to perform root cause analysis, identify trends, tell a story, influence and inform innovative ways to build programs, ensuring Headwegians are engaged and growing.
* Uphold our values and amplify the success of our business and products through our most important asset: our people.


**You’d be a great fit if:**


* You possess six or more years experience as a strategic HR Business Partner.
* You must have experience with Sales client groups.
* You have excellent judgment and problem-solving capabilities; as well as the ability to make thoughtful decisions.
* You are intellectually curious about people and organizational issues; you have a creative, solutions-based mindset that translates into high impact deliverables, all grounded in strong project and change management.
* You are analytically driven; you utilize qualitative and quantitative approaches to problem solving and root cause analysis.
* You possess experience driving key people, programs and processes (performance management cycles, calibration facilitation, compensation planning, executive coaching, employee relations/conflict resolution, organizational design, etc.).
* You have the ability to flex your style and build trust and rapport with Executives as well as ICs
* You are agile, fearless, and able to adapt to shifting priorities.
* You effectively partner with cross-functional partners (e.g. Finance, Legal) and the broader People team to build a better employee experience for employees.
* Your attitude is "we / not I".


**Compensation and Benefits:**


* Salary information is based on a single salary target per role and is differentiated based on geographic location (Group A, B, or C)
	+ Group A: $160,000
	+ Group B: $144,000
	+ Group C: $128,000
		- Examples of cities located in each Compensation Grouping:
			* Group A = NYC/Tri-State Area, SF/Bay Area, LA Area, Seattle, Boston, Austin, and San Diego
			* Group B = Chicago, Miami, Denver, Washington DC, Philadelphia, Atlanta, Minneapolis, Nashville, Sacramento, Phoenix, and Portland
			* Group C = All remaining cities
* Benefits offered include:
+ Medical, Dental, and Vision coverage
+ HSA / FSA
+ 401K
+ Work-from-Home Stipend
+ Therapy Reimbursement
+ 16-week parental leave for eligible employees
+ Carrot Fertility annual reimbursement and membership
+ 13 paid holidays each year as well as a Holiday Break during the week between December 25th and December 31st
+ Unlimited PTO
+ Employee Assistance Program (EAP)
+ Training and professional development

We believe a team's strength is in its people, and we cannot achieve this mission without a team that reflects the diversity of this problem - across race, ethnicity, gender, sexuality, age, national origin, religion, family status, disability, military status, and experience.



Headway is committed to the full inclusion of all qualified individuals. As part of this commitment, Headway will ensure that persons with disabilities are provided with reasonable accommodations. If reasonable accommodation is needed to participate in the job application or interview process, to perform essential job functions, and/or receive other benefits and privileges of employment, please contact talent@findheadway.com



Headway employees work remotely across the US, with the option to work from offices in New York City and San Francisco. Headway participates in E-Verify. To learn more, click here.

title: HR Manager, Talent and Training
description:
**APPLICATION GUIDELINES**


Applications will be reviewed on a rolling basis and must be received by March 13. Applications received after the deadline may be reviewed dependent upon qualifications. ***This is a U.S. based position.***

**JOB OVERVIEW**


The HR Manager for Talent and Training is a key member of the HR team and will be responsible for the recruiting and of top talent as well as developing and executing a top tier inclusive internal training program. The HR Manager is both a client facing and internal facing role that must deliver excellent customer service.  

  

The HR Manager will shepherd a seamless and streamlined hiring process, execute a mission aligned onboardings, and develop a values driven internal training program for all ACF employees. This includes developing diverse hiring pipelines, building and maintaining equitable hiring processes, ensuring a smooth onboarding process for new employees, and spearheading the development and execution of a robust training and development program. The training program will include HR basics such as time management, performance management, and workplace sensitivity, along with trainings focused on staff development. The HR Manager should bring a deep dedication to and understanding of DEI.

 **Responsibilities**

**Recruiting and Onboarding:**

* Oversee and execute the full staff onboarding process from development of job descriptions, to recruiting, interviewing, hiring, and onboarding. Including developing an onboarding program for staff based outside of the US with a keen focus on cross-cultural considerations and equity.
* Manage and monitor all open positions including the management of external recruitment firms and coordination of website postings.
* Responsible for development of hiring process including hiring timelines, interview questions, scheduling interviews, coordinating interview panels, making offers and conducting reference checks.
* Coordinate with hiring supervisors on interviewing and screening potential candidates including making recommendations for the best fit candidate for the job.
* Manage and enhance the applicant tracking system, including building out reporting metrics.
* Ensure hiring policies, processes and materials adhere to internal guidelines and best practices.
* Interface with internal and external stakeholders to develop and execute hiring plans.
* Coordinate with Fund Managers for all aspects of hiring including Fund manager onboarding into the ACF hiring program, training fund managers on process, procedures, and hiring best practices.
* Manage the onboarding process for all employees through the first 90 days. This will include preparing an onboarding schedule and presentations that are unified and consistent with the department and organization's needs.
* Work with other members of the human resource department to align required administration training and monitor its timeline for completion.
* Track and report Diversity, Equity, and Inclusive data using specific metrics.
* Process and monitor all reference and background checks for all qualifying candidates.
* Continually seek to improve recruiting pipelines to align with ACF values and goals.
* Develop hiring metrics for internal leadership team and board.

**Training and Development:*** Responsible for the overall success and development of the internal training and professional development program at ACF.
* Responsible for creating and executing yearly training plans for Fund and Core employees.
* Create, execute, and maintain ongoing staff training for Fund and Core employees including onboarding and compensation training, performance management, workplace harassment, supervisor training, etc.
* Responsible for the yearly staff performance management process for Fund and Core employees.
* Collaborate with ACF leaders and manager to identify training needs and gaps in skills and knowledge and design inclusive and equitable training materials, presentation, videos, and other instructional materials.
* Develop and implement strategies to foster a culture of continuous learning and growth. Work closely with employees and supervisors to create development plans and provide guidance on career paths.
* Evaluate the effectiveness of training programs and make necessary changes to improve outcomes, including developing post-training surveys to garner feedback.
* Facilitate knowledge sharing initiatives within ACF.
* Continuously improve upon and develop new training materials as necessary.

**Qualifications:*** 5+ years of human resources experience with a focus in recruiting and training.
* Ability to synthesize information into multiple formats for different audiences.
* Strong communications skills across multiple mediums.
* Dedication to excellent customer service.
* Knowledge of and proven implementation experience with DEI programs & practices.
* Organized self-starter with detailed-oriented planning and presentation skills.
* Excellent interpersonal skills with the ability to communicate positively.
* Ability to manage priorities and meet deadlines.
* Ability to work in multiple systems and adapt through system changes.
* Experience implementing and acting as the administrator for the ATS.
* Experience with Deel, JazzHR, and Monday.com preferred.
* **ACF VALUES & ENVIRONMENT**


The work of our team is centered on the core values of Amalgamated Foundation: Collaboration, Accountability, People First and Impact. We share a commitment to curiosity, growth and respect and are a lean team of doers and problem solvers. We are proud of our work in supporting the collective effort to make the world a more equitable and kinder place.
* Curious, flexible, committed and willing to learn and grow as part of a small, collaborative team.
* Joyful approach to working in a start-up environment.

**Salary & Benefits**  

The starting salary for this role is $100,000 - $125,000 and will be commensurate with experience. This position will be remotely based with domestic travel, as needed, including our bi-annual retreats. Generous benefits package that includes 100% employer-paid health insurance (medical, dental, and vision), 401k match, PTO and leave policies and remote work stipend.
