* Send detailed mass email reminders to contractors/subcontractors.
* Perform administrative and other tasks as needed yearly updates/ prepare for client audits and on-site audits for contractors and subcontractors.
* Provide reliable home internet and consistent professional work environment conducive to production, learning, and interaction with clients and colleagues.


**Physical Working Conditions (ADA):**  

The physical demands and work environment characteristics described here are representative of those that must be met by an employee to successfully perform the essential functions of this job. Reasonable accommodations may be made to enable individuals with disabilities to perform the essential functions.
  
  

**Physical demands:** While performing the duties of this job the employee is regularly required to talk, hear, walk, sit, stand, use hands to finger, handle, or feel objects, tools, or controls; reach with hands and arms.
  
  

WORK SCHEDULE - M - F- 8:30 a.m. - 5:00 p.m. EST
  
  

EOE/M/F/Vet/Disability
  
  

* Please Note: Your Actual Pay-Rate within the Pay Range will vary based on: Geography, Skill-Set and applicable Local and State Pay Practices. Any questions, please contact our DISA Recruiting Team at Recruitment.Recruitment@disa.com.

title: Onboarding Manager, Full-Time
description:
Position is remote. 100% tele-health


#### **Who we are:**


#### **Bend Health is revolutionizing the treatment of mental health conditions for kids and teens. Our innovative technology achieves better outcomes and leads to happier, healthier lives while ensuring stigma, costs, and logistics are no longer barriers. Come and be part of a fun, collaborative, supportive, motivated, and data-driven team creating the first scalable and integrated model in mental healthcare for kids and teens. Help shape the future of pediatric mental health and bend the healthcare system to work better for everyone.**


#### **Today's world can be intense and stressful, and it's taking an unprecedented toll on kids, teens, and families. Bend Health's collaborative care model relies on therapy to help families manage the ups and downs of everyday life. These challenges could involve managing emotions, challenging negative thinking, and reducing stress and anxiety.**


#### **We are looking for a full-time, Care Team Onboarding Manager passionate about whole-person, whole-family mental health care to join our care team. This is a unique position that reports to the Director, Head of Clinical Operations but will work cross-functionally with the team across Bend.**


#### **What you'll do:**


* Work collaboratively with practitioners to design and develop an onboarding program that engages and prepares team members to practice according to the Bend program
* Manage and organize the training calendar, including arranging product and company demos and presentations
* Assess the practitioners' onboarding process and develop a program to monitor the progress and competency of the individual practitioners using a metrics-based approach.
* Assess the learning needs of the care team and work collaboratively with Quality and the Program Development teams to determine additional training that could improve care.
* Work collaboratively across the organization to ensure new team members are woven into the Bend culture.
* Ensure new hires have the necessary company manuals and guidelines provided by HR.
* Ensure new hires have the necessary technical assistance to set up their hardware and software.
* Help assimilate new staff into the company workforce.
* Other duties as assigned


**Who you are:**


* Ability to work autonomously as well as with a team
* Proficient in using professional technology tools such as Google Suite, and experience with Learning Management System (LMS) preferred
* Tech-savvy and experienced in care management
* Ability to work collaboratively with a growth mindset
* Strong organizational skills and excitement about a dynamic work environment
* Warm and engaging interaction style
* Passionate about helping kids and teens achieve goals
* Love to help others and desire to make a difference
* Possess sensitivity, emotional intelligence, and empathy
* Strong communication skills, including active listening in a virtual setting
* Comfortable with ambiguity while encompassing flexibility and adaptability within a fast-paced start-up environment


 **Preferred Education and Training:**


* Experience training or facilitating practitioner groups
* Experience leading and managing organizational change for care team members
* Tech-savvy and comfortable practicing telehealth via video
* Experience working with pediatrics and families

  



The salary range for United States residents is $50,000 - $70,000 per year + Bonus. Pay is based on several factors, including but not limited to education, work experience, certifications, etc. In addition to your salary, Bend Health offers a comprehensive benefits package, incentive and recognition programs, equity, and 401k contribution (all benefits are subject to eligibility requirements). Come join us to expand access to quality mental health care for kids, teens, and families!

  


**We want to inform you regarding fraudulent postings and communications from individuals posing as Bend Health employees to job seekers. Please look at our current openings to ensure they match with third-party job hosting sites. If you are applying for a position with us, we will always take the following steps:**

  

**We will only email you from the @bendhealth.com domain.** **Our screenings and interviews will be via phone or Zoom/Google Meets Video - Never chat or instant message** **We will not send you a check until you are actively employed.** **We will never ask you for personal payment or require you to purchase equipment**


**We are here to help if you have any questions or concerns about a job posting. Please reach out directly to** **hiring@bendhealth.com** **for inquiries. Thank you again for your interest and we look forward to connecting with you!**

  



At Bend Health, we believe that our diverse perspectives are our biggest strengths - and that embracing them will create real change in healthcare. As an equal-opportunity employer, we are committed to building an inclusive environment where you can be you.

title: Director, HR Systems (Remote)
description:
#WeAreCrowdStrike and our mission is to stop breaches. As a global leader in cybersecurity, our team changed the game. Since our inception, our market leading cloud-native platform has offered unparalleled protection against the most sophisticated cyberattacks. We’re looking for people with limitless passion, a relentless focus on innovation and a fanatical commitment to the customer to join us in shaping the future of cybersecurity. Consistently recognized as a top workplace, CrowdStrike is committed to cultivating an inclusive, remote-first culture that offers people the autonomy and flexibility to balance the needs of work and life while taking their career to the next level. Interested in working for a company that sets the standard and leads with integrity? Join us on a mission that matters - one team, one fight.
About the Role:
As CrowdStrike’s head of HR Systems, you will grow an organization designed to create the infrastructure and systems that enable operations teams to scale and achieve process excellence. Success will require partnering with key stakeholders to ensure our systems and practices support CrowdStrike’s overall Business Strategy. You will be responsible for achieving the required functionality, ease of execution and scalability across all HR Systems.
What You'll Do:* Oversee day-to-day operations and strategic direction of Workday and other HR System and integrations to support HR program deliverables and create the digital roadmap and governance structure for future configurations, products and upgrades.
* Direct and lead process solution design configuration, maintenance and data architecture of HR Systems and lead on integration as needed,
* Partner, collaborate and develop strong relationships with HR leaders to understand business needs in support of the digital strategy, corporate objectives, and major functional objectives
* Partner with the data analytics team in developing and maintaining HR analytics that will improve decision making relating to organizational health ie workforce planning, talent acquisition, attrition, training, compensation and benefits, diversity etc.
* Govern HR data and conduct regular auditing of HR data to ensure data accuracy and integrity.
* Perform gap assessments, formulate investment proposals, and partner with the GPMO organization to develop roadmaps that optimally reflect corporate priorities and balancing of resources
* Lead and facilitate complex large scale, cross-functional HR business projects involving systems and/or business processes to obtain business goals and operational objectives.


What You'll Need:* Bachelor’s degree in related field; MBA or similar certification is a plus
* 10+ years global HRIS experience, with deep expertise in Workday, with a combination of HR data, technology, integrations, and project management experience
* Experience in change management and influencing across complex areas such as process design, tradeoffs in systems, scaling programs through company life stages, etc
* Proven track record of influencing, leading and facilitating initiatives with multiple senior stakeholders
* Growth mindset, sense of curiosity and strong problem-solving skills. Strong attention to detail, organization, and the highest standards for accuracy and precision
* Collaborative, process-oriented and organized approach to daily tasks in a dynamic and multinational organization
* Experience supporting a global HR Shared Services model.
* Certified Workday professional in HCM, Recruiting, Comp, Benefits a plus.


#LI-REMOTE
#LI-MJ1
Benefits of Working at CrowdStrike:* Remote-first culture
* Market leader in compensation and equity awards
* Competitive vacation and flexible working arrangements
* Comprehensive and inclusive health benefits
* Physical and mental wellness programs
* Paid parental leave, including adoption
* A variety of professional development and mentorship opportunities
* Offices with stocked kitchens when you need to fuel innovation and collaboration


We are committed to fostering a culture of belonging where everyone feels seen, heard, valued for who they are and empowered to succeed. Our approach to cultivating a diverse, equitable, and inclusive culture is rooted in listening, learning and collective action. By embracing the diversity of our people, we achieve our best work and fuel innovation - generating the best possible outcomes for our customers and the communities they serve.
CrowdStrike is committed to maintaining an environment of Equal Opportunity and Affirmative Action. If you need reasonable accommodation to access the information provided on this website, please contact Recruiting@crowdstrike.com, for further assistance.
CrowdStrike participates in the E-Verify program.
Notice of E-Verify Participation
Right to Work
CrowdStrike, Inc. is committed to fair and equitable compensation practices. The base salary range for this position in the U.S. is $160,000 - $250,000 per year + variable/incentive compensation + equity + benefits. A candidate’s salary is determined by various factors including, but not limited to, relevant work experience, skills, certifications and location.
Expected Close Date of Job Posting is:04-15-2024

title: LN Concerts, Human Resources Coordinator
description:
Job Summary:


**WHO ARE WE?**

Live Nation Entertainment is the world’s leading live entertainment company, comprised of global market leaders: Ticketmaster, Live Nation Concerts, and Live Nation Media & Sponsorship. Ticketmaster is the global leader in event ticketing with over 500 million tickets sold annually and more than 12,000 clients worldwide. Live Nation Concerts is the largest provider of live entertainment in the world promoting more than 40,000 shows and 100+ festivals annually for nearly 4,000 artists in over 40 countries. These businesses allow Live Nation Media & Sponsorship to create strategic music marketing programs that connect over 1,000 brands with the 98 million fans that attend Live Nation Entertainment events each year. For additional information, visit www.livenationentertainment.com .


Live Nation’s Concerts Division is where tours are born, artists come to life, and fans get to experience the rush of live music. From our dozens of owned/operated Amphitheaters to our Global Touring team, from Ticketing and Venue Operations to Marketing and Sales... we foster a fun and upbeat work culture with no shortage of opportunities. With perks ranging from free concert tickets to dog-friendly offices, to progressive benefits like student loan reimbursement and adoption/fertility support... it’s no wonder we are certified as a *Great Place to Work* organization and one of People Magazine’s “50 Companies that Care”. We want everyone to feel like they belong and can thrive in our community, so we strive to help you achieve your career and personal goals. Live music is our passion and where we find our common ground. There has never been a better time to join Live Nation.


**WHO ARE YOU?**

Passionate and motivated. Driven, with an entrepreneurial spirit. Resourceful, innovative, forward thinking and committed. At Live Nation Entertainment, our people embrace these qualities, so if this sounds like you then please read on!


**THE JOB**

The Human Resources Coordinator will provide administrative support to the HR team and the nationwide Venue Management Team for the Venue Nation division within Live Nation.


**WHAT THIS ROLE WILL DO**

* Work closely with the Venue Nation HR Team and Venue Management to facilitate and coordinate an exceptional on-boarding process for part time / seasonal employees throughout the country
* Support venues nationally with creation of job requisitions and postings of those positions
* Assist with submission and review of pre-employment background screening
* Provide exceptional levels of customer service to candidates, hiring managers, business unit leaders, executives and vendors
* Support college recruiting efforts including college relations as needed
* Conduct Internet research and other projects as needed
* Support Venue Management with opening of new venues – job fairs, orientation, training, etc.
* Work with HRIS team to assist with completion of Unemployment Insurance Claims

**WHAT THIS PERSON WILL BRING**

* 2-5 years in an HR/Recruiting support role required
* Undergrad education in Administration or Human Resources or equivalent experience preferred
* Familiarity with HRIS, preferably Workday
* Must be fluent in MS Office (Word, Excel, Outlook, PowerPoint)
* Excellent communication skills
* Ability to multi-task and prioritize in a fast-paced environment
* Exceptional organization skills with the ability to effectively managed multiple projects concurrently.
* Self-motivated, resourceful, proactive, and collaborative team player.
* Frequent travel for venue on-site support.

**BENEFITS & PERKS -** Our motto is ‘Taking Care of Our Own’ through 6 pillars of benefits:


* **HEALTH:** Medical, Dental and Vision benefits for you and your family, including Flexible Spending Accounts (FSA) and Health Savings Accounts (HSAs)
* **YOURSELF:** Paid time off policy including holidays, sick time and day off for your birthday, free concert tickets
* **WEALTH:** 401(k) program with company match, Stock Program Reimbursement
* **FAMILY:** New parent programs & support including caregiver leave and baby bonus, infertility support
* **CAREER:** Tuition reimbursement, student loan repayment internal growth and development programs & trainings
* **OTHERS:** Volunteer time off, crowdfunding network

**EQUAL EMPLOYMENT OPPORTUNITY**

We are passionate and committed to our people and go beyond the rhetoric of diversity and inclusion. You will be working in an inclusive environment and be encouraged to bring your whole self to work. We will do all that we can to help you successfully balance your work and homelife. As a growing business we will encourage you to develop your professional and personal aspirations, enjoy new experiences, and learn from the talented people you will be working with. It’s talent that matters to us and we encourage applications from people irrespective of their gender, race, sexual orientation, religion, age, disability status or caring responsibilities.  



  

Live Nation strongly supports equal employment opportunity for all applicants regardless of age (40 and over), ancestry, color, religious creed (including religious dress and grooming practices), family and medical care leave or the denial of family and medical care leave, mental or physical disability (including HIV and AIDS), marital status, domestic partner status, medical condition (including cancer and genetic characteristics), genetic information, military and veteran status, political affiliation, national origin (including language use restrictions), citizenship, race, sex (including pregnancy, childbirth, breastfeeding and medical conditions related to pregnancy, childbirth or breastfeeding), gender, gender identity, and gender expression, sexual orientation, or any other basis protected by applicable federal, state or local law, rule, ordinance or regulation.


We will consider qualified applicants with criminal histories in a manner consistent with the requirements of the Los Angeles Fair Chance Ordinance, San Francisco Fair Chance Ordinance and the California Fair Chance Act and consistent with other similar and / or applicable laws in other areas.


We also afford equal employment opportunities to qualified individuals with a disability. For this reason, Live Nation will make reasonable accommodations for the known physical or mental limitations of an otherwise qualified individual with a disability who is an applicant consistent with its legal obligations to do so, including reasonable accommodations related to pregnancy in accordance with applicable local, state and / or federal law. As part of its commitment to make reasonable accommodations, Live Nation also wishes to participate in a timely, good faith, interactive process with a disabled applicant to determine effective reasonable accommodations, if any, which can be made in response to a request for accommodations. Applicants are invited to identify reasonable accommodations that can be made to assist them to perform the essential functions of the position they seek. Any applicant who requires an accommodation in order to perform the essential functions of the job should contact a Human Resources Representative to request the opportunity to participate in a timely interactive process. Live Nation will also provide reasonable religious accommodations on a case by case basis.


**HIRING PRACTICES**  

The preceding job description has been designed to indicate the general nature and level of work performed by employees within this classification. It is not designed to contain or be interpreted as a comprehensive inventory of all duties, responsibilities, and qualifications required of employees assigned to this job.


Live Nation recruitment policies are designed to place the most highly qualified persons available in a timely and efficient manner. Live Nation may pursue all avenues available, including promotion from within, employee referrals, outside advertising, employment agencies, internet recruiting, job fairs, college recruiting and search firms.


\\*\\*Please note that the compensation information provided is a good faith estimate for this position only and is provided pursuant to the Colorado Equal Pay for Equal Work Act and Equal Pay Transparency Rules. It is estimated based on what a successful Colorado applicant might be paid. It assumes that the successful candidate will be in Colorado or perform the position from Colorado. Similar positions located outside of Colorado will not necessarily receive the same compensation. Live Nation takes into consideration a candidate’s education, training, and experience, as well as the position’s work location, expected quality and quantity of work, required travel (if any), external market and internal value, including seniority and merit systems, and internal pay alignment when determining the salary level for potential new employees. In compliance with the CO EPEWA, a potential new employee’s salary history will not be used in compensation decisions.

title: HR Generalist
description:
**Position Summary**
--------------------


The Human Resources Generalist provides comprehensive management, support, coordination, and guidance in the administration of the day-to-day operations and functions of HR in the organization. The HR Generalist ensures the efficient application and delivery of company policies, procedures, and practices contributing to the successful growth & development of the company. The HR Generalist is adapted as using HR software systems and working closely with all departments of the organization.

  


**RESPONSIBILITIES:**


* Provide HR support and guidance to management and employees, explaining company policies and procedures.
* Participate in developing a company culture that emphasizes quality service, high performance, and continuous improvement.
* Maintain organization compliance with all federal, state, and local employment-related laws.
* Interpret, assist, advise, and respond to queries from managers, employees, former employees, and other parties in a timely manner.
* Advise management on HR issues, investigate HR related problems, gather documentation, make recommendations, and help resolve.
* Conduct research, investigate, gather, and organize data and statistical information.
* Manage sensitive and confidential matters, including personnel relations, organizational changes, and protecting the security of information, data, and files.
* Assist with integration of HR programs, policies, and procedures and their dissemination through meetings, presentations, and other delivery methods.
* Evaluate/recognize risks or potential liability issues and give recommendations for managing.
* Research specific state and/or local employment ordinances and regulations as required.
* Respond to federal and state agency notices and requests.
* Exercise individual judgment when dealing with issues or potential issues and escalate to managers attention in a timely manner.
* Develop and maintain comprehensive knowledge of HRIS and Timeclock systems.
* Maintain and update HR files, records, forms, and databases while ensuing accuracy and confidentiality.
* Enter information into databases and systems, compile data and prepare reports, spreadsheets, memos, and other documents.
* Perform records audits to ensure that all required employee documentation is collected and maintained properly.
* Provide guidance and training on HR related areas and systems to managers as required or needed.
* Process incoming mail and respond to voicemails and emails promptly.
* Must be thoroughly familiar with Employee Handbook and all company HR policies and procedures.
* Assist employees and managers with paid time off calculations and tracking.
* Review timecards for payroll processing.
* Assist with Workers Compensation cases, including submitting incident reports, logging, filing, pulling employee payroll data, and coordination of documents and requests from insurance provider.
* Assist with managing and tracking employee Leave, FMLA, Workers Comp, etc. and properly communicate expectations, paperwork, documentation, forms, check-ins, etc. in a timely fashion.
* Maintain detailed records related to grievances, performance reviews, and disciplinary actions.
* Assist managers with resolving employee relations issues and how to document disciplinary actions.
* Handle unemployment claim notices, requests, hearings, and appeal process.
* Assist with departmental projects.
* Assist with audits.
* Assist with recruiting when needed, including sourcing, interviewing, and updating applicant tracking system.
* General office administrative tasks: document preparation, copy, scan, fax, file, shred, prepare and mail correspondence, organize files, order supplies, etc.
* Other duties as assigned as business needs arise.


**QUALIFICATIONS:**


* Bachelors Degree in HR or related field and/or certifications preferred.
* Minimum 5+ years HR related work experience.
* Computer Knowledge/Skills: MS Office, HRIS, Time Tracking, and other HR related systems.
* Knowledge of employment laws, including Title VII, FLSA, FMLA, ADA, EEO, OSHA, ACA, ERISA, INA, COBRA, etc.
* Professional in appearance and presentation, including in virtual workspace.
* Must possess strong interpersonal skills and be able to communicate clearly, both written and verbally.
* Ability to write professional correspondence using proper grammar and spelling.
* Ability to define problems, collect data, establish facts, and draw valid conclusions.
* Must be able to effectively read and interpret information, present numerical data in a resourceful manner, and skillfully gather and analyze information.
* Must be able to follow instructions, track and follow through with tasks, and have a sense of urgency when required.
* Ability to prioritize and plan work activities to use time efficiently.
* Must be organized, accurate, thorough, and detailed-oriented.


**Equal Employment Opportunity**


Endurance is proud to be an equal-opportunity employer. We celebrate our employees' differences, including race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, national origin, age, disability, and Veteran status. Our differences are what make us better together. Endurance Warranty is an E-Verify Company.


About Endurance


Endurance Warranty has been honored with multiple Stevie Awards for being a great place to work, and we’re growing rapidly. We’re a fast-paced company offering limitless opportunities to grow your career. Thanks to our dedicated employees, we provide best-in-class auto repair coverage to customers across the country, protecting people from unexpected and costly breakdowns for almost 15 years. At Endurance, we embrace the entrepreneurial spirit, and you’ll play a role in shaping this dynamic industry. We offer great pay, amazing benefits, and the opportunity to learn and grow.


When you work for Endurance, you’re working for a company that cares about you and your future. We empower employees to lead, drive change and give back where they work and live. Our people are our greatest strength and we’re proud to work as a diverse team to serve our customers and our community.


Therefore, we’ve been honored as a top place to work, including multiple StevieⓇ Awards for the best workplace and great employer. For the last several years, Endurance has also earned a spot on Selling Power’s “50 Best Companies to Sell For,” and consistently makes industry lists from Crain’s and Inc. magazine for our continuous and significant growth. Experts in the industry recognize that our employees care as well—Consumer Affairs highly recommends Endurance and we’re highly rated by our customers on Google, Trustpilot, and other major online review sites.


Come accelerate your career with us. We’ll give you the tools you need to succeed at work, and the flexibility to enjoy life outside of your job.

title: Client HR Account Manager (Remote)
company: HRS Solutions, LLC dba Aspen HR
description:
**Our Opportunity:**


The Client HR Account Manager serves as a primary point of contact for assigned clients and is responsible for client retention and satisfaction through engagement and utilization of AspenHR products and services. This role is part of a service team delivering high touch, white glove service to clients and worksite employees. The individual serves in an HR generalist capacity working hands-on and cross functionally to ensure all AspenHR services meet and exceed client expectations.


**What You'll Do:**

* Develop strong relationships with assigned clients by serving as a trusted advisor on all aspects of Aspen service. Instill confidence and trust through timely/accurate responses and following through on commitments.
* Recommend Aspen products and services as appropriate to improve clients' business processes and support business objectives. Proactively identify needs through regular meetings and outreach.
* Serve as the clients' primary point of contact for all Aspen needs related to HR, payroll, tax, workers compensation and benefits. Respond to all inquiries within our SLAs and bring items to resolution efficiently. Work cross-functionally with subject matter experts when appropriate and provide clients regular updates on progress.
* Serve as a subject matter expert on the features and functions of our HRIS platform. Support clients in automating and streamlining processes, fully leveraging the HRIS capabilities. Train client users on functionality, assist in navigation and respond to their requests/inquiries.
* Facilitate the administration of HR transactions in the HRIS platform including new hire onboarding, status changes, leaves of absence and terminations. Coordinate with team members in Payroll and Benefits as situations dictate. Ensure compliance with federal and state laws is maintained in all processes.
* Maintain the HRIS platform for assigned clients such as job titles, department/divisions, worksite locations, client and employee user accounts and document management.
* Responsible for keeping clients informed of new products/services, operational process changes, and federal/state employment laws through monthly newsletters and routine communications.
* Partner with the Benefits team to support clients' annual benefit renewal process from presenting plan rates/options, obtaining contribution decisions and coordinating employee enrollment period.

**What You'll Bring:**

* You have a passion for service and relentless drive to exceed expectations
* You can manage multiple clients, priorities and projects without sacrificing quality and service delivery.
* You thrive in a high volume, fast-paced and dynamic environment.
* You're diligent and focused on details, particularly with communication, follow-up and documentation.
* You are tech-savvy and able to learn new programs quickly but you already have strong proficiency in Microsoft programs and a variety of HRIS platforms.

**Other Requirements:**

* Bachelor's degree, or equivalent combination of education and experience; preferably a degree in business, management/leadership, or human resources.
* Minimum five years of generalist human resources experience with knowledge of benefits, payroll and HR compliance.
* Multi-client account management experience preferred; preferably in HR or financial services industry
* PEO/ASO experience a plus

**What Aspen Brings:**

* Committed and supportive team members with a passion for client service
* Fast-growing company with opportunity to make your mark
* Fully remote environment
* Generous benefits to address mental, physical and financial health
* Flexible and generous time off


NOTE: This position is a remote/work-from-home role.


Expected salary for CA applicants is $80,000 to $100,000 depending on experience and qualifications.

title: HR and People Operations Specialist
description:
**WHO WE ARE**  

Come grow with us! If you are a passionate change agent who thrives in a collaborative, entrepreneurial and inclusive, culture committed to operational excellence, we would like to meet you.  

  

At Resonance, immediate hands-on experience alongside our clients as we work to build sustainable, positive impact. Our teams are autonomous and self-sufficient. You get to weigh in with founders and leaders on how to drive change and grow the movement while growing the company.  

  

Resonance is an award-winning, Certified B Corporation consultancy that delivers market-based solutions to address the world's toughest challenges. We enable a variety of donor, commercial, and investor clients around the world to catalyze lasting impact. Resonance seeks to catalyze large-scale social, environmental, and economic change by fostering new and dynamic forms of collaboration. We do this by fostering public-private partnerships, facilitating sustainable investment, and providing deep analytical insights in frontier markets.
**POSITION MANDATE**
As a highly visible member of the Human Resources & Talent team, you will partner with HR & Talent team colleagues to help build and execute the company’s people operations and operational excellence agenda and optimize people operations and processes across the full talent spectrum. You will be a strong operational partner to cross-functional stakeholders to enable their business capability and capacity. You can expect all the challenges and benefits of a fast-paced, entrepreneurial environment – high ambiguity, wide-open space for agile strategy and execution, and optimal opportunity to impact the company's success directly.
This is a full-time position, and hours of work and days are Monday through Friday, 8:30 a.m. to 5 p.m. ET.

**OUTCOMES / ESSENTIAL FUNCTIONS**
* Support the coordination, analyses, discussions and resolutions for various human resource and people operations conditions, strategies, plans, and procedures for all staff, including the full lifecycle of the employee experience (onboarding, hiring, development, promotion, and offboarding).
* Under the guidance of the HR & People Operations Manager, administer benefits plans, including claims resolution, change reporting, and communicating benefits information to employees; manage the variety of Leave policies and requests (FFCRA, STD & LTD, Parental Leave, FMLA, state specific PFL). Responsible for the integrity of employee data.
* Administers the HRIS human resource information system (Paycor), records and compiles and distributes reports from the database.
* Restructure and optimize SharePoint's HR and TA sections to ensure all documents and materials are appropriately housed, maintained, and accessed, including labor law posters, and updating links.
* Assist payroll processing, new state registration and tax application processes. Manages employee change processes.
* Collaborate and coordinate with the appropriate stakeholders to support operational excellence across the enterprise by:
	+ Partnering with HR and other stakeholders to investigate, strategize and establish people operations policies and programs to support them
	+ Coordinating, communicating, and delivering people-focused SOPs and policies to the other departments, particularly ECCO
* Execute tasks relating to the employee life cycle including offer and change communications, orientation and exit interviews, ensuring they are duly stored and accessible and maintaining their integrity and privacy according to employee data laws and regulations.
* Support the Talent Acquisition by activities and tasks such as candidate and interviewer scheduling, stakeholder follow-up and communications, etc.
* Maintain employee files and ensure changes to benefits and other important programs and initiatives are communicated in a concise and timely manner. Helps implement policies aligning with core principles while recommending changes to current plans and policies to stay abreast with trends and best practices.
* Maintain the organizational chart in SharePoint and contribute to policy updates.
* Remains knowledgeable about and communicates human resources trends, best practices, regulatory changes, and employment law at a regular cadence and applies this knowledge to communicate policy, practice, and resource changes.
* Other duties as needed.

**REQUIRED EDUCATION & EXPERIENCE**
* 3+ years of experience in progressively responsible human resource and/or talent management roles, preferably within a management consulting/professional services context.
* 3+ years supporting people and talent operations, leveraging project management approaches practices, and methodologies.
* 2+ years of hands-on experience resulting in proficiency with technology tools (e.g., HRIS, ATS, LMS, Microsoft Office, including Excel) and willingness to adapt to new technology.
* 3+ years of benefits administration experience
* Demonstrated knowledge of labor legislation, human resource laws, and best practices


  

**PREFERRED EDUCATION & EXPERIENCE**
* Bachelor’s degree in Human Resources of Business Administration
* SHRM-CP or PHR certification
* 1+ years of experience managing the payroll process.


  

**TRAVEL EXPECTATIONS**  

Limited travel is expected in this role.
**WORK ENVIRONMENT & PHYSICAL DEMANDS**  

This position operates in a professional office environment, and routinely requires the use of standard office equipment such as computers, phones, printers, photocopiers, and filing cabinets.  

  

The physical requirements described here are representative of those that must be met by an employee to successfully perform the essential functions of this job.
As a part of the responsibilities for this job, the employee is required to communicate, detect, converse with, discern, convey, express oneself, and exchange information orally and in writing with others. The employee must be able to remain in a stationary position, sitting at a desk for prolonged periods, move or traverse inside the office and facilities; operate, activate, use, prepare, inspect, place, detect, or position computers and other office equipment, such as a calculator, copy machine, furniture, and computer printer. The employee must be able to make substantial repetitive motions of the wrists, hands and fingers. The employee must be able to lift and move up to 15lbs at times.
**WORK AUTHORIZATION / SECURITY CLEARANCE**
US work authorization required.
**AAP/EEO STATEMENT**
The Equal Employment Opportunity Policy of Resonance is to provide a fair and equal employment opportunity for all associates and job applicants regardless of race, color, religion, national origin, sex (including pregnancy, gender identity or expression, and sexual orientation) parental status, genetic information (including family medical history) political affiliation, military service, age, veteran status, disability, or marital status, or any other characteristic protected by federal, state, or local law. These protections extend to all management practices and decisions, including recruitment and hiring, appraisal systems, promotions, training, and career development programs. Consistent with these obligations, Resonance also provides reasonable accommodations to employees and applicants with disabilities and for sincerely held religious beliefs, observances, and practices.
Resonance believes that employees should be provided with a working environment which enables each associate to be productive and to work to the best of his or her ability. We do not condone or tolerate an atmosphere of intimidation or harassment based on any of the above-mentioned characteristics.
We expect and require the cooperation of all employees in maintaining a discrimination and harassment-free atmosphere.
**Applications will be reviewed on a rolling basis. Only candidates selected for interviews will be contacted. No phone calls or emails please.**

February 23, 2024
### **About the company**


We build the company around people - so we are looking for teammates who want to build something big with us, too!


Our international team of more than 500 professionals is spread across the United States, Europe, Latin America, Australia, and India. But we are all connected by our innovative thinking and desire to create as one team. Our clients are from industries like healthcare, data engineering, warehouse automation, retail digitalization, mobile app development, and e-commerce. As our projects are so varied, we value teammates who have fresh perspectives and unique experiences. For us, what makes you different makes you right for our team.
‍


### **The project and your role**

#### **Your responsibilities:**

* **Being a part of the Global HR Team:** Work with your team andthe Head of HR and Recruitment located in Europe;
* **Employee Lifecycle:** Manage all HR procedures related to employees, from onboarding to offboarding;
* **Onboarding:** Conduct comprehensive onboarding processes and provide support during the probation period. This includes assistance during the first day, first week, and first month of new employees;
* **Employee Well-Being:** Monitor employee mood, conduct regular 1-to-1 meetings, and create action plans for their development. Assess staff risks and values to enhance job satisfaction;
* **Policy and Procedure Guidance:** Explain company policies, procedures, laws, and standards to both new and existing employees, ensuring everyone understands and complies;
* **DE&I:** Implement, develop, foster, and maintain diversity, equity, and inclusion (DEI) within the organization;
* **HR Policy Development:** Contribute to the updating and development of HR policies to meet the evolving needs of our work;
* **C&B:** Maintain and improve our current benefit package;
* **Offboarding:** Manage employee offboarding, conduct exit interviews, and provide valuable and actionable feedback;
* **Events:** Manage the coordination and execution of company events and merchandise projects, ensuring smooth operation and consistency with our brand values and strategies for employee engagement;
* **Metrics and Data:** Cooperate on HR metrics, data analysis, and outcomes for further business development. Help us become a data-driven HR team;**‍**
* **Digitalization:** Contribute to the digitization of the HR team, including using different AI tools to increase the efficiency of the HR team worldwide.
### **Your skills**

* 1 year of HR experience, ideally in the IT industry
* Spanish language at a professional level of communication
* Experience with HR best practices & HR metrics, and ideally with recruiting and staffing
* Knowledge of employment-related laws and regulations
* Experience with immigration processing
* Strong desire to understand company culture and nurture and support its development
* Strong analytical, problem-solving, and organizational skills
* Ability and desire to build and effectively manage interpersonal relationships with people of different levels and backgrounds


‍

### **What we can offer**

* **Find Inspiration!** Be part of a dynamic team which takes any opportunity to grow and learn.
* **Stay Covered!** Use our Local Benefit Package, which includes medical benefits, 401K plan, PTOs, maternity leave bonus, and language courses.
* **Keep Learning!** Gain access to our diverse range of training programs, courses, and certifications.
* **Enjoy Flexibility!** Choose your work style - remote, on-site, or hybrid in one of our stunning offices. We offer the freedom of flexible working hours.**‍**
* **Travel!** Work from anywhere and explore the world with business trips or our Workation program.

English

title: HR Operations Manager - UKG Ready, Payroll, and Benefits
description:
**PURPOSE OF THE POSITION**

* **Leadership and Oversight:** Lead and oversee the end-to-end payroll

and benefits processes, ensuring accuracy, compliance, and efficiency

within the Team Resources department. Emphasis of work initially will

be in payroll, with additional leadership opportunity in benefits, etc.

* **UKG Ready Specialization:** Serve as Sewell’s the primary UKG Ready

specialist, managing system configurations, updates, and audits to

optimize functionality and streamline HR operations.

* **Team Development and Training:** Contribute to the growth and

development of the Team Resources team by actively participating in

hiring, mentoring, and providing ongoing training initiatives. Training

for UKG also extends to the team at large.

* **Strategic Collaboration:** Collaborate cross-functionally and align Team

Resources processes with company goals, fostering a positive work

culture and contributing to the overall success of The Sewell Family of

Companies.

**KEY RESPONSIBILITIES**

1. **PAYROLL**- Lead the end-to-end payroll process, ensuring accuracy,

compliance, and efficiency.

2. **BENEFITS** **LEADERSHIP** - Assist the Team Resources Director with

leading the Benefits team. The benefits team handles benefits

administration, open enrollment, vendor relationships, and team

inquiries.

3. **UKG READY SPECIALIST** - Act as the primary UKG Ready specialist for

Team Sewell, collaborating with cross-functional teams to implement

system enhancements and updates.

4. **UKG READY CONFIGURATION / ADMIN -** Oversee the configuration

and maintenance of UKG Ready for the entire Team Resources team,

ensuring data accuracy and system security.

5. **AUDIT UKG** - Conduct audits of our current UKG Ready setup and

backend settings to optimize processes.

6. **LEADING UKG ELEMENTS OF RECRUITING AND ONBOARDING -**

Provide guidance and support to the Team Resources team in utilizing

UKG Ready for recruiting and onboarding processes, but not

responsible for day-to-day recruiting and onboarding.

7. **LEADING VS INDIVIDUAL CONTRIBUTION** Lead and mentor a team in

some cases, while actively contributing to hands-on tasks when

necessary.

8. **BUILDING THE TR TEAM -** Assist in the hiring process and provide

training for current and future Team Resources team members.

9. **COMPLIANCE MANAGEMENT** - Stay informed and ensure strict

adherence to local and international employment laws, regulations, and

company policies.

10. **DATA ANALYSIS AND REPORTING** - Utilize data analytics to provide

insights and generate regular reports for leadership, enabling informed

decision-making.

11. **TEAM MEMBER RELATIONS SUPPORT -** Collaborate with the Team to

address and resolve issues related to payroll, benefits, and HRIS.

12. **PROJECT MANAGEMENT** - Lead and coordinate special projects related

to Team Resources operations, ensuring successful execution and

timely completion.

13. **COLLABORATION** - Collaborate with other departments to ensure

seamless integration and alignment of HR processes.

title: Employee Benefits Account Manager
description:
**Job Description:**  

**Benefits and Perks*** Medical, Dental, Vision, Life and Disability benefits
* Paid Time Off & Volunteer Time Off
* 401k with Employer Match
* Company-paid professional development opportunities
* Company-paid certification renewal

**Position Summary**  

This position serves as the primary service contact for health plan renewals and is expected to consistently provide excellent customer service, as well as represent internal needs and goals within the organization to ensure quality.  

  

**Essential Job Duties and Responsibilities:*** Manages a book of business comprised of clients that are located both locally and nationally that are mostly fully insured, but may include some self-insured clients.
* Responsible for obtaining client census and quotes, preparing and submitting quote requests, and evaluating the results in preparing recommendations for clients and prospects.
* This is not a commission position because there is no involvement in attaining sales leads; the Employee Benefits Account Management attends meetings with prospects as set up by the sales team.
* Collaborates with internal partners involved in providing services to identify and resolve issues and ensure that these services meet client expectations.
* Conducts employee benefits enrollment meetings.
* Monitors usage and experience of existing accounts and makes recommendations regarding existing plan(s).
* Creates client proposals as necessary with current and renewal details as well as marketplace and master policy options.
* Interacts with insurance carriers and clients to assist in resolving claim disputes and answering questions regarding billing and products.
* Plan and schedule work by use of Salesforce project management tools.
* Ensure work product is timely and accurate.
* Ensure compliance with applicable government regulations such as ERISA, ACA, and HIPAA.
* Requires occasional travel, sometimes overnight.

**About Us**  

Simply put, Human Resource Management is our business and has been since 1999 when we started eEmployers Solutions, Inc. (ESI) as a licensed Professional Employer Organization (PEO). We are a privately held company with headquarters in San Antonio, Texas. We are looking for a Benefits Account Managerwith a spirit for customer service to join our team!

title: Recruitment Manager
description:
Princeton Medspa Partners specializes in buying and launching the leading medical spas and providing the best aesthetic services in the United States.

We are industry outliers with an unprecedented team of aesthetic pioneers and thought leaders who bring decades of experience and proven track records to every partnership.

Princeton Medspa Partners is guided by core values of integrity, safety, personalized service and industry-best results.

The company size is currently 11 locations and ~170 employees. Projected growth will add +17 locations in 2024, and up to 20 new locations in 2025, 2026, and 2027.

The Recruitment Manager will support the hiring needs of the company's 11 existing locations and additional locations as they come on-line. Roles to recruit for will largely be in the medical space such as physicians (MD/DO), Nurse Practitioners, and Physician Assistants.

The Recruitment Manager will build out a recruiting team in support of the company as it grows. The company size is currently 11 locations and ~170 employees. Projected growth will add +17 locations in 2024, and up to 20 new locations in 2025, 2026, and 2027.

**Requirements:**

* 5+ years full life cycle recruiting experience
* Experience building and managing a recruiting team

**Nice to Have:**

**Responsibilities:**

* Develop and implement recruitment strategies to attract and hire qualified candidates
* Conduct full-cycle recruitment, including sourcing, screening, interviewing, and selecting candidates
* Collaborate with hiring managers to understand staffing needs and create job descriptions
* Utilize various recruitment and collaboration tools and platforms such as Monday.com and JazzHR
* Build and maintain relationships with external recruitment agencies and job boards
* Collaborate with the HR team to develop hiring/planning strategies
* Utilize JazzHR to track candidate information and manage recruitment pipelines

**Skills:**

* Excellent communication skills, both written and verbal
* Strong knowledge of recruitment best practices and employment laws
* Ability to effectively source candidates through various channels
* Experience in conducting interviews and assessing candidate qualifications
* Knowledge of hiring/planning strategies and talent development initiatives

title: HR Generalist
description:
**ABOUT US**



OLIPOP was founded in 2017 by Ben Goodwin and David Lester. Ben and David have been working together for nearly a decade to find accessible solutions to bring the benefits of digestive health to as many consumers as possible. OLIPOP is a deliciously refreshing tonic that is crafted with prebiotics, botanicals, and natural plant fiber to support your microbiome and benefit digestive health. We're on a mission to provide an affordable, delicious alternative to soda that delivers leading-edge health benefits to mainstream consumers.


**OUR TEAM**



At Olipop our values lead the way we create our products, engage with each other, and interact with our community. While we're invested in our product, we're equally invested in personal development. We're tightly knit, we're genuine and we're always pushing the envelope to do a better job than we did the day before. Our team is also fully remote, requiring us to be resourceful, creative and collaborative to support our fast-moving business.



To best serve our diverse community of customers, we also seek to recruit and include people with a diversity of abilities, backgrounds, and cultures.


**WHAT YOU'LL NEED**



Working at a start-up can be as much a personal journey as it is a professional one. To succeed at a company like Olipop, you must be comfortable with failing, learning, and adapting. You need to be curious, optimistic, and able to find a way when it seems impossible. You must be confident enough to express your ideas but humble and open to learning from your experiences and from others. If this is the approach you take to life, then we'd love to hear from you.

**THE ROLE**



OLIPOP is searching for a People Operations Generalist to join our team. This position focuses on excellent execution of the day-to-day operations of the People Operations department while providing exceptional and timely support to our growing team of 100+ OLIPOPPERS in more than 20 states.



In this role you'll have to prioritize your time to focus on the "nuts and bolts" of People Operations, including but not limited to payroll, benefits, leaves of absence, worker's compensation, and HRIS management, all while modeling and upleveling our culture and values. You'll be a great addition to our team if you are interested in work that makes a difference, are able to think critically and creatively to solve problems, and are skilled at building efficient processes that will scale with our company.

  

**RESPONSIBILITIES**


* Processing bi-monthly payroll with absolute accuracy, ensuring all data changes are accounted for and all compliance requirements are met.
* Performing various new hire onboarding and offboarding tasks to ensure a consistent, high quality experience that exceeds employee expectations, suggesting improvements to automate where practical and ensuring compliance with the respective laws of each state where we operate (20+, currently).
* Partnering with our benefits broker to administer employee benefits, including answering employee questions and supporting annual enrollment.
* Managing our current HRIS, Gusto, ensuring 100% accurate data at all times, running routine and ad-hoc reports, and quickly learning the ins and outs of the system to understand what customization is available based on changing organizational needs.
* Supporting HRIS transition projects, having experience with a variety of popular HRIS, payroll and performance management technology and familiarity with transitioning and implementation of new systems.
* Working with our leave management vendor to support employee leaves of absence, understanding the basics of leave management and being comfortable with explaining our company leave policies and practices, following up with employees to request required forms and documenting leaves in our HRIS.
* Administering worker's compensation programs, reporting claims, liaising with employees, managers and claims adjusters to ensure employees are taken care of and claims are moved through the process in a timely manner.
* Administering the performance review cycle in our performance management software by setting up the cycle, keeping track of important dates, sending reminders, moving the cycle through the various stages and helping answer questions to ensure reviews are high-quality and completed in a timely manner.
* Administering company engagement programs, including supporting survey and action planning activities, and suggesting/executing activities that support company engagement initiatives.
* Creating and updating People Operations process documentation, standard operating procedures, help guides and various other resources to be used within the department and by OLIPOPPPERS at large.
* Creating systems to self-audit processes to ensure nothing slips through the cracks and when it does, we catch it quickly.
* Collaborating with the People Operations team as needed to deliver the best support and service to every Olipop employee.


**QUALIFICATIONS**


* Minimum 3+ years of hands-on operational experience performing the tasks that are listed above.
* Highly organized, process-oriented, excellent follow-through and reliable - nobody ever questions if you'll do what you say you're going to do. You communicate status updates regularly to build trust with colleagues and leaders.
* Ability to take initiative and work autonomously – you act as a thermostat, not a thermometer, and can run with something from beginning to end.
* Ability to work with ambiguity, think critically, make decisions and solve non-routine problems based on your experience and through solid reasoning skills. Not a rule follower for rule's sake.
* High level of discretion when dealing with confidential and sensitive matters.
* Ability to communicate clearly, empathetically and firmly in a variety of settings - verbally, in writing, 1 on 1 and in large groups.
* Competence in Google Suite and Microsoft Suite - ability to manipulate data sets in spreadsheets, perform calculations and write formulas.
* Experience with team collaboration tools such as Slack and Zoom is preferred.

  


**REPORTS TO**



People Success Manager

  


**COMPENSATION**



$80,000-$90,000 base salary + bonus

  

We are proud to be an Equal Opportunity/Affirmative Action Employer. Olipop does not discriminate on the basis of race, color, religion, sex (including pregnancy and gender identity), national origin, political affiliation, sexual orientation, marital status, disability, genetic information, age, membership in an employee organization, retaliation, parental status, military service, or other non-merit factor. Applicants and employees are protected from discrimination under Federal law. For more information, please see EEO is the Law.

title: Global Mergers, Acquisitions, Divestitures and Joint Venture (MADJV) HR Manager NA (Open to Remote)
description:
Want to build a stronger, more sustainable future and cultivate your career? Join Cargill's global team of 160,000 employees who use new technologies, dynamic insights and over 157 years of experience to connect farmers with markets, customers with ingredients, and people and animals with the food they need to thrive.
  
Location
  
  

This role will be based in North America and is open to remote. Job Purpose and Impact
  
  

The North America Mergers, Acquisitions, Divestitures, and Joint Venture (“MADJV”) HR Manager will flex across MADJV assignments to support all business enterprise groups and functions. In this role, you will be accountable for leading the execution of MADJV transactions on behalf of human resources as assigned. You will establish strong working relationships with essential project team members (including HR domains, business stakeholders and functional partners)) to ensure deals realize the highest possible value, limit risks, protect company interests, values and culture to drive optimal business outcomes. Key Accountabilities
  
  

Lead and develop strategic relationships, influence, and mobilize action among business leaders, corporate development, and human resource partners related to all people components of MADJV transactions.
  
Support the long-range HR MADJV strategic roadmap to meet the company´s inorganic growth goals.
  
Ensure roadmaps and requirements for transformation execution are shaped, understood, and delivered at the right time and with the highest quality of delivery.
  
Partner with other key stakeholders to ensure cohesive alignment and to enable the overall MADJV activities, vision, and strategy.
  
Foster a strong continuous improvement culture to ensure deployment of MADJV processes and be a change leader to inject strategic and innovative thinking into initiatives and projects.
  
Flex across various enterprises and functions to ensure the demand is met with allocated resources and support MADJV efforts globally.
  
Provide expert thought leadership in your field and work with limited direction, using additional research and interpretation to identify issues or problems. Provide direction to supporting team members and be a strategic contributor.
  
Other duties as assigned. Qualifications
  
Minimum Qualifications
  
Bachelor’s degree in a related field or equivalent experience
  
Minimum of six years of related work experience including M&A transactions
  
Ability to travel regionally and internationally up to 25% of the time Preferred Qualifications
  
Minimum of five years of experience leading MADJV projects, with knowledge of due diligence processes and procedures used within the context of MADJV, including applicable laws and regulations
  
Master's degree or other post-secondary degree
  
Experience partnering with senior business and functional executives across an organization
  
Ability to utilize data and insights to identify trends to drive process improvements and evolve the MADJV function
  
Ability to combine strategic thinking and strong operational execution with solid attention to detail
  
Demonstrated ability to effectively navigate through ambiguity
  
Excellent presentation skills. Must be able to draft and deliver compelling and informative presentations to senior leaders Additional Information
  
  

Compensation
  
The expected salary for this position is $150-165K. This position is eligible for a discretionary incentive award. The incentive award amount is dependent upon company performance and your personal performance.
  
Benefits
  
Full-Time (30+ hours) positions are eligible for a benefit package including the following (subject to certain collective bargaining agreements for Union positions): Paid time off; paid holidays; medical, vision, and dental coverage; flexible spending accounts; life insurance; disability insurance; retirement savings; employee and family assistance program (EAP)
  
  

Equal Opportunity Employer, including Disability/Vet.
  
  

Minnesota Sick and Safe Leave accruals of one hour for every 30 worked, up to 48 hours per calendar year unless otherwise provided by law.

title: Proposal Manager - Employee Benefits
description:
**Summary:**
The Proposal Specialist supports the organization's business development and sales activities by targeting new businesses and renewals. The Proposal Specialist is pivotal in leading the development and completion of responses to RFPs, RFIs, and proposal requests by coordinating efforts among several departments.
**Responsibilities:**
* Leads and executes RFP proposal development and submission for new business opportunities and renewal of existing accounts.
* Partners across the organization with Sales, Leadership, Clinical, Account Management, Carrier Partners, Brokers, and Subject Matter Experts (SMEs) to produce and submit consistent, high-quality strategic responses to RFPs and RFIs
* Works closely with the Sales Team to develop presentations and reports to show the full scope of services and company differentiators, creating effective and appropriate content for proposals and RFPs.
* Develop and maintain policies and procedures that support Proposal and RFP response development and submission.
* Creates accurate, high-quality proposals that improve bid-win probability.
* Manage quoting, proposal generation, and renewal processes for multiple lines of business.
* Work directly with the Sales team, providing input on sales and marketing strategies.
* Oversee and manage assigned new business opportunities.
* Generate reports from internal systems and databases.
* Continuously collaborate with both internal and external parties for process streamlining and continuous improvement
* Review and evaluate assigned new business opportunities by working closely with sales and underwriting to gather necessary information.
* Develop and grow strong working relationships with external carriers, brokers, and vendors for effective communication and negotiation.
* Remain up to date with available market products and healthcare industry trends.
* Track detailed sales activity for your assigned opportunities/prospects daily utilizing various tools, email, and web-based systems.
* BA/BS, required, offsetting combination of education and experience will be considered.
* 3-5 years of experience in Sales Support, Client Services, PBM Industry, Project Management
* Some travel may be required.

**Skills & Abilities:**
* High attention to detail on all levels, including product, formatting, and organization of work.
* Critical thinking, Problem-solving, Resourceful, and solution seeking.
* Ability to prioritize effectively to work efficiently within a dynamic environment.
* Ability to develop solutions to unique situations outside of templates or established processes.
* Ability to work both independently and collectively as a team, knowing when to seek guidance and ask for help.
* Capable of taking ownership, accountability, and initiative
* Professional communication skills, both verbal and written to all levels of the organization and external partners
* Intermediate to advanced skills with MS Word, MS Excel, and Power PDF Advance (high concentration in Excel)
* Experience with databases and data reporting tools, i.e., Asana
* Proven Project Management experience with the capacity to manage several projects concurrently.


**COMPETENCIES:**
**MANAGER**
**Collaborates**
Building partnerships and working collaboratively with others to meet shared objectives.  

  

**Manages Conflict**
Handling conflict situations effectively, with a minimum of noise.  

  

**Courage**
Stepping up to address difficult issues, saying what needs to be said.  

  

**Decision Quality**
Making good and timely decisions that keep the organization moving forward.  

  

**Values Differences**
Recognizing the value that different perspectives and cultures bring to an organization.  

  

**Directs Work**
Providing direction, delegating, and removing obstacles to get work done.

title: Specialist, Employee Relations
description:
AAA is hiring for an **Employee Relations Specialist** to join our HR Shared Services team!


**At AAA, your success is our success. What we can offer you:**

* A competitive salary commensurate with experience
* Annual Bonus + Annual Merit Increase Eligibility
* Comprehensive health benefits package
* 3+ weeks of paid time off accrued during your first year
* 401(K) plan with company match up to 7%
* Professional development opportunities and tuition reimbursement
* Paid time off to volunteer & company-sponsored volunteer events throughout the year
* Other benefits include a free AAA Premier Membership, Health & Wellness Program, Health Concierge Service, Life Insurance and Short Term/Long Term Disability

**What You'll Do:**

* Resolves general employee relations issues; provide direction and recommendations to all levels of leadership, ensure fairness and consistency of policy and practice.
* Regularly remains online and available to respond to cases escalated by HR Service Center Tier 1.
* Provides consultation to managers on policies and compliance regarding employment-related matters.
* Investigates and resolves employee complaints, issues, and concerns regarding employment practices originating from Shared Services hotline and other sources.
* Conducts interviews and prepares relevant documentation using investigation guidelines.
* Recommends appropriate resolution of complaints, develops action plans and follows up to ensure completion.
* Interacts with internal (COs, Field HR) resources to acquire needed information to lead work to completion.
* Coordinates all accommodation requests to include general administration, interactive process, and compliance with all related policies and employment laws.
* Reviews dashboard metrics daily to optimize efficiency and ensure work is completed in accordance with service level agreements (SLAs)
* Provides reports to Field HR and COE’s to be used in solving people related business challenges and HR strategy
* Participates on Human Resources and/or company-wide project teams.
* Other duties as assigned.

**Minimum Qualifications:**

* Bachelor’s degree in HR or related field; equivalent experience considered in lieu of degree
* 4+ years of experience in employee relations
* Strong written and verbal communication skills; able to communicate with tact and diplomacy
* Ability to influence others on policies, practices, and procedure
* Effective at capturing and synthesizing information from multiple parties
* Solid understanding of employment laws
* Ability to handle sensitive and highly personal information daily and maintain confidentiality in a mature and insightful manner
* Knowledge of multiple areas of employee relations
* Proficient in Microsoft Office and experience with case management technology preferred

AAA Club Alliance (ACA) is an affirmative action - equal opportunity employer.


Our investment in Diversity, Equity, and Inclusion:
  

  

At ACA, we are committed to cultivating a welcoming and inclusive workplace of team members with diverse backgrounds and experiences to enable us to meet our goals and support our values while serving our Members and customers. We strive to attract and retain candidates with a passion for their work and we encourage all qualified individuals, regardless of race, color , gender, identity, veteran status, sexual orientation, physical ability or national origin, to apply.  



**Job Category:**

Human Resources

title: HR Generalist
description:
**Who We Are**


eAssist is the nation's leading platform for remote dental billing and patient billing services for dental offices. We were co-founded by a dentist who understands what other dentists need. eAssist currently serves close to 3000 dental practices through a unique proprietary technology platform that connects dental practices to vetted dental billing professionals, allowing practice owners to fully outsource their billing department.


eAssist was recently certified as a *2022-2023 Great Place to Work* and has been featured on the *Inc 5000* list of fastest-growing privately held companies in the U.S. for the last 7 years in a row! ***What makes us so unique? We are 100% remote. This means we are truly able to find the best of the best to join our employee team and they get to do what they love from the comfort of their home office.***

**Please check out what people love about us and our platform on Glassdoor:**


https://www.glassdoor.com/Reviews/eAssist-Reviews-E814561.htm

**Who You Are**


We’re looking for that one of a kind person who will stand out of the crowd of applicants. The type of person who doesn’t sit around and wait for direction, but actually begins projects independently. You feel compelled to take action without requiring additional prompting from managers. If you see a challenge you embrace it head on and you love to test your limits. You’re the first person to volunteer for a difficult task and don’t need much direction. You know how to move past difficulties and find alternative solutions to accomplish your objectives. If you are all of these things and more then we’d love to meet you!

 **JOB OVERVIEW:** The HR Generalist is responsible for assisting with the administration of all HR initiatives, including benefits and retirement programs, HRIS management, onboarding/offboarding, performance management and other HR admin duties. This is a full-time salaried (exempt) position working 40 hours per week (or more if needed). The incumbent will also provide other HR related services as needed. Preference given to someone in Utah county, though this role will be mostly remote (90%+)

 **KEY RESPONSIBILITIES:**

* Assist in ensuring the accuracy of all benefits enrollments in the HRIS (ADP) to provide vendors with accurate eligibility information.
* Assist employees via email, phone and company communication channels with their questions.
* Process and administer all leave-of-absence requests and disability paperwork: medical, personal, disability and FMLA.
* Effectively interpret FMLA and ADA implications as they relate to leaves of absence/disabilities.
* Generate reports and analyze data to support decision-making and compliance.
* Assist with employee performance management programs.
* Provide assistance in other areas of Human Resources as needed.
* Updating and entering employee information into HRIS system.
* Assisting with onboarding and offboarding duties.
* If local, mail pick up and sorting from office in American Fork.

**REQUIREMENTS:**

  

* Familiarity with HRIS (ADP preferred).
* Excellent written and verbal communication skills.
* Excellent organizational and time management skills.
* High level of integrity and ability to handle confidential information.
* Proficient with Microsoft Office Suite or similar software.

 **MINIMUM WORK EXPERIENCE:**

  

* 2+ years experience in Human Resources

 **PREFERRED EDUCATION:**

* Associate’s degree in HR or related field preferred.
* SHRM-CP or PHR

 **COMPENSATION: $58-62,000 DOE**

 **TRAVEL / PHYSICAL DEMANDS:**


90% Remote; If you are local to UT county then mail pick up from office will be required. must maintain a private, professional work environment, free from distractions and be available for virtual meetings during business hours (for example, Monday through Friday, 8am to 5pm in your time zone).
