title: HR Business Partner (Remote, US)
description:
Vivun is the world’s leading provider of PreSales software. Our AI-powered platform includes solutions for PreSales Operations, Demo Automation, and aligning Sales with Product teams. Revenue leaders can now drive growth efficiently by scaling their technical selling efforts, maximizing every R&D investment and de-risking their deals. Customers include Snowflake, Zoom, Okta, Elastic, ADP, Coupa, and Harness. To learn more visit www.vivun.com. **Position Summary:**  

Vivun is seeking an HR Business Partner to join our People & Culture team. This is an exciting opportunity to collaborate with our global employee base in delivering innovative, consultative solutions that drive performance and results. In particular, you’ll serve as a trusted advisor in the effective delivery of HR solutions, including compensation, benefits, immigration, global employment, performance management, compliance, recruiting support, onboarding, and employee relations. You’ll serve as an evangelist of our culture, working directly with our most important asset, our employees.  

This role reports to our VP of People and is a remote position that can be done from anywhere in the U.S.
### **Key Responsibilities**

+ You will design, support, and execute people-related programs and strategy
+ You will provide strategic business partnership, thought partnership, and coaching to all levels of the organization globally
+ You will provide coaching and guidance on performance management issues, professional development, career pathing, and leveling
+ You will oversee sensitive employee relations issues as they arise
+ You will partner with employees and management to provide HR policy guidance and interpretation
+ You will identify levers to drive employee engagement across the organization
+ You will be responsible for managing and supporting the onboarding, exit, and performance review processes
+ You will actively support and contribute to company-wide events and culture initiatives
+ You will be responsible for maintaining and protecting confidential data with great discretion, judgment, and professionalism

### **Minimum Qualifications**

+ You have 6+ years of relevant experience working in Human Resources for a high-growth, dynamic organization, preferably in technology
+ You have experience with being the face of HR, representing policies and practices to managers and employees across the organization
+ You have good working knowledge of HR federal & state laws and regulations
+ You demonstrate strong decision-making skills with a logical approach
+ You have excellent presentation, verbal, and written communication skills
+ You have the ability to conduct group facilitation, coach and counsel managers at all levels
+ You have the ability to analyze data, draw accurate conclusions, and communicate key messages succinctly
+ You possess knowledge of talent management best practices
+ You have exceptional analytical and problem solving skills
+ You are a highly motivated individual with a high level of initiative and a willingness to support additional projects as needed

### **You Are:**

+ **A believer in Vivun’s core values:** Ownership. Empathy. We, not me. Transparency. Be different.
+ **Experienced working in high growth startup environments:** You have the ability to move fast, adapt, and thrive in a dynamic startup environment where you derive priorities, requirements, and goals from company context.
+ **Collaborative:** You are ready to roll up your sleeves and create strategies that work across roles and departments to achieve company goals.
+ **A Clear Communicator:** You effectively and positively present your informed opinions on strategy clearly to multiple teams and areas of expertise. You come with a solid rationale behind every decision you make, you understand the importance of listening as part of communication.

### **What You Will Have At Vivun:**

+ Competitive salary and full health benefits
+ Stock Options at a well funded, pre-IPO company on a fast growth track
+ Flexible work schedules and work from anywhere at a fully remote company
+ Unlimited PTO with two weeks designated as “quiet period” each year
+ An experienced team who will fight beside you in the trenches to accomplish your goals

$125,000 - $150,000 a year
The anticipated base salary for this position is $125,000 - $150,000 USD. The actual base salary offered will depend on a variety of factors, including without limitation, the qualifications of the individual applicant for the position, years of relevant experience, level of education attained, and certifications or other professional licenses held. This position is also eligible for equity.

title: Security Training and Development Program Manager
description:
**Our Mission**

As the world’s number 1 job site\\*, our mission is to help people get jobs. We strive to cultivate an inclusive and accessible workplace where all people feel comfortable being themselves. We're looking to grow our teams with more people who share our enthusiasm for innovation and creating the best experience for job seekers.

(\\*comScore Total Visits, September 2023)

**Day to Day**

The Technical Security Program Manager - Security Awareness Training and Development will effectively deliver business results by promoting a culture of accountability and consistent application of project & program management practices. We are facilitators and motivators, working across departments and offices to ensure collaboration, communication, visibility, and successful delivery of programs and projects.

This role will be accountable for helping teams achieve their goals, work strategically together, and remain as adaptable as possible in a fun, ever-changing environment. We’re always looking for ways to optimize.

We are looking for a Technical Security Program Manager who specializes in Security Awareness and Training Development to help in the continued maturity of Indeed’s security awareness culture. This role will focus on developing in-house security training, communications, and other awareness events. Our goal is to mitigate human risk by delivering the right information to the right people at the right time. In this role, you’ll get the opportunity to create a program that will help amplify the voice of security across various groups and levels within the business.

**Responsibilities:**

* Ensure Indeed's security awareness culture program meets all industry regulations, standards, and compliance requirements.
* Develop, implement, and oversee a security training and development program. Including a variety of creative ways to engage various audiences across the business through various training mechanisms. This includes coordinating Indeed’s annual internal security conference, garnering over 1,000 attendees.
* Work closely with learning and development teams and technical SMEs. Identifying areas of risk and develop targeted and roles-based information security training, education, and awareness activities.
* Own the design, development, and implementation of security and technical training programs of a broad organizational scope, including but not limited to, tailored training for code developers and committers. This includes defining the objectives, writing scripts, defining the audiences, and producing educational training/videos and assessments.
* Conduct assessments to identify training needs and requirements including ensuring multiple learning styles are included in the course design by using various communication channels.
* Develop training materials beyond CBT and web-based training to include training handbooks, job aids, models, multimedia visual aids, computer, and web-based tutorials- the more creative, the better!
* Continuously evaluate the effectiveness of existing security training, leveraging feedback tools and metrics to drive improvements and measure effectiveness to ensure it incorporates best practices and learning principles. As a result, you will be able to deliver the highest quality training programs based on needs identified through ongoing examination of the organization's risks and needs.
* Leverage 1st party and 3rd party technologies to create engaging learning experiences that are specific to the Indeed environment, while leveraging existing content not developed in-house to supplement ongoing training and awareness.
* Work with the security team to identify the top human risks to our organization and the behaviors we need to change to manage those risks. Ensure Indeed's program effectively changes these behaviors so our workforce acts securely, reducing the most risk to our organization.
* Create a positive program that builds on our culture and engages people to focus on changing behaviors both at home and at work. We want our employees to demonstrate the same secure behaviors regardless of where they are or whose technologies they are using.
* Structure and maintain this program to be long-term, aiming to transform not just behaviors but the overall culture.
* Identify and report on meaningful metrics to measure program performance and associated human risks.

**Requirements:**

* Highly adaptable in a fast-paced hyper-growth environment; thrives when working autonomously.
* Experience developing and delivering engaging and fun security training, end-to-end with mastery of instructional design principles, training techniques, and adult learning theories.
* Proven experience in designing and developing learning solutions and experiences including the development of material for multiple delivery modalities.
* Professional proficiency and creative savvy in authoring tools such as Articulate, Adobe, Camtasia, Vyond, Microsoft Office 365, Degreed and other Learning Management Systems, and other similar tools.
* Up-to-date knowledge and experience applying both learning and security industry trends and best practices, new training methodologies, authoring tools, delivery methods, and content.
* Experience working cross-functionally with various teams, both internal and external to security, is a plus.
* Excellent understanding of security risks with a passion for sharing information about these risks in creative ways with at least 5+ years working as a program/ project manager or technical designer.

**Skills/Competencies:**

* Highly adaptable in a fast-paced hyper-growth environment; thrives when working autonomously.
* Experience developing and delivering engaging and fun security training, end-to-end with mastery of instructional design principles, training techniques, and adult learning theories.
* Proven experience in designing and developing learning solutions and experiences including the development of material for multiple delivery modalities.
* Professional proficiency and creative savvy in authoring tools such as Articulate, Adobe, Camtasia, Vyond, Microsoft Office 365, Degreed and other Learning Management Systems, and other similar tools.
* Up-to-date knowledge and experience applying both learning and security industry trends and best practices, new training methodologies, authoring tools, delivery methods, and content.
* Experience working cross-functionally with various teams, both internal and external to security, is a plus.
* Excellent understanding of security risks with a passion for sharing information about these risks in creative ways with at least 5+ years working as a program/ project manager or technical designer.

**Salary Range/ Transparency**

US Remote 100,000 - 140,000 USD per year

Austin Remote 100,000 - 140,000 USD per year

NYC Remote 127,000 - 183,000 USD per year

Seattle Remote 117,00 - 169,000 USD per year

SF Bay Area Remote 131,000 - 189,000 USD per year

Note: This job description is not intended to be all-inclusive. The employee may perform other related duties as negotiated to meet the ongoing needs of the organization.

**Benefits - Health, Work/Life Harmony, & Wellbeing**

We care about what you care about. We have a multitude of benefits to support Indeedians, as well as their pets, kids, and partners. Select your country and learn more about our employee benefits, program, & perks at https://benefits.indeed.jobs!

**Equal Opportunities and Accommodations Statement**

Indeed is deeply committed to building a workplace and global community where inclusion is not only valued, but prioritized. We’re proud to be an equal opportunity employer, seeking to create a welcoming and diverse environment. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, gender, gender identity or expression, family status, marital status, sexual orientation, national origin, genetics, neuro-diversity, disability, age, or veteran status, or any other non-merit based or legally protected grounds.

title: Sourcer - Talent Acquisition Associate
description:
**Company:** Oak Street Health

**Title:** Associate, Talent Sourcing

**Location:** Treehouse

**Role Description:**


As a Sourcer in the Talent Acquisition department at Oak Street Health, you will play a critical role in identifying and attracting top talent to join our organization. You will be responsible for sourcing candidates through various channels, such as job boards, social media platforms, and professional networks, to build a robust pipeline of qualified candidates. Your efforts will contribute to our goal of finding exceptional individuals who embody our mission and values, ensuring that we continue to deliver outstanding care to our patients.

 **Core Responsibilities:**

* Candidate Sourcing: Utilize multiple channels, including online sourcing tools, job boards, social media platforms, and industry-specific networks, to identify potential candidates who meet the qualifications and requirements for various positions within Oak Street Health.
* Talent Pipeline Development: Build and maintain a strong pipeline of qualified candidates for current and future openings, ensuring a steady flow of potential hires.
* Screening and Evaluation: Conduct initial screenings and assessments of candidates to assess their suitability for specific roles, including reviewing resumes, conducting phone screens, and evaluating candidate qualifications.
* Collaboration with Hiring Managers: Collaborate closely with hiring managers to understand their specific talent needs, develop effective sourcing strategies, and provide regular updates on candidate progress and pipeline status.
* Employer Branding: Contribute to the development and execution of employer branding initiatives to enhance Oak Street Health's reputation as an employer of choice within the healthcare industry.
* Data Management: Ensure accurate and up-to-date candidate tracking and documentation within the applicant tracking system (ATS), maintaining thorough records of all sourcing activities.
* Continuous Improvement: Stay up-to-date with industry trends and sourcing techniques, actively seeking opportunities to enhance the effectiveness and efficiency of talent acquisition processes.
* Other duties as assigned.

**What are we looking for?**


Qualifications:

* Bachelor's degree in Human Resources, Business Administration, or a related field (or equivalent experience)
* Previous experience in talent acquisition, recruiting, or sourcing roles preferred
* Demonstrated experience with various candidate sourcing techniques and tools, including online platforms, social media, and professional networks
* Strong knowledge of applicant tracking systems (ATS) and other HR software
* Excellent interpersonal and communication skills, with the ability to engage and build relationships with candidates and internal stakeholders
* Strong organizational and time management skills, with the ability to prioritize tasks and meet deadlines in a fast-paced environment
* Attention to detail and a commitment to delivering high-quality work
* Passion for healthcare and a genuine interest in Oak Street Health's mission
* US work authorization
* Someone who embodies being “Oaky”

**What does being “Oaky” look like?**

* Radiating positive energy
* Assuming good intentions
* Creating an unmatched patient experience
* Driving clinical excellence
* Taking ownership and delivering results
* Being relentlessly determined

**Why Oak Street Health?**


Oak Street Health is on a mission to “Rebuild healthcare as it should be'', providing personalized primary care for older adults on Medicare, with the goal of keeping patients healthy and living life to the fullest. Our innovative care model is centered right in our patient’s communities, and focused on the quality of care over volume of services. We’re an organization on the move! With over 150 locations and an ambitious growth trajectory, Oak Street Health is attracting and cultivating team members who embody “Oaky” values and passion for our mission.

**Oak Street Health Benefits:**

* Mission-focused career impacting change and measurably improving health outcomes for medicare patients
* Paid vacation, sick time, and investment/retirement 401K match options
* Health insurance, vision, and dental benefits
* Opportunities for leadership development and continuing education stipends
* New centers and flexible work environments
* Opportunities for high levels of responsibility and rapid advancement

  

Oak Street Health is an equal opportunity employer. We embrace diversity and encourage all interested readers to apply.


Learn more at www.oakstreethealth.com/diversity-equity-and-inclusion-at-oak-street-health

title: People Operations Associate
description:
Headway’s mission is a big one - to build a new mental health care system everyone can access. We’ve built technology that helps people find great therapists with the first software-enabled national network of providers accepting insurance.



1 in 4 people in the US have a treatable mental health condition, but the majority of providers don’t accept insurance, making therapy too expensive for most people. Headway is building a new mental healthcare system that everyone can access by making it easy for therapists to take insurance and scale their practice.



Headway was founded in 2019 – since then, we’ve grown into a diverse, national network of over 25,000 mental healthcare providers across all 50 states who run their practice on our software. We’re a Series C company with over $225m in funding from a16z (Andreessen Horowitz), Accel, GV (formerly Google Ventures), Spark Capital, Thrive Capital, and Health Care Service Corporation.



We want your time here to be the most meaningful experience of your career. **Join us, and help change mental healthcare for the better.**


As Headway’s People Operations Associate, you’ll play an integral role in supporting our 500+ employees & 500+ contingent workers across the US. We’re looking for a gritty, relationship-obsessed team player to support Headway’s human hypergrowth to galvanize our progress towards our mission.



As an early member of the People Ops function, you’ll have direct exposure to all dimensions of People Operations in this high-visibility role, though initial focus will primarily be on the areas below. This is an exceptional opportunity for someone interested in developing their People Ops toolkit in a dynamic, high-growth and mission-driven environment.


**Join us, and make an impact.**



As Headway’s People Operations Associate, you’ll play an integral role in supporting our 500+ employees & 500+ contingent workers across the US. We’re looking for a gritty, relationship-obsessed team player to support Headway’s human hypergrowth to galvanize our progress towards our mission.



As an early member of the People Ops function, you’ll have direct exposure to all dimensions of People Operations in this high-visibility role, though initial focus will primarily be on the areas below. This is an exceptional opportunity for someone interested in developing their People Ops toolkit in a dynamic, high-growth and mission-driven environment.


**You will:**


* Manage onboarding and offboarding SOPs of full time employees and contingent workers, identifying ways to improve and scale

Lead our People Tickets Infrastructure * - including triage and ensuring coverage in most People ops AORs


**You’d be a great fit if:**


* You have a minimum of 2-years of experience working on an HR/people team at a high growth technology start-up in an operational capacity
* You love to build new things and are extremely passionate about building relationships
* You have a curiosity and drive to learn the ins and outs of People Ops
* You can multitask and work quickly without sacrificing attention to detail
* You are resourceful and ready to help others whenever needed


**Compensation and Benefits:**


* Salary information is based on a single salary target per role and is differentiated based on geographic location (Group A, B, or C)
	+ Group A = NYC/Tri-State Area, SF/Bay Area, LA Area, Seattle, Boston, Austin, and San Diego
	+ Group B = Chicago, Miami, Denver, Washington DC, Philadelphia, Atlanta, Minneapolis, Nashville, Sacramento, Phoenix, and Portland
	+ Group C = All remaining cities
+ Group A: $85,000
+ Group B: $76,500
+ Group C: $68,000
+ Examples of cities located in each Compensation Grouping:
* Benefits offered include:
+ Equity Compensation
+ Medical, Dental, and Vision coverage
+ HSA / FSA
+ 401K
+ Work-from-Home Stipend
+ Therapy Reimbursement
+ 16-week parental leave after you have been employed with Headway for 12 months (non-exempt employees must have worked at least 1,250 hours)
+ Carrot Fertility annual reimbursement and membership
+ 13 paid holidays each year as well as a Holiday Break during the week between December 25th and December 31st
+ Unlimited PTO
+ Employee Assistance Program (EAP)
+ Training and professional development

We believe a team's strength is in its people, and we cannot achieve this mission without a team that reflects the diversity of this problem - across race, ethnicity, gender, sexuality, age, national origin, religion, family status, disability, military status, and experience.



Headway is committed to the full inclusion of all qualified individuals. As part of this commitment, Headway will ensure that persons with disabilities are provided with reasonable accommodations. If reasonable accommodation is needed to participate in the job application or interview process, to perform essential job functions, and/or receive other benefits and privileges of employment, please contact talent@findheadway.com



Headway employees work remotely across the US, with the option to work from offices in New York City and San Francisco. Headway participates in E-Verify. To learn more, click here.

title: People Generalist, Fulfillment Operations
description:
As a member of the ShipBob Team, you will benefit from an environment where everything is achievable. We aim to be a place where you can:


* **Write Your Career Story**. Because we are solving some of the most difficult problems in global commerce, you have the opportunity to write the story that will make your career.
* **Experience Global Impact and Global Connection.** At ShipBob we benefit from diverse cultures and perspectives in service of the global community.
* **Grow With An Ownership Mindset.** We believe that great innovation comes from great transparency. We are more resilient and more creative when we have an inclusive and transparent culture where everyone knows our strengths and opportunities.


**Title:** People Generalist, Fulfillment Operations


**Shift:** M-F, 2:00 pm-11:00 pm, with overtime as needed


**Location:** Bethlehem, PA


**Role Description:**



The People Generalist, Fulfillment Operations is a hands-on role that serves as the People Team representative providing full cycle Human Resources support within our ShipBob Innovation and Fulfillment Centers. As the primary point of contact for employees and managers, you will be supporting our teams with specialized employee relations matters, conflict and performance management, career planning, and more. In addition, as a People Generalist, Fulfillment Operations you will work closely with our business leaders to execute HR initiatives and strategies to drive organizational effectiveness, employee engagement, workforce planning, and compliance within your assigned location.


**What you'll do:**


* Serve as the first point of contact for employees to resolve issues and conduct investigations partnering with People Team Leadership, HRBPs, and Legal as needed.
* Maintain accurate and up-to-date human resource records and documentation, upholding compliance guidelines and regulations by performing periodic audits.
* Train, coach, and counsel managers on people matters.
* Partner with 3rd party staffing agency on-site representative to ensure proper staffing.
* Participate in recruiting events and career fairs both onsite and offsite.
* Source, schedule, coordinate and conduct new employee interviews for hourly roles.
* Facilitate new hire onboarding training and ensure new hires are processed correctly with all required paperwork and approvals being completed properly.
* Conduct new hire check-ins with all associates.
* Participate in ShipBob Culture Committee and support Employee Resource Groups (ERGs).
* Establish, plan, coordinate, and participate in employee retention efforts at assigned location in partnership with site General Manager.
* Host employee office hours / open door hours
* Facilitate the smooth exit of employees by maintaining a consistent offboarding process to include acting as the HR representation during involuntary separation meetings and conducting exit interviews with voluntary separations.
* Track employee attendance and manage disciplinary write-ups.
* Participate in the progressive discipline and PIP process for associates within assigned location.
* Provide support and communication to employees regarding new People Team initiatives and programs, including the yearly open enrollment process.
* Presents at assigned site's monthly town hall and start-up meetings.
* Monitor, address, and communicate key people metrics monthly with site leadership.
* Administer periodic employee satisfaction surveys and compile results as scheduled by the company.
* Provide training and resources to the onsite Leadership team.
* Process accident paperwork in support of workers compensation claims.
* Additional duties, projects, and responsibilities as necessary or assigned by the HRBP and the People Leadership team.


**What you'll bring to the table:**


* Bachelor's degree in Human Re sources or Business related field; or equivalent combination of education and experience; or SPHR/PHR, SHRM-CP Certified.
* Solid understanding of Labor related laws and statutes.
* Prior experience working in a fulfillment center, warehouse, or manufacturing facility.
* Ability to understand and interpret data as well as the ability to make recommendations and take action utilizing that data.
* Must be able to manage highly confidential information.
* Able to work in a fast-paced, highly energized and open environment and work with all levels of management.
* Solid presentation and speaking skills to a wide range of group sizes.
* Must have stellar interpersonal skills (written and verbal).
* Proficient in using MS Office, Excel, and data related tools.
* Ability to work independently, requiring minimal direction.
* Ability to travel required.


**Classification:** Non Exempt


**Reports to:** Manager, North America People Operations


**Perks & Benefits:**


* Medical, Dental, Vision & Basic Life Insurance
* Paid Maternity/Parental Leave Program
* Flexible Time Off Program
* Paid Sick Leave and Paid Emergency Leave
* Floating Holidays (2 days/year)
* Wellness Days (1 day/quarter)
* 401K Match
* Competitive Salary and Performance Bonus
* Variety of voluntary benefits, such as, short term disability
* Referral Bonus Program
* Fun Culture >>> Check us out on Instagram (@lifeatshipbob)


***ShipBob believes in transparency while providing a competitive total compensation package with a pay for performance approach. The expected base pay range for this position is $65,000 - $94,000.***


We recognize that people come with a wealth of experience and talent beyond just the technical requirements of a job. If your experience is close to what you see listed here, please still consider applying. Diversity of experience and skills combined with passion is a key to innovation and excellence; therefore, we encourage people from all backgrounds to apply to our positions.


**About You:**



At ShipBob, we're looking to bring on board people who embody our core values:


* Be **Mission-Driven.** We want team members that are passionate about helping entrepreneurs improve their business, and bring that passion every day.
* Be **Humble**. We have ambitious goals, and our team members understand that success or failure depends on us working together and leaving egos at the door.
* Be **Resilient.** Logistics is a complicated business. So is software. We value team members that never give up and keep iterating until a problem is solved.
* Be a **Creative Problem Solver.** As a startup, we value smart, innovative solutions to complex problems. We fall in love with the problem, not our "favorite" solution.
* **Be Safety Minded.** It's not just talk; it's the way you work.


**About Us:**



ShipBob is a cloud-based logistics platform that partners with thousands of e-commerce businesses to help make their entrepreneurial dreams a reality. We offer a full suite of fulfillment solutions for our merchants, including the ability to improve their transit times, shipping costs and deliver a best in class experience to their customers.



As one of the fastest growing tech companies in Chicago backed by blue-chip investors like Menlo Ventures, Bain Capital Ventures, Hyde Park Venture Partners and SoftBank Vision Fund 2, our goal is to continue to be the best fulfillment technology in the industry.


*ShipBob provides equal employment opportunities to all employees and applicants for employment and prohibits discrimination and harassment of any type without regard to race, color, religion, age, sex, national origin, disability status, genetics, protected veteran status, sexual orientation, gender identity or expression, or any other characteristic protected by federal, state or local laws.*


*This policy applies to all terms and conditions of employment, including recruiting, hiring, placement, promotion, termination, layoff, recall, transfer, leaves of absence, compensation and training.*

title: HR Generalist
description:
**Title:** Human Resources Generalist

**Department:** Human Resources

**Direct Supervisor:** Senior Director, Human Resources

**General Summary:** This position serves to support the Human Resources Department and the company. The Human Resources Generalist is responsible for the day-to-day needs of the HR Department. The HR Generalist is the first point of contact for the company and is responsible for keeping the department running.

**Essential Functions:**

* Provides direct support to the Human Resources Department.
* Facilitates employment-related processes for new and current employees.
* Regularly tracks and manages record database for all internal and field personnel (500+ employees).
* Oversees and tracks all sick, vacation and benefit accruals and usage. Works closely with third-party payroll provider (i.e., Entertainment Partners) and the Accounting Department to verify employee vacation, sick and leave days.
* Advises staff on leave policies and requests for time off.
* Administers company health benefit plans. Serves as main contact for benefits plan questions, maintains all enrollment paperwork, coordinates open enrollment, and processes all benefit changes.
* Maintains handbooks, company safety policies, and compliance materials.
* Works with payroll and health benefits providers to ensure that the providers receive appropriate employee paperwork, and that employees can enroll in appropriate plans.
* Familiarizes new and current employees with company policies, procedures, and benefits.
* Maintains relationships with key employees to ascertain necessary production and employee information including employment start dates, rates, and end dates.
* Maintains multiple tracking spreadsheets simultaneously.
* Recruits, schedules interviews, and facilitates the hiring of qualified job applicants for open positions; collaborates with department managers to understand skills and competencies required for openings.
* Coordinates, schedules, and implements new hire orientation.
* Performs routine tasks required to administer and execute human resource programs including compensation, benefits, state and federal leaves, safety, and compliance.
* Addresses employment-related inquiries from applicants, employees, and supervisors, referring complex and/or sensitive matters to the appropriate staff.
* Provides employee history, rate checks, and employment status for inquiring supervisors.
* Provides verbal phone confirmation for employee verification checks, as well as completing written verifications.
* Researches and maintains knowledge of trends, best practices, regulatory changes, and recent technologies in human resources, talent management, and employment law.
* Completes various tasks and projects as needed for the Senior Director, Human Resources.

**Other Duties & Responsibilities:**

* Handles highly confidential information with a high degree of professionalism and discretion.
* Ability to multi-task and manage several ongoing projects simultaneously.
* Ability to maintain a high level of organization.
* Great follow-through and the ability to anticipate upcoming work needs.
* Ability to communicate with staff at all levels.
* Excellent written and oral communication skills.
* This position requires frequent contact with high-level executives.
* Must be extremely self-motivated and comfortable working independently and in a group setting.
* Heavy e-mail and phone correspondence.
* This position is hourly with minimal overtime as deemed necessary.

**Qualifications:**

* Bachelor’s degree in Human Resources or a related field preferred.
* 1-3 years of HR Generalist experience.
* Must be proficient in Microsoft Office (Excel, PowerPoint, Word).
* Knowledge of the entertainment industry is not required but a plus.
* Must be comfortable with the Macintosh Operating Systems.

**Physical Demands:**

* This position is a sedentary role, must be able to sit or stand for the duration of their shift.
* While performing the duties of this position, the employee is regularly required to talk or hear.
* This role would require the ability to lift files, open filing cabinets and bend or stand on a stool as necessary.

**Work Environment:**

* This position operates in a remote or hybrid environment.
* This position routinely uses standard office equipment such as computers, phones, photocopiers, filing cabinets and fax machines.
* This position will not require travel.
* This position does not require the use of a company or personal vehicle for work-related tasks.
* This is a full-time position. Position hours are from 9:30 AM – 6:00 PM.

**Classification:** Non-Exempt

Job Type: Full-time

Pay: $27.00 - $32.00 per hour

Expected hours: 40 per week

Benefits:

* 401(k)
* 401(k) matching
* Dental insurance
* Health insurance
* Life insurance
* Paid jury duty
* Paid time off
* Vision insurance

Schedule:

* 8 hour shift
* Monday to Friday
* Overtime

People with a criminal record are encouraged to apply

Work Location: Remote

title: HR Assistant- Internship Operations Coordinator
description:
### **Que Technology Group is a small, minority-owned IT company based in Baltimore, MD. We have an internship program that is ongoing until graduation. This position is an HR Assistant position with a focus on overseeing our internship program.**

**We provide real-world work experience to college students of all majors. The goal of the internship program is to serve as a bridge between the IT field and college students, while providing them opportunities to grow their skillset and receive mentoring guidance from the team.**

**As a part-time employee, we offer great perks, such as flexible hours between Monday-Friday, and company-sponsored events.**


### **If you are looking for a great team to work with, and a place where you can utilize your skills and expand your skillset, QTG is the place for you!**


### **Review the description below, and if this sounds like you, let us know!**


### **Internship Operations Coordinator Responsibilities:**


### **The Internship Operations Coordinator is responsible for overseeing the Internship Program. Duties include, but are not limited to:**


* ### **Taking the lead on ensuring the Internship Program is running smoothly and meeting strategic goals**
* ### **Collaborating with Internship Administrative Coordinator on management duties**
* ### **Collaborating with different departments in the company to generate intern tasking and to see how the internship program may be able to support those departments**
* ### **Maintaining intern databases, Microsoft Teams site and other platforms used for the internship program**
* ### **Monitoring intern performance to ensure they are meeting all internship requirements and staying in compliance**
* ### **Collecting and analyzing feedback from the interns to brainstorm and plan new activities and initiatives**
* ### **Serving as a coordinator between College Career Centers, Senior Staff, and Intern Alumni for internship initiatives**
* ### **Ensuring all interns have meaningful and relevant work from week to week; gathering information on interns’ personal interests and incorporating that into the internship program**
* ### **Assisting with sourcing and recruitment of interns as needed**
* ### **Planning intern team events and outings to increase intern engagement and create meaningful one-on-one relationships between the interns and the team**
* ### **Collaborating with the Internship Administrative Coordinator and Human Resources Department to brainstorm new internship initiatives, and to provide ongoing support to current initiatives by participating in weekly meetings**
* ### **Formalizing Internship processes by way of creating Standard Operating Procedure documents**
* ### **Overseeing Intern-Alumni Networking LinkedIn group**
* ### **Overseeing the production of the Company Quarterly Newsletter**
* ### **Completing onboarding for new hires**
* ### **Assisting the Human Resources Department as needed**

### **Skills/Abilities:**


* ### **Strong leadership and coaching skills**
* ### **Excellent verbal and written communication skills in a team setting**
* ### **Experience in working with college students and alumni is a plus**
* ### **Exceptional time management and organization skills**
* ### **Exceptional attention to detail**
* ### **Takes initiative in all situations, both in working independently and in a team setting**
* ### **Fast learner who can easily adapt to new situations and learn new skills**
* ### **Open minded and creative thinker who will contribute new ideas to continue to grow internship program**
* ### **Familiarity with Microsoft Office365 (Excel Online, Word Online, Outlook, Teams, Powerpoint, etc.)**

### **Position Information:**


* ### **$14.00/hour**
* ### **15 hours per week**
* ### **Flexible hours Mon-Fri**
* ### **Location: Remote work - Must have a permanent home address in the states of** **MD or GA**

### **Candidates must meet the following requirements:**


* ### **Must have a permanent address in a HubZone area and must provide address verification documents**
* ### **Meet 15-hour per week commitment**
* ### **60 hours per month requirement**
* ### **Meet weekly report deadlines by 5pm each Friday**
* ### **Submit timesheets by due date on a bi-weekly basis**

### **We would love to have you join our family! Reach out to us to see how we can connect. Also, visit our website at www.qtg-hq.com, and connect with us on LinkedIn and Twitter!**

**We are an equal opportunity employer, and all qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity or expression, pregnancy, age, national origin, disability status, genetic information, protected veteran status, or any other characteristic protected by law.**

title: Program Manager, Diversity, Equity, and Inclusion
description:
KAYAK, part of Booking Holdings (NASDAQ: BKNG), is the world's leading travel search engine. With billions of queries across our platforms, we help people find their perfect flight, stay, rental car, cruise, or vacation package. We're also transforming the in-travel experience with our app and new accommodation software. For more information, visit www.KAYAK.com.



As an employee of KAYAK, you will be part of a global network that includes OpenTable and KAYAK's portfolio of metasearch brands including Swoodoo, checkfelix, momondo, Cheapflights, Mundi and HotelsCombined. Many employees are dedicated to one brand, but we all have the benefit of using each others strengths and insights. Together, we're able to help people experience the world through dining and travel.



The Program Manager of DEI will collaborate, build, and execute programs that strengthen the OpenTable | KAYAK commitment to diversity and inclusion. This role will implement the OK DEI strategy in alignment with Booking Holdings Inc. objectives to increase diversity, equity, and inclusion capabilities in the workplace.

  


**In this role, you will:**

* Researches, develops, recommends, and executes creative, bespoke strategies to foster and reinforce OK's diversity and inclusion goals
* Develops and manages programs and forums to strengthen DEI proficiency across the teams and at all levels
* Partners with Learning & Development to develop and/or acquire training and development to aid DEI initiatives
* Partners with Talent Aquisition to create and implement recruiting and hiring strategies to attract employees from diverse backgrounds
* Leads ERG program, ensuring a self-sustaining model with capability to support the BHI and OK DEI strategy and objectives


	+ Serve as a trusted advisor and coach for the ERG leaders (incl. co-chairs and executive sponsors) and members
	+ Manage ERG budgets and facilitate annual planning process
	+ Develop and enhance metrics that measure ERG impact
* Manages employee learning and dialogue platforms - Speaker Series, Digital Learning Journey, Onboarding, etc. - in collaboration with partners, such as Internal Communications, People Partners, ERG Executive Sponsors, and Legal
* Maintains knowledge of diversity-related issues, legislation, and best practices
* Acts as consultant to the business for internal and external DEI messaging (eg Internal Communications, Marketing, People & Culture, etc.)

  




**Please apply if:**

* 5+ years of experience focused on diversity, equity, and inclusion
* Desire for continued personal learning and development
* Passionate about promoting DEI
* Ability to balance multiple business priorities
* Experience operating in a global environment with appreciation of cultural differences, and ability to build consensus across geographies and business units
* Experience building business cases and presenting to various stakeholders, including senior leadership
* Excellent interpersonal and communication skills (research, writing, editing, presentation, speaking) with the ability to quickly build credibility and influence
* Self motivated and successful in operating independently with limited oversight
* Analytical approach, with ability to draw actionable insights from data

  




**Benefits:**


* Generous paid vacation
* Day off on your birthday
* Company matched retirement plans
* Health, dental and vision insurance plans
* Flexible Spending Accounts
* Headspace Subscription
* Drinks, coffee, snacks, games etc.
* Weekly Catered Lunches
* Free massages from professional massage therapists
* Universal Paid Parental Leave

  




There are a variety of factors that go into determining a salary range, including but not limited to external market benchmark data, geographic location, and years of experience sought/required. The range for this United States located role is $95,000 - $123,000.



In addition to a competitive base salary, roles are eligible for additional compensation and benefits including: annual cash bonus; health benefits; flexible spending account; retirement benefits; life insurance; paid time off (including PTO, paid sick leave, medical leave, bereavement leave, floating holidays and paid holidays); and parental leave and benefits.

  


**Diversity and Inclusion**



We aspire to have a workplace that reflects all of the diverse communities we serve. We know that when we have diverse teams we produce more creative ideas, products, and better outcomes for our team members. OpenTable/KAYAK is proud to be an Equal Opportunity Employer, and we welcome and encourage candidates from all backgrounds and experiences to apply for roles on our team. Whoever you are, just be you.



We will ensure that individuals with disabilities are provided reasonable accommodation to participate in the job application or interview process, to perform job responsibilities, and to receive other benefits and privileges of employment. Please contact us to request accommodation.

  



#LI-BG1

title: HR Manager
description:
Described as the "Uber of Content", Social Native is a marketplace technology company that empowers marketers to create, source, and optimize authentic visual content in the most efficient way possible. Leveraging the world's first AI-powered creative platform, brands such as Unilever, Adidas, L'Oréal, Crocs, and Nestlé Waters partner with Social Native to improve the performance of their paid and organic social strategy with a combination of Influencer Marketing, Custom Content, and Content Editing solutions. With our acquisition of Olapic, we're changing the way marketers evaluate, refine, and optimize their visual content strategy. This move solidifies our goal of delivering an all-in-one platform providing brands with data-driven insights, scales content creation, measures the impact of their work, and optimizes content and influencer strategy for even greater results.



We are seeking a highly motivated and experienced Human Resources Manager to join our team. This is an opportunity to play a pivotal role in shaping our HR practices and policies. Reporting directly to the Acting Head of Business Operations, who possesses a background in HR, you will have the unique opportunity to leverage their expertise while independently managing the HR function.


**Key Responsibilities:**


**Recruitment and Staffing:** Manage the entire recruitment process, including job postings, interviews, and onboarding.


**Performance Management:** Work with managers to effectively evaluate and improve employee performance.


**Employee Relations:** Serve as the primary contact for all employee-related matters, resolving conflicts and fostering a positive work environment.


**Compliance and Policy Development:** Ensure compliance with all legal and regulatory requirements; develop and update HR policies and procedures.


**Training and Development:** Identify training needs and organize employee development programs.


**Benefits and Compensation:** Administer employee benefits programs and manage compensation structures.


**Data Management and Reporting:** Maintain HR records and provide reports to the Head of Business Operations.

 **Qualifications:**


* Bachelor’s degree in Human Resources, Business Administration, or related field.
* Minimum of 5 years of HR experience, preferably in a leadership role.
* Excellent understanding of HR functions and best practices.
* Strong verbal and written communication skills.
* Ability to work independently and manage multiple priorities.
* SHRM-CP or SHRM-SCP certification preferred.

  


**Social Native Perks:**



One of the best perks of Social Native is working with amazing talented people! Come see what it’s like to work at a fast-paced, venture-backed tech company. We are looking for smart, driven, fun people who are eager to take ownership of exciting projects and be a part of building something great.


* Attractive health, dental, and vision insurance coverage
* Competitive Compensation
* 401(k) Retirement Plan
* Unlimited Vacation Policy
* Flexible Work Hours

title: Senior Manager, HR Business Partner
description:
**Who We Are**



Babylist is the leading digital destination for growing families. For over a decade, Babylist has been the technology solution for expecting parents and the community that supports them, expanding from baby registry into a full-service platform that helps parents make decisions with confidence, stay connected and build happy and healthy families. Every year Babylist helps over 9M people make purchases through its registry, app, ecommerce shop and comprehensive product guides. The Babylist ecosystem now includes Babylist Health, which provides access to products and services including insurance-covered breast pumps, Expectul, a new voice in health and wellness for pre-pregnancy through postpartum care, and The Push, a branded content studio that works with the biggest companies in the baby space. With over 59M monthly pageviews and 1.2M TikTok followers, Babylist is a generational brand leading the $88 billion baby product industry. To learn more about Babylist's registry options, editorial content and more, visit www.babylist.com


**Our Ways of Working**



We have team members located across the United States spanning multiple time zones. This means we put in extra effort to make sure we connect and collaborate in ways that make sense for us. We know how valuable the flexibility of remote work is for our employees.



We know that personal connection is the foundation for the great work we do together. In order to build those relationships with team members in other cities, we meet with coworkers in person two times a year at a full company offsite and a departmental offsite. These offsites are expected of employees and are great opportunities to meet the people you work with every day and to do some of the work that is much more difficult to do virtually.


**What the Role Is**



The Senior Manager, HR Business Partner is responsible for driving talent and business outcomes for leaders and teams across Babylist. You will own and execute important strategic initiatives across areas such as organizational design, organizational development, compensation, performance management, training, and employee relations. You will not be afraid to challenge the status quo. You thrive with ambiguity and can translate complex issues into clear and coherent solutions. Reporting to the VP, People, you will collaborate with leaders to understand business objectives and challenges and use data to inform potential solutions that live our values and propel our business forward!


**Who You Are**


* 10+ years of experience in HR with the last 3 years in an HRBP role engaging with multiple levels to C-suite within a high growth tech company
* Extensive generalist background with experience in talent and organizational development, employee relations, performance management, compensation, and employment law
* Trustworthy, expert collaboration skills and team mentality
* High proficiency in data judgment and strong ability to analyze, interpret and communicate data effectively and responsibly in order to drive business outcomes
* Excellent communication skills, including the ability to write clearly and succinctly in a variety of modalities and formats
* Strong strategic consulting and relationship management skills that enable collaboration and networking both within the HR function and throughout the organization
* Extensive knowledge of state and federal employment laws and standards


**How You Will Make An Impact**


* Work closely with leaders to understand, recommend, and implement programs and structure in growing teams
* Leverage deep understanding of the business strategy and goals to provide insight and leadership into organizational effectiveness, talent planning, and talent development
* Provide expertise, creative problem solving, and coaching to leaders who are managing highly sensitive and complex employee relations matters
* Proactively analyze and identify complex people issues and trends and recommend appropriate actions
* Anticipate training & development needs, develop plans & programs, and then coordinate implementation
* Thoughtfully collaborate with recruiting teams and hiring managers in proactive management of compensation packages and bonus plans
* Own end-to-end change management process and planning associated with reorganizations, leadership and other transformational initiatives impacting the employee experience
* Partner with team leaders on team offsite planning and curriculum development


**Why You Will Love Working At Babylist**


* We invest in the infrastructure you'll need to be supported and successful: tools, opportunities to connect with colleagues, and a stipend to help you set up your office
* We build products that have a positive impact on millions of people's lives
* We work at a sustainable pace which means work/life balance is a real thing here
* We believe technology and data can solve hard problems
* We believe in exceptional management
* We are an antiracist organization and doing the work to support differences of all kinds
* We offer competitive pay and meaningful opportunities for career advancement
* We have great benefits like company paid medical, dental, and vision, a generous paid parental leave policy, and 401k with company match
* We care about employee wellbeing with perks for physical, mental and emotional health, parenting, childcare, and financial planning


Babylist takes a market-based approach to pay, and pay may vary depending on your location. Your actual base salary will depend on factors such as your skills, qualifications, experience, and work location.


The estimated pay range for this role is $121,500.00 - $177,450.00



In addition, Babylist offers equity, bonus, and benefits, including company paid health, dental and vision insurance, 401(k) matching, flexible spending account, and paid leave (including PTO and parental leave) in accordance with our applicable plans and policies.


*If your experience is close to what we're looking for, please consider applying. Experience comes in many forms – skills are transferable, and passion goes a long way. We know that diversity makes for the best problem-solving and creative thinking, which is why we're dedicated to adding new perspectives to the team and encourage everyone to apply.*


***IMPORTANT NOTICE: Our company takes the security and privacy of job applicants very seriously. We will never ask for payment, bank details, or personal financial information as part of the application process. All of our legitimate job postings can be found on our official career site. Please be cautious of job offers that come from non-company email addresses (@babylist.com), instant messaging platforms or unsolicited calls.***

  



#bi-remote

title: Sr. Manager, Learning & Development
description:
With millions of diners, tens of thousands of restaurants, and 23+ years of experience, OpenTable, part of Booking Holdings, Inc. (NASDAQ: BKNG), is an industry leader with a unique insight into the world of hospitality. We champion restaurants, bars, wineries, and other venues around the world, helping them attract guests, manage capacity, improve operations and increase revenue.



Every employee at OpenTable has a tangible impact on what we do and how we do it. You'll also be part of a global network that includes OpenTable and KAYAK's portfolio of travel brands including Swoodoo, checkfelix, momondo, Cheapflights, Mundi and HotelsCombined.



Hospitality is all about taking care of others, and it defines our culture. You'll work in a welcoming and inclusive environment, and get the benefits, flexibility, and support you need to succeed.



The Sr. Manager, Learning & Development is responsible for developing innovative and engaging learning experiences, helping our employees reach their full potential through skills and capabilities development.



Reporting to the Sr. Director of People Experience, this role manages and coordinates organization-wide efforts to ensure that a comprehensive set of learning & development programs are created and implemented for the purpose of retaining, growing, and engaging a high performance workforce. The Sr. Manager, Learning & Developement will design, deliver, and continuously improve development initiatives that align with organizational goals. This position will build development experiences while using data and analytics to set priorities for improvements aligned with ongoing strategic goals.

  


**In this role, you will:**

* Design, build and oversee internal L&D programs including identifying performance, skills, and/or behavior gaps, making recommendations, and providing solutions to improve business performance and develop future leaders by partnering closely with HR Business Partners and business leaders.
* Partner and collaborate closely with other functions within People and Culture (HR Business Partners, DEI, Talent Acquisition, Talent Programs, and Operations) by supporting and providing learning resources/guides to the entire employee lifecycle - onboarding, career development, team building, manager development, and leadership development programs.
* Manage the Learning Management System (LMS) and infrastructure for all L&D programs by establishing methods and procedures for delivery, evaluation measurement, and reporting.
* Manage project execution including coordination of logistics, managing materials, and providing a critical eye to ensure content is ready for distribution.
* Research, manage, evaluate, and maximize the L&D vendors, including relationship management, usage tracking, budget, employee satisfaction, and impact on the organization's needs.
* Continually evaluate and gain feedback on L&D content to ensure focus on improvement, results, and business impact.

  




**What's required to be successful in the role:**


* Expertise in Learning & Development, Training, Organizational Development or similar field including experience facilitating in-person and remote training programs
* Experience designing in-house, customized training programs
* Experience and fluency in instructional design or course design tools and methods

  




**Please apply if:**

* Ability to apply modern adult learning principles to effectively engage an audience and lead training sessions for groups of varying skill levels
* Experience managing an L&D function, including providing guidance and development for a small team
* Dynamic and engaging facilitator
* Experienced in training design and delivery utilizing a variety of mediums
* Excellent written and verbal communication skills with high emotional intelligence, and executive presence
* Hands-on experience with Learning Management Systems (LMS)
* Experience in partnering with the business, understanding priorities, and translating them into relevant and impactful learning content

  




**A few of the benefits you get at OpenTable:**


* Work from (almost) anywhere; wherever you do your best work
* Focus on mental health and well-being
* Company paid therapy sessions through SpringHealth
* Company paid subscription to HeadSpace
* Company-wide weeks off each year - the whole team fully recharges (and returns without a pile-up of work!)
* Generous paid parental leave
* Generous paid vacation + time off for your birthday
* Paid volunteer time
* Health, dental & vision plans
* 401k with company match
* Focus on your career growth
* Enriched learning and development opportunities
* Leadership development
* Access to thousands of on-demand e-learnings

  




There are a variety of factors that go into determining a salary range, including but not limited to external market benchmark data, geographic location, and years of experience sought/required. The range for this United States located role is$140,000 - $182,000.



In addition to a competitive base salary, roles are eligible for additional compensation and benefits including: annual cash bonus; health benefits; flexible spending account; retirement benefits; life insurance; paid time off (including PTO, paid sick leave, medical leave, bereavement leave, floating holidays and paid holidays); and parental leave and benefits.

  


**Diversity, Equity, and Inclusion**



OpenTable aspires to be a workplace that reflects the diverse communities we serve and a culture that is inclusive and welcoming. Hiring people with different backgrounds, experiences, perspectives, and ideas is critical to innovation and to how we deliver great experiences for our users and our partners. Representation matters.



We ensure that individuals with disabilities are provided reasonable accommodation to participate in the job application or interview process, to perform job responsibilities, and to receive other benefits and privileges of employment. Please contact us to request accommodation.

  



#LI-Remote



"Remote work allowed"

title: Training Manager
description:
We are looking for a progressive and dynamic Training Manager, ready to hit the ground running using their tools and impressive style supporting Maryland Department of Health.



The Training Manager will play a key role in the successful implementation and adoption of a large multi-vendor, modular health care system implementation. The Training Manager must apply training management strategies and methods to meet business, schedule and budget objectives. This person will coordinate with client and vendors to develop training related to the integration hub and portal. The primary focus will be to coordinate with project and organizational change management to develop a Medicaid Enterprise training strategy related to adhering to project management processes and procedures. This person will oversee training to ensure the project team is familiar with architecture and governance standards while providing oversight for vendors as they manage solution-specific training development and delivery.


**Supervision**


* Reports to the Project Management Office Project Manager
* Work with the Organizational Change Manager and through others in the organization to succeed
* Support the project team in integrating training activities into their project plans
* Support and coach teams and vendors to ensure training is developed and delivered to support project success

**Roles and Responsibilities**


* Coordinate with vendors to develop and deliver training to staff related to the enterprise data integration hub and portal.
* Develop and deliver training to staff related to project management processes and procedures.
* Provide oversight to vendors as they develop solution-specific training.
* Coordinate training using a training calendar.
* Develop and propose methods of knowledge transfer (training, coaching, materials, etc.) to build skills and experience for staff as appropriate.
* Using documentation best practices and standards, establish and support training documentation repository.
* Coordinate with team, client and vendors to develop competency, skills, and tools necessary to develop sustainable project management and technical capabilities.
* Produce training deliverables timely and in accordance with contract deliverable instructions
* Develop and deliver a training strategy
* Provide training development and delivery related to enterprise data integration hub and portal
* Develop and deliver training related to the project management processes and procedures
* Maintain a training calendar
* Organize and maintain a training documentation repository
* Coordinate efforts with other leaders, team members, clients, and vendors
* Integrate training activities into project plan
* Evaluate and ensure user readiness through training
* Track and report issues
* Define and measure success metrics and monitor training progress


**Skills and Qualifications**


* 10-15 years’ relevant training experience, including a minimum of 3-5 years leading training staff and delivering training for large-scale efforts
* Bachelor’s Degree or equivalent work experience in training activities
* Thorough understanding of how people learn and retain new skills and information
* Practical experience in applying knowledge of training principles, methodologies, tools, and solutions
* Excellent facilitation and active listening skills
* Exceptional communication skills – both written and verbal
* Executive presence; ability to work effectively at all levels in an organization – strong organization behavior knowledge


**Additional Skills**


* Must be a team player and able to work with and through others
* Ability to influence others and move toward a common vision or goal
* Knowledge of and/or experience with health care or Medicaid Management Information System projects preferred

title: HR Manager - Payroll & Benefits
description:
### **The position**



Officengine is seeking an experienced & intellectually curious HR Manager - Payroll & Benefits to join our team and support the payroll, benefits & HR operations of our growing portfolio of clients. This role provides the curious, creative, entrepreneurial-minded candidate a significant opportunity to make an impact, not simply in shaping our clients’ operations but also in the development/refinement of a package of services we may offer future clients.



As a small team with a diverse client base, opportunities for learning and skills development present themselves daily. Adding to this, the legislative changes over the past ten years (ACA, Covid-19, Employee v. Independent contractors) and the HR Manager - Payroll & Benefits, will be busy researching, interpreting guidance, and in conjunction with Leadership, determining the necessity of disseminating this information and how processes/workflows may need adjustment. The ideal candidate will be a master communicator.



We're eager to hear from team players who roll up their sleeves to get the job done. Who have experience mentoring and coaching a team. Someone kind, filled with empathy, honesty, and passion for their work.


### **You have the opportunity to…**


* Become an expert in processing payroll using Rippling, Gusto, & ADP.
* Interact with clients on a cadence you define - to understand anticipated growth, pain points, and needs, recommending services as their business grows (required harassment training, sick time requirements, FMLA, 401k matching, FSA, etc)
* Interact with our client's employees - answering their questions, explaining tax forms, pay stubs, and guiding them through performing necessary actions within the HRIS/payroll system.
* Oversee project implementations involving HR-related software/tools.
* In time, hire, inspire, and coach a team of HR professionals
* Work closely with partners to extract the best outcomes for Officengine and our clients
* Become a subject-matter expert on all things People operations, payroll, benefits, wellness, and matters related to employee engagement.


### **Whom we're looking for…**


* 5+ years of relevant experience required.
* Expert communicator (verbal/non-verbal & written) required.
* Experience teaching, motivating, training, or coaching a team
* Required values/skills: empathy, honesty, curiosity, kindness, integrity, and passion/pride in your work.
* Must be a team player and self-motivated
* MS Office/Google Workspace experience.
* BS/BA degree required.


### **Bonus Points:**


* Licensed insurance agent
* Thrives in a remote work environment.

title: HR Systems & Analytics Manager (Hybrid)
description:
**About AESC US LLC**


AESC is a world-leading battery technology committed to research, development, design, manufacture and sales of high-power batteries for EVs and energy storage batteries. AESC has 4,000 employees and 10 production plants in Japan, the U.S., the U.K., China, France and Spain. For the past 12 years, AESC has produced high-performance, extended range batteries for hundreds of thousands of electric vehicles in 44 countries, achieving a record of “zero critical battery malfunction.”


AESC invests heavily in next-generation technology to drive innovation and works with its strategic partners to continually push the boundaries of performance, safety and efficiency. Its teams work with strategic partners to continuously improve the company’s global leadership in product development, quality and sustainable processes.


We are currently seeking candidates to fill a **HR Systems & Analytics Manager** located either in**Santa Clara, CA or Smyrna, TN**

**JOB SUMMARY**


The HR Systems and Analytics Manager is primarily responsible for managing the company’s end-to-end digitization of the Human Resources department. Lead the selection, integration and implementation of external platforms including a global Human Resources Information System (HRIS). Manage, support, and administer HRIS, software applications and related procedures, documentation, security, and reports. Configure and/or modify business processes and develop appropriate documentation for process and integration design, implementation, and test activities. Work closely with the IT team, business operations, and 3rd party providers. The HR Systems and Analytics Manager will be responsible to improve the overall integrity of HR data, ensuring that the employee data is accurate, up to date, and remains confidential. This position will collect, compile, and analyze HR data, metrics, and statistics to connect HR data to business outcomes.

**ESSENTIAL DUTIES AND RESPONSIBILITIES**


The following description of work to be performed by this individual is not intended to be all-inclusive. Rather, it focuses on the major tasks that must be accomplished.

* Leads the sourcing, selection, integration and implementation of a global Human Resources Information System (HRIS).
* Acts as the subject matter expert with development of HRIS, including resolving HRIS tickets timely, providing access, launching modules, building workflows, and creating long term solutions.
* Implements HR System modules including but not limited to talent management, payroll, talent development, benefits and shared services.
* Facilitates HRIS user success through training, development, communications, etc.
* Maintains the HRIS system by updating system settings, adding new features, building workflows, and troubleshooting issues.
* Designs, organizes, modifies, and supports information for process automation.
* Conducts research on industry best practices, trends, and standards to identify opportunities to optimize HRIS processes and workflows.
* Collaborates with IT to ensure HRIS system security and data integrity.
* Develop and maintain HR dashboards and analytics tools to streamline HR processes and provide actionable insights.
* Analyzes data and statistics for trends and patterns with attention to recruitment, hiring practices, motivation, turnover, and compliance with employment laws and regulations.
* Manages HR data, develop, and maintain HR reports, and provide insights to leadership on a monthly and quarterly basis.
* Identifies and recommends reasonable short- and long-term goals, milestones, and benchmarks for key performance metrics and develops a plan to modify or replace HRIS applications, modules, and systems to meet those objectives.
* Provide recommendations for hardware and software upgrades, as appropriate, to further improve operations, security and enhance value.
* Define performance metrics for measurement, comparison, and evaluation of key performance factors, such as cost, quality and delivery including benchmarking performance against peer groups.
* Build, foster and manage relationships with various bness stakeholders to ensure cohesive execution around company goals.
* Understands and follows all standards of IATF16949 and VDA 6.3 quality standards.
* Understands and follows all standards of ISO14001 environmental standards.

**OTHER JOB DUTIES (Not considered essential to the job)**


Performs all other related assignments (including special projects) as required in a professional and cooperative manner.

**MINIMUM QUALIFICATIONS (Education and Experience):**


The requirements listed below are minimum requirements for the job. Reasonable accommodationsmay be made to enable individuals with disabilities who are otherwise qualified to safely perform the essential functions of the job, unless such accommodation would impose an undue hardship on the Company.

**Minimum Qualifications – Experience**

* 5 years of experience managing, implementing, and supporting a global HRIS and related modules including but not limited to HR database, Applicant tracking, Onboarding, Performance management, Benefits administration, Workforce management, Time and attendance, Absence and leave management, Learning and development, Talent management, Succession planning, HR analytics, Payroll, and Employee self-service.
* HR data analysis in areas including job classification, compensation, recruitment, selection, training, employee benefits, and/or equal opportunity compliance environments.
* Thorough understanding of local, state, and federal laws in addition to multi-territory requirements to support employment, HR, and HR policies.
* Excellent time management skills and ability to plan and set priorities while managing multiple projects and prioritize workload effectively to meet deadlines.
* Strong attention to detail, with a commitment to accuracy and data integrity.
* Strong interpersonal skills in collaborating with cross-departmental stakeholders.
* Excellent verbal and written communication skills.
* Strong analytical and critical thinking skills.
* Excellent project management skills.

**Minimum Qualifications – Education**

* Bachelor’s degree in Human Resources, Business Administration, Computer Science, Data Analytics, or related field required.

**Computer Skills and Required Software Experience**

* Advanced proficiency with Microsoft Office Suite to include advanced Excel functionalities such as Formulas, V-Look Ups, Macros, Data manipulation and validation, and Pivot tables.
* Data visualization software such as Tableau or related to manipulate and analyze large data sets and produce insightful reports, dashboards and visualizations.
* HRIS systems knowledge such as: ADP, Workday, UKG, Paycor, Paylocity, etc.

**PHYSICAL REQUIREMENTS**

*The physical requirements described below are representative of those an employee must normally meet to successfully perform the essential functions of this job. Reasonable accommodations may be made to enable otherwise qualified individuals with disabilities to perform the essential job functions.*

* Ability to remain in stationary position 75% of the time.
* Ability to occasionally move about inside the office to access file cabinets, office machinery, etc.
* Ability to constantly operate a computer, calculator, copy machine, and computer printer.
* Ability to lift, push and / or pull up to 25 pounds.
* Ability to bend, lift and / or twist.

**WORK ENVIRONMENT**


The work environment is primarily an office setting. However, it is expected to provide support in an automated manufacturing facility with a concrete floor and is characterized by some temperature extremes, moderate noise and forklift traffic.


The individual must be able to perform all essential functions as appropriate on the plant floor, in meetings, and with employees, management, customers and suppliers.


The HR Systems and Analytics Manager must perform the essential duties and responsibilities with or without reasonable accommodation efficiently and accurately, and without causing significant safety threat to self or others. The statements made herein are intended to describe the general nature and level of work being performed by employees assigned to this job classification. They are not intended to be construed as an exhaustive and inclusive list of all responsibilities, duties, and/or skills required of personnel so classified.

**Equal Opportunity Employer**


All of us at Envision AESC – regardless of functional area or expertise – share a passion to design, manufacture, and sell high-performance products. It is our policy to provide Equal Employment Opportunity (EEO) to all persons regardless of race, gender, disability, or any other status protected by law. Candidates for this position must be legally authorized to work in the United States and will be required to provide proof of employment eligibility at the time of hire.


For more information, visit https://us.aesc-group.com/


www.tnectricjobs.com

**Salary starting at 100k**


"We participate in E-Verify will provide the federal government with your Form I-9 information to confirm that you are authorized to work in the U.S."
