title: HR Manager
description:
**About Miter**
---------------


Construction is in crisis. It's one of society’s largest and most important industries, yet its productivity growth has lagged the broader economy for several decades. It usually takes more time and money to build a bridge, road, or school in 2021 than it did in 1981. What gives?!

  

At Miter, our mission is to make it faster and cheaper to build infrastructure like bridges, roads, schools, and housing. We're leveraging recent breakthroughs in payments technology to build insanely great HR and finance software for contractors, helping them bid on more projects, make smarter decisions, and build stronger teams.

  

Miter's culture is rigorous, fast, and supportive. We believe in small, empowered teams. We insist on high standards and we win as a team.

**Role overview**
-----------------


Miter is hiring a customer-facing HR Manager who will serve as the de facto Head of HR for a subset of our customers. Our customers rely on Miter to navigate complex payroll, HR, and wage & hour issues, and you’ll ensure they have the knowledge, tools, and support required to build incredible teams.

 **You will:**

* Work with our customers to design company handbooks and policies
* Answer customers’ questions on wage & hour laws, prevailing wage/OSHA regulations, and other HR matters, or route them to experts within the Miter network
* Advise existing and prospective customers on ways to streamline HR processes, attract and retain talent, and eliminate risk
* Work with Miter’s product and engineering teams to design software that addresses our customers’ HR needs

 **You may be a fit for this role if you:**

* Have a professional HR certification (e.g., SHRM-CP, PHR)
* Have 3+ years of experience working in an HR Manager or CHRO role. Bonus points if you’ve worked with construction businesses
* Have strong verbal and written communication skills
* Enjoy and excel at researching answers to complex HR questions
* Work with passion, focus, and urgency

 **Our benefits:**

* Sponsored health plans
* 401(k) match
* Unlimited vacation
* Work where you want!

 **Our commitment to equal opportunity:**


Miter is proud to be an equal opportunity employer that values diversity. We do not discriminate based on race, color, national origin, ethnicity, religion or religious belief, sex (including pregnancy, childbirth, or related medical conditions), sexual orientation, gender, gender identity, gender expression, transgender status, sexual stereotypes, age, military or veteran status, disability, or other applicable legally protected characteristics. We also consider qualified applicants with criminal histories, consistent with applicable federal, state, and local laws. Miter is committed to providing reasonable accommodations for candidates with disabilities in our recruiting process.

title: Lean Manager
description:
**Our Mission**
---------------


At infoAnalytica, we strive to delight our customers’ every day by a “Stand up, commit and deliver” team rather than a “Do the best you can” team.


**Growth at infoAnalytica**
---------------------------


* An opportunity to work with Fortune 500 Clients, serviced globally
* Learn from and work with experts and industry leaders
* Practices and Processes are backed by right resources and technologies
* Foster transparency and facilitate collaboration amongst our teams
* An inclusive and diverse work environment that fosters growth
**Our Ethos**
-------------


* Own one’s work
* Do more with less
* Be Holistic, not myopic
* Earn trust and confidence
* Be a part of the solution, not the problem
* Impute
* Be a partner
* Deliver Results
* Pay attention to detail
* Focus on hiring and building grade A talent

  
**Some of the many benefits we provide our employees**
======================================================


Health Coverage For You & Your Family
In-House Gym
Training & Development Programs
In-House Cafe
Menstrual Leave Policy
  
### **Manager Leaning & Development (HR)**



InfoAnalytica Consulting provides critical market intelligence and valuable business insights to its global business clients. We have extensive expertise in Business & Financial Research and Analysis, Social Media Solutions, Marketing and Technology Consulting, and Content Development. Our clients include small, midsize and large (Fortune 500) companies in the U.S. and Europe. InfoAnalytica’ s philosophy is to provide actionable insights, solutions and content that deliver results in the applicable business space.



We understand the aspirations of our people, including prospective employees, and provide them with a conducive work environment and opportunities for growth in the research and consulting space.


### **Key responsibilities may include, but not limited to:**


* Helping the Company meet its objectives by conducting organizational needs analysis (technical, functional & soft skills), developing & implementing high impact learning & development programs/interventions in line with business needs and priorities to ensure that all employees have the required competencies to excel in their roles.
* Reviewing and revising course materials to ensure they are in line with operating processes, procedures, and systems.
* Developing content & delivering trainings (Soft Skills, Leadership, Communication, Interpersonal skills, Customer interactions, Writing skills, Motivation, Personal Effectiveness, TTT, etc.) to various parts of the business and working with various stakeholders to coordinate and organize training sessions.
* Collating feedback of completed training to evaluate and measure results and making improvements where required.
* Sourcing and recommending vendors and other external partners to design, develop, and / or deliver learning solutions where applicable**.**
* Implementing LMS & technology enabled innovations to support blended and digital learning.
* Coaching employees and helping them in applying training content to real life situations.
* Drive the employee engagement and employee communication initiatives to build a positive, cohesive & progressive work culture.

### **Ideal Profile:**


* 8-12 years of experience in a similar role with IT / ITES, KPO/BPO, Consulting companies
* Excellent presentation, communication and interpersonal skills, with the ability to interact and build credibility across all levels of the organization.
* Strong networker & relationship builder
* Experience of implementing and managing LMS and Technology solutions
* Strong attention to detail and deliver work that is of a high standard
* Highly goal driven and work well in fast paced environments

title: Human Resources Specialist
description:
**KEY AREAS** **DETAILS FOR RECRUITMENT, PERFORMANCE MANAGEMENT AND DEVELOPMENT RELATED ACTIVITIES**

  

  

**Job Title** HRBP – Factory

  

  

**Functional Job Title** Asst.Manager

  

  

**Department** Human Resources

  

  

**Reports to** Deputy Manager HRBP/ HEAD HR

  

  

**Scope** Factory related HR activites & Statutory Compliances

  

  

**Job Summary (Why does this Job Exist?)** Responsible for ensuring adherence to statutory compliances across NCL VEKA (Labour Laws, PF, Gratuity, ESIC…etc), contract managament, Time office, Admin & day to day factory HR activities

  

  

**Minimum Quailfication** Bachelors Degree/ MBA HR

  

  

**Experience** 5-7 years of relevant experience

  

  

**Location** Mucherla Village,

Hathnoora Mandal, Sangareddy District,



Hyderabad-502296

  


  

  

**Minimum Competencies**  

**(Knowledge and Skills)** Adherence to Statutory Compliances (application and renewal)
  

Thorough understanding of relevant statutory compliances / labour laws as applicable to the state and industry
  

Communicate details of labour laws to all stakeholders
  

Timely application of compliances / labour laws (PF, ESIC)
  

Renewal of labour licenses
  

Communicate, connect and collaborate with PF and ESIC departments / officials with regard to various activities (as applicable)
  

Design, Develop and Implement a process and ensure adherence to processes regarding PF and ESIC
  

Co-ordinate and stay connected with labour department and officials basis requirement
  

Stay updated with changes to any of the labour laws and communicate to all stakeholders internally and external
  

Collaborate with legal department to address issues if any and as applicable
  

Maintain a database of activities completed by the department and communicate the same to all verticals within HR and all relevant stakeholders

Communication Proficiency
  

Ethical Conduct, Personal Effectiveness and Credibility, Work life balance
  

Leadership, Critical thinking
  

Negotiation Skills and Influencing Skill / Persuasion Skills
  

Analytical ability and Problem Solving
  

Result Oriented – Ability to identify, understand, manage Customer Psychology
  

Must possess excellent written and oral communication skills
  

Ability to identify problems and develop creative solutions that minimize impact to project.

  

  

**Preferred Competencies** Fair, positive and empathetic persona
   

Dynamic and a self-motivated candidate
  

Team player with a strong focus on results
   

Demonstrated skills in conflict resolution and negotiation
  

Good command over oral and written communication skills both in English and Hindi
   

Willingness to travel (about 20% of time)
   

Strong Interpersonal and analytical skills
  

Proficient in use of computers  



  

  

  

**Primary Responsibilities/ Accountabilities** **Recruitment**
  

Getting the manpower requisition from various depts. wrt the current vacancies (replacement/new position, if any)
  

Verifying the requisition against sanctioned manpower department wise for both contract & company
  

Explore possibilities for hiring against vacancies.
  

Draft & circulation of notices for worker level vacancies.

Managing contractors deployed at plant.
  

Review manpower of contracts for various depts.
  

Review manpower assigned under various depts.
  

Explore contractors for deployment for meeting sanctioned manpower as and when required.
  

Regular interaction with contractors to ensure sanctioned manpower deployment on day to day basis.
  

Coordinate with Group company on manpower contract references

Formulation of templates and formats wrt to increments, rationalisation, service contracts, circulars, notices, inter office memos etc
  

ISO documentations

Approval of leaves in the system in case of administrative reportees and functional reportees on time.
  

Overseeing payroll function
  

**Training & Development**

Induction & orientation of new joinees
  

Ensure safety training at plant level on monthly basis.

Discussing employee issues individually to come up with amicable solutions.

Overseeing Factory Admin. Activities like Gardening, Civil, Housekeeping, Vehicle Parking, Gate movement of employees, Furniture & Fixtures, Seating arrangement of employees. b)Overseeing Indenting of Uniforms, Shoes, Monsoon Gears, etc for employees.

  

  

**Other Duties and Responsibilities** Other responsibilities related to initiatives as identified by the organization / management

title: Human Resources Manager
description:
**HR Operations Delivery Manager - ELC**
========================================

#### **Take your next career step at ABB with a global team that is energizing the transformation of society and industry to achieve a more productive, sustainable future. At ABB, we have the clear goal of driving diversity and inclusion across all dimensions: gender, LGBTQ+, abilities, ethnicity and generations. Together, we are embarking on a journey where each and every one of us, individually and collectively, welcomes and celebrates individual differences.**

  

You will be working as HR Operations Delivery Manager – ELC and reporting to HR Operations Hub Delivery Lead AMEA & NAM based in Bangalore, India. In this role you will be leading a team of 50 people and take full accountability for the end-to-end Employee Life Cycle Management process, delivering high-quality services against globally agreed performance targets. Ensuring a high degree of customer experience and driving its further enhancement. As part of the HR Operations organization, the HR Operations Delivery Manager supports the execution of the Global / Regional Roadmap and deliverables as well as further optimization of HR processes in close collaboration with the Global HR Service Lines. Demonstrates organizational awareness beyond his/her area of responsibility.

### **Your responsibilities**

* Contributing to developing the HR Operations Strategy and Roadmap and is committed to implementing the same. Planning the development of the operations and further refines the operating model and organizational structure
* Collaborating with other HR Operations Managers, HR Delivery Leads and HR Front Office Managers to achieve further efficiencies and to ensure consistency of management approaches. committing to building / strengthening ABB's brand recognition in the markets
* Taking accountability for end-to-end HR Operations across all supported locations. Delivering services according to signed-off processes, KPIs and quality targets. Ensuring all HR processes incorporate appropriate control mechanisms, including 4-eye-check / SOX checks, data protection and country legal/regulatory compliance tasks
* Ensuring a high degree of customer orientation. Driving the enhancement of the Customer Experience Journey, analyzing received customer feedback and driving actions accordingly.
* Building and maintaining sustainable relationships with key stakeholders like HR Operations Front Office, Country HR Managers, HRBPs, HR Expert Services/Corporate, other representatives and other stakeholders
* Driving people management strategy of HR Operations for a Hub and leading by example and the required cultural sensitivity. Setting targets and managing performance for direct reports. Collaborating with other HR Operations Managers to develop further efficiencies and to ensure consistency of management approaches
* Developing bench strength and succession plans for key roles within the team, understands the retention of individual top performers and takes appropriate action. Encouraging and supporting staff movements across organizational boundaries
* Working closely with HR Service Line Leads, Expert Services/Corporate and other HR service delivery teams to implement lean approaches to deliver efficiencies through process improvements, standardization and/or automation

### **Your background**

* Postgraduate / bachelor’s degree in any stream
* At least 12 plus years of experience in HR Shared Services in a global organization with a minimum of 5 years of experience as a People manager
* Ability to manage a team size of 25 plus members and to work in a fast-paced, multi-tasking, high-transaction team environment
* Hands-on experience in SAP and Workday knowledge will be advantageous. Ability to manage multiple demands on time and work with cross-functional teams
* High degree of structure and self-organization, deadline focused. Collaborative, solutions-oriented approach and strong analytical skills
* Proficiency in MS Office and excellent written and verbal communication skills. Attention to detail and ability to multitask and prioritize accordingly
* Excellent interpersonal skills with the ability to manage sensitive and confidential situations with tact and professionalism

### **More about us**


ABB’s shared services organization which delivers operational and expert services in Finance, Human Resources, Information Systems, Legal, Global Travel Services and external Customer Contact Centers. With employees based in five main hubs and front offices, GBS provides mainly Business services to ABB teams across the globe as well as supports with external customer inquiries. We look forward to receiving your application (documents submitted in English are appreciated). If you want to discover more about ABB, take another look at our website www.abb.com. It has come to our attention that the name of ABB is being used for asking candidates to make payments for job opportunities (interviews, offers). Please be advised that ABB makes no such requests. All our open positions are made available on our career portal for all fitting the criteria to apply. ABB does not charge any fee whatsoever for recruitment process. Please do not make payments to any individuals / entities in connection to recruitment with ABB, even if is claimed that the money is refundable. ABB is not liable for such transactions. For current open positions you can visit our career website https://global.abb/group/en/careers and apply. Please refer to detailed recruitment fraud caution notice using the link https://global.abb/group/en/careers/how-to-apply/fraud-warning Work model: on site #LI-onsite

title: Assistant Manager-anodizing
description:
**1. Candidate:**

description:
**Job Description**
**Designation: HR Manager (IT)**

Jewel Pro-Tech is a subsidiary of Diamond ICQ, a prestigious luxury diamond jewelry company headquartered in Hong Kong. We are totally product base company and aim to delivers tailored, cutting-edge technology for Diamond ICQ



\\_\\_\\_\\_\\_\\_\\_\\_\\_\\_\\_\\_\\_\\_\\_\\_\\_\\_\\_\\_\\_\\_\\_\\_\\_\\_\\_



Experience: 5+ years (Preferred)



Job Type: Full-Time (Work From Office Only)



Job Location: Adajan, Surat


**Key Responsibilities:**


* Develop and implement HR policies and procedures that align with the company’s goals and objectives.
* Manage the end-to-end recruitment process, including job postings, resume screening, interviews, and candidate selection.
* Develop and maintain an effective performance management system to evaluate employee performance and provide feedback to improve their work.
* Administer compensation and benefits programs to ensure competitive salaries and benefits packages that attract and retain top talent.
* Implement and maintain employee development programs, including training, coaching, and mentoring to ensure continuous learning and professional growth.
* Maintain and update employee records and ensure compliance with legal requirements, including employment laws, labour regulations, and safety standards.
* Manage employee relations and resolve conflicts to maintain a positive and productive work environment.
* Conduct regular HR audits to ensure compliance and identify areas for improvement.
* Provide guidance and support to line managers on HR-related issues.
* Stay up-to-date with HR trends, best practices, and legal requirements.


**Requirements:**


* Proven experience as an HR Manager in an IT Company would be an added advantage.
* Excellent knowledge of HR policies and practices, labour laws, and regulations.
* Strong interpersonal, communication, and leadership skills.
* Experience in managing the full recruitment cycle.
* Strong analytical and problem-solving skills.
* Ability to manage multiple priorities and work under pressure.
* Bachelor’s or Master’s degree in Human Resources, Business Administration, or a related field.


If you are passionate about HR and want to make a difference in our organization, we encourage you to apply for this exciting opportunity.

title: Data Analysis
description:
**Job Description:**


We are looking for a skilled HR manager to oversee all aspects of Human Resources practices and processes. You will support business needs and ensure the proper implementation of company strategy and objectives. The goal is to promote corporate values and enable business success through human resources management, including job design, recruitment, performance management, training & development, employment cycle changes, talent management, and facilities management services.


Responsibilities:

* Enhances the organization's human resources by planning, implementing, and evaluating employee relations and human resources policies, programs, and practices.
* Maintains the work structure by updating job requirements and job descriptions for all positions.
* Supports organization staff by establishing and interviewing program; counselling managers on candidate selection; conducting and analyzing exit interviews; and recommending changes.
* Prepares employees for assignments by establishing and conducting orientation and training programs.
* Manages a pay plan by conducting periodic pay surveys; scheduling and conducting job evaluations; preparing pay budgets; monitoring and scheduling individual pay actions; and recommending, planning, and implementing pay structure revisions.
* Ensures planning, monitoring, and appraisal of employee work results by training managers to coach and discipline employees; scheduling management conferences with employees; hearing and resolving employee grievances; and counselling employees and supervisors.
* Implements employee benefits programs and informs employees of benefits by studying and assessing benefit needs and trends; recommending benefit programs to management; directing the processing of benefit claims; obtaining and evaluating benefit contract bids; awarding benefit contracts; and designing and conducting educational programs on benefit programs.
* Ensures legal compliance by monitoring and implementing applicable human resource federal and state requirements, conducting investigations, maintaining records, and representing the organization at hearings.

title: Operations Lead
description:
**HR Operations Team Lead - ELC**
=================================

#### **Take your next career step at ABB with a global team that is energizing the transformation of society and industry to achieve a more productive, sustainable future. At ABB, we have the clear goal of driving diversity and inclusion across all dimensions: gender, LGBTQ+, abilities, ethnicity and generations. Together, we are embarking on a journey where each and every one of us, individually and collectively, welcomes and celebrates individual differences.**

  

You will be working as HR Operations Team Lead - ELC and reporting to HR Operations Hub Delivery Lead AMEA & NAM based in Bangalore, India. In this role you will be leading a team of 10 people and will take full accountability for the end-to-end Employee Life Cycle Management process, delivering high-quality services against globally agreed performance targets. Ensuring a high degree of customer experience by committing to a complete, accurate and timely completion of HR transactions. Supporting the globally set standards for HR Operations and ensuring that the local legal and regulatory requirements are adhered to HR Operations Hub processes of the respective Country.


### **Your responsibilities**

* Driving the end-to-end HR Operations in one or more respective Countries and or Service Line(s) and supervising the team. Delivering services according to signed-off processes, KPI and quality targets in a timely and accurate manner
* Leading internal controls and GDPR over HR transactions in collaboration with the HR Front Office Manager / HR Operations Manager. Supporting the Front Office Manager to implement global initiatives like acquisitions, divestments, new policies, etc. in the respective team(s)
* Delivering HR services with a high degree of customer orientation and an exemplary and proactive ‘can-do attitude’. Driving the enhancement of the Customer Experience Journey by analyzing received customer feedback and taking according actions
* Supporting cross-collaboration within HR Operations and other HR functions to optimize processes and tools, thereby promoting synergies. Holding accountability for escalations and driving resolutions
* Setting targets and managing performance for direct reports. Proactively growing the capability of the team, encouraging open discussion of development needs for the team and individuals. Leading the team by example and the required cultural sensitivity
* Developing bench strength and succession plans for key roles within the team, understanding the strengths of individual team members and allocating assignments accordingly. Encouraging and fostering personal career paths and development opportunities
* Continuously analyzing and optimizing operational performance across the team, addressing issues and implementing a culture of continuous improvements. Managing ongoing improvement activities such as training, knowledge transfer and regular quality checks

### **Your background**

* Bachelor’s degree in any stream
* At least 8 to 10 years of experience in HR Shared Services in a global organization with minimum 4 years of experience as a People manager
* Hands on experience on SAP and Workday knowledge will be advantageous. Ability to manage multiple demands on time and work with cross-functional teams
* Ability to manage a team size of 8 to 10 members and flexible to work in US shifts (5: 30 pm to 2: 30 am)
* Proficiency in MS Office and excellent written and verbal communication skills
* A collaborative, solutions-oriented approach and strong analytical skills
* Ability to work in a fast-paced, multi-tasking, high-transaction team environment

### **More about us**


ABB’s shared services organization which delivers operational and expert services in Finance, Human Resources, Information Systems, Legal, Global Travel Services and external Customer Contact Centers. With employees based in five main hubs and front offices, GBS provides mainly Business services to ABB teams across the globe as well as supports with external customer inquiries. We look forward to receiving your application (documents submitted in English are appreciated). If you want to discover more about ABB, take another look at our website www.abb.com. It has come to our attention that the name of ABB is being used for asking candidates to make payments for job opportunities (interviews, offers). Please be advised that ABB makes no such requests. All our open positions are made available on our career portal for all fitting the criteria to apply. ABB does not charge any fee whatsoever for recruitment process. Please do not make payments to any individuals / entities in connection to recruitment with ABB, even if is claimed that the money is refundable. ABB is not liable for such transactions. For current open positions you can visit our career website https://global.abb/group/en/careers and apply. Please refer to detailed recruitment fraud caution notice using the link https://global.abb/group/en/careers/how-to-apply/fraud-warning Work model: on site #LI-onsite

title: HRIS Manager
description:
***About Kennametal***

*With over 80 years as an industrial technology leader, Kennametal Inc. delivers productivity to customers through materials science, tooling and wear-resistant solutions. Customers across aerospace and defense, earthworks, energy, general engineering and transportation turn to Kennametal to help them manufacture with precision and efficiency. Every day approximately 8,700 employees are helping customers in nearly 100 countries stay competitive. Kennametal generated $2.1 billion in revenues in fiscal 2023. Learn more at* *www.kennametal.com**. Follow @Kennametal: Twitter, Instagram, Facebook, LinkedIn and YouTube.*

**Position Title:** **Manager – HRIS**

**Job Summary**


The HR Information Systems (HRIS) manager oversees the global Human Capital Management (HCM) system, primarily SuccessFactors. Reporting directly to the Director of HR Technology & PMO. It includes driving the evolution of the Human Resources function by developing, enhancing, and managing the HCM system. This position entails leading the HRIS administration team while collaborating with stakeholders, including global HR, payroll/finance, IT functions, and third-party vendors.

**Key Job Responsibilities**

* **Release Management**: Lead the HCM system release processes by aligning and prioritizing HRIS initiatives, defining change request intake processes, and determining release scope.
* **System Testing Strategy**: Define and manage a comprehensive system testing strategy, including managing multiple test environments and maintaining a library of test scripts for all modules.
* Integrations -
* **Change Management**: Develop strategies for change management and communication to facilitate long-term system adoption.
* **Business Partnership**: Establish partnerships with business owners to provide consultation on process improvements, releases, innovative solutions, and validation processes.
* **Data Integrity**: Define global data integrity processes and audits, ensuring adherence to global data standards and collaborating with regional HR to improve data integrity in compliance with data privacy laws.
* **Permissions and Security Management:** Implement and oversee permissions and security protocols within the HCM system, ensuring access controls and data protection measures are in place.
* **Integration Strategy:** Develop and execute strategies for integrating the HCM system with other organizational systems, such as finance, IT, and third-party applications.
* **Team Leadership**: Provide leadership and coaching to the HRIS administration team, managing workload assignments and fostering professional development.
* **Training**: Oversee user training on system operations, including preparation of user manuals and delivery of training sessions.
* **Project Management**: Lead projects ensuring integration with all relevant functions.
* **Process Improvement**: Identify opportunities for process improvement and implement project management best practices.
* **Vendor Relationship Management:** Manage relationships with third-party vendors providing HCM system services, ensuring adherence to service level agreements (SLAs), resolving issues promptly, and optimizing vendor performance.

**Preferred Areas of Education & Certifications:**
==================================================

* Fulltime Bachelor’s Degree
* Minimum of seven (7) years of relevant experience, with at least 1-2 years in a supervisory capacity.
* Five (5) years of hands-on experience in the SAP SuccessFactors domain, encompassing full-cycle implementation of SuccessFactors modules, from requirements gathering through testing, documentation, and final solution rollout.
* Proficiency at an expert level with SAP SuccessFactors modules, particularly Employee Central, Recruiting, Performance Management, Goal Management, Compensation, or Onboarding.
* Extensive experience in implementing and/or upgrading Human Capital Management (HCM) systems and ADP systems.
* Comprehensive knowledge of integrating HCM software applications and products, particularly on SAP SuccessFactors system with other systems.

 **Required Skills**

* Demonstrated understanding of HR processes and their interactions with HR systems.
* Strong analytical skills to effectively diagnose and address issues.
* Exceptional customer service orientation, ensuring focused and attentive service delivery.
* Proficient computer background, ideally with previous experience as a systems administrator.
* Hands-on experience with HR/Payroll and Microsoft Office software applications, focus on the SAP SuccessFactors suite.
* Proven organizational prowess, capable of managing multiple projects concurrently.
* Robust capabilities in process improvement and project management.
* Effective verbal and written communication skills, including demonstrated prowess in presentations and facilitation.
* Adaptability to changing circumstances while consistently meeting deadlines.
* Sound judgment and discretion when handling highly confidential and sensitive information.
* Ability to effectively collaborate with and manage remote teams in a global organizational setting.
* Openness to innovation and feedback, with a demonstrated ability to adapt and evolve.

  

Equal Opportunity Employer

* Job Responsibility


The role is to provide comprehensive support to the organization and its employees, contributing to operational efficiency and effectiveness.  

  

**1.Supporting the Registration Process**: Assisting with the establishment of new legal entities by coordinating with legal counsel, government agencies, and relevant authorities. This may involve preparing and filing necessary documentation, ensuring compliance with regulatory requirements, and facilitating the registration process from start to finish.  

**2.Business Support for the Japanese MD:** Providing administrative support to the Japanese MD, which may include scheduling meetings and appointments, managing correspondence, travel coordination and so on.  

3**. Office Management**: Overseeing day-to-day operations of the office, ensuring smooth functioning of administrative processes and procedures.  

**4. Correspondence and Communication**: Handling incoming and outgoing communications, including emails, phone calls, and postal mail. Drafting and distributing internal memos and announcements.  

**5. Document Management**: Organizing and maintaining physical and digital files, records, and databases. Ensuring confidentiality and security of sensitive information.  

**6. Calendar Management**: Scheduling appointments, meetings, and conferences. Coordinating logistics and preparing necessary materials.  

**5. Travel Coordination**: Making travel arrangements for employees, including booking flights, accommodations, and transportation.  

**6. Supply Management**: Ordering and maintaining office supplies, equipment, and inventory. Managing vendor relationships and negotiating contracts.  

**7. Event Planning**: Assisting with the planning and execution of company events, such as conferences, seminars, and team-building activities.  

**8. Human Resources Support**: Assisting with recruitment processes, onboarding new employees, and maintaining personnel records. Coordinating employee benefits and assisting with payroll administration.  

**9.Financial Administration**: Assisting with budget management, expense tracking, and invoice processing. Collaborating with accounting and finance departments as needed.  

**10. Facilities Management**: Overseeing facilities maintenance and repairs. Coordinating office renovations or relocations as necessary.  

**11. Compliance and Legal Support**: Ensuring compliance with relevant regulations and company policies. Assisting with the preparation of legal documents and contracts.  

**12. Special Projects**: Undertaking ad-hoc projects and assignments as assigned by senior management. This could include research, analysis, and reporting tasks.

title: Administrative Officer
description:
Positions:
1
Location:
Bangalore Business Support Office  


Location - Bangalore/ Mumbai



Position - 1



At Gaiagen, we manufacture products that are biological alternatives to chemicals, in the field of pest management.



We are looking for an ambitious and energetic ‘**Sr. Officer - HR Admin & Safety’** to help us with HR administration, payroll management, Labour Contract Management, HR compliance and safety related work. This includes Updating internal payroll databases, coordination with the Payroll Partner, ensuring Statutory compliance related to HR & Factories Act and timely submission of returns, recruitments, addressing employee grievances related to payroll, PF, ESIC, Leaves etc., Management of Labour Contractors & Safety.


**Required Qualification:**



* MBA in Human Resources or relevant field.


* Minimum experience of 2-3 years in the field of Human Resources.


* Good communication skills in English and Hindi.


* Safety related certification will be an added advantage.
  


**Skills and Attributes:**



* Proven work experience as a Payroll Officer or similar role


* Hands-on experience with HRIS /accounting softwares/ MS Office/ G-suite.


* Strong math skills with an ability to spot numerical errors & good detailing.


* Good knowledge of labor legislations.


* Ability to handle confidential information.
  


**Job Description:**



* Compile relevant payroll data and Coordinate with the Payroll partner to ensure timely salary dispersals.


* MIS preparation and sharing relevant reports with the Finance Department.


* Ensure wages and tax withholdings comply with regulations.


* Ability to understand and help in designing compensation, benefits, taxes and insurance deductions.


* Adherence to labour related compliance with regard to Factories Act.


* Ensuring compliance with HR policies, and promoting effective communication within the organization.


* Preliminary screening for Recruitment.


* Organizing onboarding of new employees & Induction.


* Implementing HR policies and working with managers to ensure their enforcement.


* Manage Exit Formalities & Full & Final Calculations.


* Management of Labour Contractors and approval of bills and ensuring overall compliance.


* Visiting Government Departments based on requirement.


* Conduct Fire drills/ POSH Meetings/ Annual Medical Checkup as per requirements.


* Build relationships with key stakeholders.


* Handling Employee Grievances related to HR Administration (PF/ESIC/ Insurance).


* Building Safety Culture within the organization.
  


**Equality Statement:** Gaiagen is committed to building a diverse workplace. We invite applications from all persons, irrespective of gender, disabilities, and members of religious minorities groups who can contribute through their experience to the diversity and effectiveness of our workplace. Equality and diversity are core to our values as an organization. Staff members are expected to work collectively and individually to promote a constructive and sensitive approach to colleagues from different backgrounds, and value and respect their work.

  


**Conflict of Interest:** Public or other activity, affiliation to or support for any group or organization, personal association or other factor which may generate a real or perceived conflict of interest with our principles of independence and impartiality, or raise a security concern, or otherwise prevent the candidate from carrying out key functions of the specific post and would therefore disqualify the candidate from being appointed.

  


**Selection Process:**


* Shortlisting of candidates based on skills and experience
* Telephonic / Online interview
* Face to face interview

**ABOUT ELEVANCE HEALTH**

Elevance Health is a leading health company in America dedicated to improving lives and communities and making healthcare simpler. It is the largest managed health care company in the Blue Cross Blue Shield (BCBS) Association serving more than 45 million lives across 14 states.


A regular in **Fortune** 500 list, **Elevance Health** ranked **20** in 2022. Gail Boudreaux , President and CEO of Elevance Health has been a consistent name in the Fortune list of most powerful women and currently holds 4th rank on this list.


**ABOUT CARELON**

Carelon Global Solutions (CGS) is a healthcare solutions company that is simplifying complex operational processes to improve the health of the healthcare system.


Previously known as Legato Health Technologies, Carelon Global Solutions (hereinafter, CGS) underwent a name change and joined the Carelon family of brands in January 2023, as a fully owned subsidiary of Elevance Health *(Previously Anthem Inc.).* CGS brings together a global team of like-minded innovators who manage and optimize operational processes for health plans as well as providers.


Our brightest minds housed across our global headquarters in Indianapolis as well as Bengaluru, Hyderabad and Gurugram in India, Manila in the Philippines, Limerick in Ireland and San Juan in Puerto Rico bring with them innovative capabilities and an unmatched depth of experience. This global team uniquely positions CGS to enable scalable, next-generation platforms and specialized digital tools that make healthcare operations more practical, effective, and efficient.


**OUR MISSION & VALUES**

**Our Mission:** Improving Lives and Communities. Simplifying Healthcare. Expecting More.
  

**Our Values:** Leadership | Community | Integrity | Agility | Diversity


**JOB POSITION**

Carelon Global Solutions India is seeking Team lead with minimum 5 years of people management experience in an operations environment handling at least 20+ direct reportees.


**JOB RESPONSIBILITY**

* Responsible for providing day-to-day direction for the Provider Experience Data Operations area.

**Primary duties may include but are not limited to:**

* Manages the operations of demographic data and network affiliations for the system capabilities and the lines of business within that area.
* Oversees day-to-day operations of the proactive maintenance of provider groupings and affiliations for all Commercial, Medicare Advantage, and Medicaid Plans.
* Manages database requirements for new network/products for the designated system capabilities and lines of business.
* Manages and prioritizes day-to-day tasks and activities for systems and human resources to optimize business levers (Self Service and Automation, Data Quality, etc.) for the Provider Experience demographic area.
* Hires, trains, coaches, counsels, and evaluates performance of direct reports.

**QUALIFICATION**

* Bachelors’ or Masters’ degree

**EXPERIENCE**

* Overall 10-12+ Years of experience and 5 years of management experience in an operations environment handling at least 20+ direct repartees; or any combination of education and experience, which would provide an equivalent background.
* Excellent Analytical skills and problem-solving skills and highly proficient in Data management along with excellent oral and written communication skills.
* Should have been a member or have led a performance improvement project through Six sigma/lean/kaizen approach.
* Should demonstrate capability and deep understanding of operating parameters / SLA to keep hygiene and engagement intact.

**SKILLS AND COMPETENCIES**

* Good comprehending & articulation skills - English Language
* Good/ Excellent communication skills - Both written and Spoken English
* Good logical thinking ability
* Good communication - Both written and spoken English - Ability to understand and articulate.
* Should have basic knowledge of MS Office (Word / Excel / PPT)

**THE CARELON PROMISE**

Aligning with our brand belief of ‘limitless minds are our biggest asset’, we offer a world of limitless opportunities to our associates.


It is our strong belief that one is committed to a role when it is not just what the role entails, but also what lies in its periphery that completes the value circle for an associate.


This world of limitless opportunities thrives in an environment that fosters growth and well-being, and gives you purpose and the feeling of belonging.


**LIFE @ CARELON**

* Extensive focus on learning and development
* An inspiring culture built on innovation, creativity, and freedom.
* Holistic well-being
* Comprehensive range of rewards and recognitions
* Competitive health and medical insurance coverage
* Best-in-class amenities and workspaces
* Policies designed with associates at the center.

**EQUAL OPPORTUNITY EMPLOYER**

Carelon is committed to a diverse and inclusive workplace and is proud to be an equal opportunity employer. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, gender identity or expression, sexual orientation, national origin, genetics, pregnancy, disability, age, veteran status, or other characteristics.


**Reasonable Accommodation**

Our inclusive culture empowers Carelon to deliver the best results for our customers. We not only celebrate the diversity of our workforce, but we also celebrate the diverse ways we work.


If you have a disability and need accommodation such as an interpreter or a different interview format, please ask for the Reasonable Accommodation Request Form.

title: Delivery Driver
description:
* Pune, India
* DOP SLH
* 3059852
**Job Description**
-------------------

***Role Purpose***


*The purpose of this role is to increase revenue, maximize process efficiency & cost-effectiveness, and ensure excellent customer experience, through effective leadership and supervision of daily operations and personnel, strategy planning, contract compliance, resource optimization and capability development for an account.*  



***Do***


* **Maximize process efficiency and cost effectiveness through strategic planning, contract compliance and governance mechanisms**
	+ *Strategy Planning with Senior Stakeholders & Clients*
		- Collaborate with leaders to provide strategic and operational plans associated with the account
	
		- Plan the strategy for the coming years by identifying new geographies for alternate revenue streams
* Collaborate with clients and identify countries that need to be mapped to bring revenues for the same product

* Part of internal WIPRO leadership planning meeting to discuss revenue numbers for the account


* Report to global delivery account head on status of the account


* *Ensure a deep enough understanding of clients’ individual experiences to head off potential issues before they become problems*
* *Contract compliance & adherence*
	+ Ensure all SLA parameters are met in the account and maintain a green card at all times

	+ Review and drive appropriate actions/ systemic changes on internal and external audit findings to ensure no major non-compliances are cited
* Monitor and review the account on various delivery parameters to ensure quality delivery as per budget and timelines

* *Delivery governance in the account*
	+ Understand customer goals and key performance metrics and ensure exceeding those goals throughout the project

	+ Ensure a green card for all accounts in terms of performance and quality
* Monitor and review delivery dashboards/ MIS across accounts to track progress and identify potential red flags

* Participate and share account performance across operational, quality and fulfillment parameters with internal and external stakeholders


* Lead and manage project escalations, potential risks or early warning signs on project delivery to eliminate any revenue leakage


* Ensure regular invoicing as per the contract terms and condition
* Forecast and track key account metrics

* *Invoicing*

	+ Timely submission of invoices to the client as defined in the SOW
	+ Provide information required and resolve any invoicing issues raised by the clien*t*
* *Work with internal teams by supporting activities such as RFP response, doing use capability demonstrations, and participating in the customer calls to sell solutions*


* *Identify opportunities for quick wins through automation and related initiatives in the account (wherever applicable)*


* *Collect and analyze statistics (costs, customer service metrics etc.)*


* *Assume responsibility of budgeting and tracking expenses*

  

* **Ensure outstanding performance against key metrics mentioned in the agreement**

	+ *Regular cadence around contract compliance*
	
		- *Evaluate performance with key metrics (accuracy, customer service metrics etc.)*
		- Set direction for the team, track progress against targets through regular cadence calls and course correct as required
* Drive the focus of the team on quality and adherence to contract compliance processes

* Drive and implement structured cadence around quality, both process and transactional


* Cadence with delivery lead to ensure margins are met and the account numbers are at par to what is committed


* Weekly calls with WFM to ensure resource optimization, compliance to the manpower numbers agreed in the contract, future planning in case of ramp ups etc.


* *Resource Allocation & Retention*

	+ Conduct effective resource planning to maximize the productivity of resources (people, technology etc.)

	+ Review and monitor resource planning and fulfillment in line with account requirements and costs of delivery
* Optimize manpower and minimize leakages by working closely with delivery head

* Ensure retention by offering relevant trainings and certifications of all allocated resources


* Lead one-on-one floor connect and other engagement activities to improve stickiness of the delivery team


* *Collaborate and influence internal key stakeholders to manage and resolve issues to ensure fulfillment and flawless delivery of projects*
  

* **Build people capability to ensure superior customer service levels of the existing account/client**


* *Develop Capability within service line and products as per account requirements*


* *Lead capability development initiatives to drive client specific certifications*
* *Co-create capability enhancement programs with client for front line staff and supervisory level*


* *Work with the Training and HR team to build and review training calendar*


* *Ensure customer-dedicated (as a result of change in process/tool), guaranteed trainings are conducted for the employees in the areas of skill development, soft skill and leadership training*
* *Ensure team KPIs are assigned & delivered with timeliness & accuracy keeping the end results in mind*


* *Partner with HR and Training teams to build training programs for front line staff/engineers and the supervisory level*


* *Focus on helping people develop their careers in order to retain people in the account and reduce turnover*
  

* **Stakeholder Interaction & Management**
	+ *Coordinate with internal and external stakeholders to ensure compliance and quality in the delivery for accounts*

	+ *Interact and engage with the client leadership to communicate and update progress against account plan, project delivery etc.*
	+ *Connect with senior leadership monthly on updating on the progress on a particular account*

	+ *Conduct monthly client connects to get feedback from client on the services provided as well as update the clients on the progress on the account*

	+ *Cadence with delivery lead to ensure margins are met and the account numbers are at par to what is committed*
	+ *Participate in monthly review meetings with WIPRO leadership updating them on the status and progress of each account*

	+ *Work with quality team to ensure the current business is as per the delivery standards of the contract*

	+ *Weekly calls with WFM to ensure resource optimization, compliance to the manpower numbers agreed, future planning in case of ramp ups etc.*

	+ *Provide timely assistance in case of an escalation and support resolution of escalations/ issues*
* **Effective Team Management**

	+ *Resourcing*
	
		- Hire adequate and right resources for the team
	+ *Talent Management*
	
		- Ensure adequate onboarding and training for the team members to enhance capability & effectiveness
	
		- Build an internal talent pool and ensure their career progression within the organization
* Manage team attrition

* Drive diversity in leadership positions


* *Performance Management*

	+ Set goals for the team, conduct timely performance reviews and provide constructive feedback to own direct reports

	+ Ensure that the Performance Nxt is followed for the entire team

	+ Lead and drive engagement initiatives for the team

title: Lead Project Manager
description:
**\\_VOIS Intro**
----------------

**About \\_VOIS:**

  

\\_VO**IS** (Vodafone Intelligent Solutions) is a strategic arm of Vodafone Group Plc, creating value and enhancing quality and efficiency across 28 countries, and operating from 7 locations: Albania, Egypt, Hungary, India, Romania, Spain and the UK.

  

Over 29,000 highly skilled individuals are dedicated to being Vodafone Group’s partner of choice for talent, technology, and transformation. We deliver the best services across IT, Business Intelligence Services, Customer Operations, Business Operations, HR, Finance, Supply Chain, HR Operations, and many more.

  

Established in 2006, \\_VO**IS** has evolved into a global, multi-functional organisation, a Centre of Excellence for Intelligent Solutions focused on adding value and delivering business outcomes for Vodafone.

**\\_VOIS Centre Intro**
-----------------------

**About \\_VOIS India:**

  

In 2009, \\_VO**IS** started operating in India and now has established global delivery centres in Pune, Bangalore and Ahmedabad. With more than 14,500 employees, \\_VO**IS** India supports global markets and group functions of Vodafone, and delivers best-in-class customer experience through multi-functional services in the areas of Information Technology, Networks, Business Intelligence and Analytics, Digital Business Solutions (Robotics & AI), Commercial Operations (Consumer & Business), Intelligent Operations, Finance Operations, Supply Chain Operations and HR Operations and more.

**Job Role Related Content (Role specific)**
--------------------------------------------

**\\_VOIS Equal Opportunity Employer Commitment**
------------------------------------------------

**India:**

  



\\_VO**IS** is proud to be an Equal Employment Opportunity Employer. We celebrate differences and we welcome and value diverse people and insights. We believe that being authentically human and inclusive powers our employees’ growth and enables them to create a positive impact on themselves and society. We do not discriminate based on age, colour, gender (including pregnancy, childbirth, or related medical conditions), gender identity, gender expression, national origin, race, religion, sexual orientation, status as an individual with a disability, or other applicable legally protected characteristics.

  

As a result of living and breathing our commitment, our employees have helped us get certified as a Great Place to Work in India for four years running. We have been also highlighted among the **Top 5 Best Workplaces for Diversity, Equity, and Inclusion**, **Top 10 Best Workplaces for Women**, **Top 25 Best Workplaces in IT & IT-BPM** and **14th Overall Best Workplaces in India** by the Great Place to Work Institute in 2023. These achievements position us among a select group of trustworthy and high-performing companies which put their employees at the heart of everything they do.

  

By joining us, you are part of our commitment. We look forward to welcoming you into our family which represents a variety of cultures, backgrounds, perspectives, and skills!

 **Apply now, and we’ll be in touch!**

**Together we can**
-------------------

title: Senior Associate Engineer
description:
At EY, you’ll have the chance to build a career as unique as you are, with the global scale, support, inclusive culture and technology to become the best version of you. And we’re counting on your unique voice and perspective to help EY become even better, too. Join us and build an exceptional experience for yourself, and a better working world for all.

 **EY MENA Pre-joining Consultant**

  



You will work as part of the EY MENA Pre-joining Team, providing a high level of support across the MENA region to our new joiners. Your role will be to provide an exceptional pre-joining experience from when a candidate has accepted their offer up until their first day of joining, supporting all new hires from entry level through to partner level.

 **Your key responsibilities:**

  

As a Pre-joining Consultant (PJC), you will be the main point of contact for our new joiners to ensure their pre-joining experience is smooth and efficient. The new joiners will require support in understanding our Immigration, Relocation, and Pre-joining policies and processes.

  

The role requires a high level of stakeholder management with key internal stakeholders such as the Recruitment Team and Hiring Managers as well as different functional teams such as IT, Administration, HR Enablement. You will also be responsible for resolving problems relating to the pre-joining process which will vary by candidate and location.

  



**Other key responsibilities include:**

  

* Provide an exceptional new joiner experience ensuring that when they join EY that their experience lives up to our Employee Value Proposition
* Managing the immigration process for all new joiners across MENA
* Guide team members to resolve challenging situations concerning benefits and legal areas
* Ensure accuracy and attention to detail in all elements of the new joiner process
* Escalate complex or sensitive cases to leadership as appropriate
* Identify potential problems and opportunities related to preboarding
* Be responsible for data and reporting accuracy
* Support and guide internal stakeholders and colleagues in process and structure changes
* Identifying issues and challenges with a solution orientated mindset with always keeping in mind providing an exceptional new joiner experience and enabling continuous improvement within our process and polices
* Understand MENA pre-joining regulations and ensure full compliance
* Provide location knowledge to aid transition and resolve problems relating to the pre-joining process

 **Skills and attributes for success:**

* Excellent English language written and verbal communications skills
* Building positive relationships with all stakeholders (internal and external)
* Ability to learn processes, methodologies, tools, and technologies used, and utilize them in an efficient manner
* Strong MS office skills and a willingness to acquire new skills to effectively leverage internal reporting systems
* Strong eye for detail
* A consultative professional who build relationships based on doing the right thing

 **To qualify for the role, you must have:**

* 3-6 years’ experience of working as part an HR Team including recruitment, immigration, pre-joining, onboarding, or related experience
* Experience of managing complex HR situations and working in a challenging fast-paced environment
* Experience of Microsoft Office applications and Outlook (Mandatory)
* Strong candidate centricity and consultative skills
* Experience in professional email writing as a mode of communication on a day-to-day basis
* Experience in stakeholder management and building strong relationships with support teams
* Experience managing multiple priorities and a high volume of candidate queries
* Exhibit a positive can-do attitude and approach to responsibilities; demonstrate commitment to the role
* Experience working with multi-cultural teams a plus

 **EY | Building a better working world**

  



EY exists to build a better working world, helping to create long-term value for clients, people and society and build trust in the capital markets.

  



Enabled by data and technology, diverse EY teams in over 150 countries provide trust through assurance and help clients grow, transform and operate.

  

Working across assurance, consulting, law, strategy, tax and transactions, EY teams ask better questions to find new answers for the complex issues facing our world today.

title: Manager
description:
**About the Company:**
StayVista is your quintessential “Home Away From Home” experience. As guests, you can choose from a collection of over 500 luxury villas and private holiday homes, from all across India. Ideal for individual and group getaways, we help you create memorable experiences whilst you reconnect with nature, yourself or your loved ones. Only 1 in 10 villas that we scout are carefully selected and added to our portfolio, to ensure that they meet our reliable quality standards. Additionally, as managers of cherished holiday homes, we also look after our homeowners’ interests and needs with trust and transparency. Our dedicated 24x7 guest services team, includes our founders, and is available to all of Vista Rooms stakeholders. Having served 300,000 happy travellers at over 500 holiday homes, we are South Asia’s largest chain of luxury private villas.  

Diversity and Inclusion is one of our core values at StayVista and we aim to provide equal opportunities to our employees and applicants for employment with regard to race, religion, colour, age, sex, national origin, sexual orientation, gender identity, disablity or any other category. Together, we continue to build an inclusive culture that encourages, supports and celebrates the diverse voices of our employees. **Why work with us:** We're a non-hierarchical, rapidly growing organisation with a young team. We adapt, iterate, and improve. If your work ethic is in line with us, you’ll be a great fit. Additional Perks: Employee discounts on villa stays, reward and recognition. Work and play go hand in hand here. Bachelor/ Master's degree in management field or related field with a minimum of 10 years of work experience.

title: Senior Human Resources Associate
description:
### **Job Description**


HR Executive with Learning and Development Experience  

  

  

**What we want:**  


We are seeking a dynamic and experienced HR Executive with a strong background in Learning and Development to join our team. The ideal candidate will be responsible for assisting in all HR functions with a specific focus on designing, implementing, and managing learning and development programs to support the growth and development of our employees. **Who we are:**
  

Vertoz is Madtech Group, helping Digital Marketers, Advertising Agencies, and Digital Media businesses with their Data-Driven Marketing, Advertising & Monetization expedition by utilizing the latest technology. Vertoz has developed in-house full-stack Madtech Products and acquired various components to complement them.

Participate in onboarding activities for new hires, ensuring a smooth transition into the organization.  


Maintain employee records and HR databases, ensuring accuracy and compliance with legal requirements.  


Support performance management processes, including goal setting, performance evaluations, and development planning.  


Handle employee inquiries and provide guidance on HR policies, procedures, and benefits.

title: Process Lead
description:
**Who You'll Work With**
------------------------


You will be based in our Gurugram office as part of our Global Payroll team, which is part of our Global Finance & Accounts service line. This group processes payroll of the firm members. You will work in coordination with our internal payroll teams, regional offices, accounting, TERS and applications support team to ensure required data are provided to our leadership team.

------------------

You will be involved in identifying process improvement areas and work closely with project management team and facilitate projects. You will be supporting team in production when needed and ensure that the business process documentation is updated. You will also be involved in facilitating and imparting functional training for members and clarify process related queries.

------------------

* Fluent in English, with strong verbal and written communication skills

* Excellent interpersonal skills
* Ability to work well under pressure and prioritize multiple tasks towards meeting all deadlines
* Take complete ownership of all the assigned responsibilities
* Excellent judgement and ability to maintain confidentiality of sensitive information

title: Digital Analyst
description:
**Position Summary**


The Analyst, Global Training, will work within Bain’s global training team to provide technical and functional support to core learning platform Springboard, including system updates, integrations, analysing new functionality and its impact, configuration changes to enable new features. Other responsibilities of this role include measuring learning impact through reporting solutions, drawing insights to influence product decisions, maintenance of technical standards (xAPI and SCORM) in integrations and platform standards audits.


Global training at Bain builds capabilities through a range of learning options including face-to-face experiential programs, apprenticeship, coaching, mentoring, social, virtual facilitation and self-directed digital content. We are actively increasing the use of digital/online learning at Bain including developing the “next generation” learning content/delivery to complement our award-winning in-person programs.

 **Essential Functions**

 **Support, configure and administer learning systems, and system upgrades.**

* Build and maintain deep technical knowledge of all relevant learning platforms and content technology (i.e. LXP, eLearning software, video delivery system, content libraries)
* Troubleshoot customer requests raised through ServiceNow tickets and maintain the agreed SLAs.
* Conduct regular quality checks to ensure learning technology is fully operational; react quickly and efficiently to customer feedback/requests including troubleshooting or escalation.
* Develop test plans, monitor acceptance criteria, communicate new feature releases, and coordinate with vendor/Bain’s Technology Services Group (TSG) for resolutions.
* Test and maintain technical integration with other Bain HR and content systems;
* Serve as advisor to global training team for process improvements to global/local system functionality.
* Review upcoming product updates from the LXP supplier and identify potential backlog items that may be impacted

 **Use robust analytics to drive adoption and utilization of Springboard**

* Audit and maintain all learning records and ensure consistency and quality of all data from learning systems (LXP, Google Analytics); improve analytics over time
* In coordination with Metrics and Reporting senior specialist, develop set of regular metrics to support analysis and measurement of self-directed content effectiveness
* Analyse learning data and learning dashboards to advise suitable adoption initiatives
* Actively promote the learning systems and functionality across general consulting and business function/expert/engine 2 employees globally
* Drawing conclusions from data, identifying key trends and making recommendations

 **Program manage and coordinate technology initiatives within Learning ecosystem**

* Work in an agile environment to ensure product backlog items are tracked and updated in Trello boards
* Supporting the Product Manager with project management activities, providing timely and accurate information
* Maintaining plans, records, spreadsheets, trackers and databases
* Creating high quality accurate documentation, including meeting minutes
* Manage and drive data analysis within the coordination team and communicate to stakeholders
* Anticipate risks, resolve issues and initiate corrective action as appropriate

 **Communicating and presenting insights to diverse audience across the organisation**

* Use Bain tools and presentation templates to ensure that insights drawn are communicated across the organisation
* Share frequent progress updates with our team, and stakeholders

 **Qualifications**

* BA/BS or equivalent, with strong academic credentials or **equivalent experience**
* Any certification or diploma on learning technologies, system implementation and, learning data analysis
* At least 2-4 years of experience with learning or HR technology tools (learning management systems, learning experience platforms, eLearning authoring software, content management systems, etc.); experience with implementations a plus
* Expertise in Learning standards including using SCORM, AICC, and/or xAPI for learning data analysis preferred
* Reporting tools and experience in analysing large data sets and using the information for continuous improvements
* Proficiency with Microsoft Excel (including dynamic formula construction, nested formulas and VLOOKUP, Pivot Tables) and other Office products (Teams, Word, PowerPoint)

 **Knowledge, Skills, and Abilities**

* Experience in computer systems validation, and learning management functional systems domain preferred
* Data Analysis – Performs data analysis in the context of tracking budget, penetration of trainings, talent
* High proficiency with Microsoft Office and demonstrated experience with reporting and presentation tools required
* Excellent written and verbal skills and the ability to communicate well with all levels of the organization
* Time Management – Ability to prioritize set goals and finish deliverables on time
* Demonstrates Entrepreneurship – Takes initiative, focuses on customers and improves performance
* Knowledge of principles, training methods, and techniques for adult learners
* Excellent planning and organizational skills, with the proven ability to prioritize, handle multiple assignments and work accurately within tight timelines
* Ability to take the initiative and lead the execution of small projects
* Passion for business and learning, intellectual curiosity, and learning agility
* Excellent team player and aligned to Bain operating principles

title: Warehouse Lead
description:
About Northern Trust:
Northern Trust, a Fortune 500 company, is a globally recognized, award-winning financial institution that has been in continuous operation since 1889.
Northern Trust is proud to provide innovative financial services and guidance to the world’s most successful individuals, families, and institutions by remaining true to our enduring principles of service, expertise, and integrity. With more than 130 years of financial experience and over 22,000 partners, we serve the world’s most sophisticated clients using leading technology and exceptional service.
Job Title: Team Leader, Investment Research & Analytics
ROLE:
Support the Securities Lending front office teams in all matters relating to the client reporting, Internal MI statistics and NT & Borrower performance analysis. Coordinate with Northern Trust Account Managers / Relationship Managers, Global Equity and Fixed Income Trading Desk and other stakeholders to help evaluate Securities Lending fee/revenue estimates for new prospects, RFP, RFI and existing clients. Assisting the company’s bid to expand clientele/business Coordinate with Risk, Compliance, Operations and Short Duration Fixed Income teams in producing various risk related reports for Securities Lending Aptitude in analyzing and interpreting queries/tables in Access/SQL/Power BI to conduct in-depth research Responds to internal and external inquiries and requests for information. Recommend appropriate procedural changes to existing process to management using root cause analysis Research and develop solutions for issues being addressed by the stakeholders Attend trainings to maintain up-to-date knowledge of business, team and self-development Technically competent to act as first point of reference for day-to-day queries Demonstrates excellent analytical, consultative, communication and judgment skills Handle projects assigned by the business teams Understand business need & develop reports using SQL/Power BI/VBA  

PRINCIPAL RESPONSIBILITIES:
Expected to work and review the daily/weekly/monthly BAU reports Monitors and reviews procedures of work handled for front office teams Reports unexpected/erroneously applied breaches Detects and advises management of potential improvements to the existing process and recommends procedural changes when required Maintain and discuss partner’s performance on regular basis Hold quality huddles on regular basis Produce metrics related to staffing, cross training & bandwidth of the team Review individual partner performance on a regular basis. Share feedback & seek feedback for partner & self-development Contributing towards developing a consistent and disciplined process to support business and other stakeholders
SKILLS / EXPERIENCE
§ 7 to 8 years of overall experience & 12 months experience in managing a team
§ Graduate (MBA or equivalent)  

§ Securities Lending, Portfolio Management & Investment Performance experience is preferred  

§ Mathematically minded individual with strong analytical skills  

§ Ability to work in pressurized environment & manage priorities effectively  

§ Highly motivated with strong attention to detail  

§ Proficient system knowledge of Macro level excel, MS Access & Power BI  

§ Excellent written & verbal communication skills
§ Excellent team management skills
Working with Us:
As a Northern Trust partner, greater achievements await. You will be part of a flexible and collaborative work culture in an organization where financial strength and stability is an asset that emboldens us to explore new ideas.
Movement within the organization is encouraged, senior leaders are accessible, and you can take pride in working for a company committed to assisting the communities we serve! Join a workplace with a greater purpose.
We’d love to learn more about how your interests and experience could be a fit with one of the world’s most admired and sustainable companies! Build your career with us and apply today. #MadeForGreater
Reasonable accommodation
Northern Trust is committed to working with and providing reasonable accommodations to individuals with disabilities. If you need a reasonable accommodation for any part of the employment process, please email our HR Service Center at MyHRHelp@ntrs.com.
We hope you’re excited about the role and the opportunity to work with us. We value an inclusive workplace and understand flexibility means different things to different people.
Apply today and talk to us about your flexible working requirements and together we can achieve greater.
