title: Team Leader, Investment Solutions
description:
About the Opportunity
Job Type: Permanent
Application Deadline: 29 March 2024
Job Description  

Title: Team Leader - Workplace Investing Operations
Department: Workplace Investing Operations
Location: Gurgaon
Reports To: Sr. Manager / Associate Director
Level: Grade 4
We’re proud to have been helping our clients build better financial futures for over 50 years. How have we achieved this? By working together - and supporting each other - all over the world. So, join our Workplace Investing Operartions team and feel like you’re part of something bigger.
About your team
Workplace Investing (WI) Operations supports and maintains pension administration services for a wide range of corporate clients. The nature of the service provided includes full support to pension scheme members at all stages of the administration life cycle through to specialist support to trustees and members for specific task delivery.
Workplace Investing Retirements teams is AA rated process that handles Disinvestment requests and producing Retirement Projections for Workplace Investing members and Financial Advisers.
DC Retirements team is responsible to process few key critical tasks :
Processing retirement disinvestments requests received from members/ trustees, monthly average volumes is* 1,300 members.

Issuing legal & regulatory and non-regulatory packs to members/ trustees/ third party approaching retirement age, monthly average volumes is* 5,500 members.
* Handling Mailbox, CAM - Audit requests, sale control reports and issuing Manual payment forms and payment letters.
* Recording benefit crystallisation events, RTI tax submissions, tax charge and reportable events to HMRC.


Any impact on resources may have an adverse impact on meeting Client commitments, Service Level Agreements and Regulatory deadlines.
About your role  

Individual selected for the role is expected to provide supervisory cover for effective management of day-to-day Operational tasks and also act as a leader for a team of Associates/Senior Associates & Process specialists to guide them on their career development. The individual should demonstrate a high level of commitment to customer service improvement and also showcase Fidelity values.
About you* Approach issues with a customer centric perspective to ensure consistent customer delight.
* Drives customer service culture through coaching and developing team.
* Drives forward ideas for improvements to environment/ service / procedures, obtaining feedback and approval from peers and manager.
* Manages and prioritises daily activities and processes in order to maintain SLAs.
* Takes responsibility for handling and escalating issues/concerns identified
* Develops and maintains thorough knowledge of all systems, processes and procedures relating to department
* Acts as role model to the team – leads by example.
* Coaches and develops individuals through each stage of their role; completes appraisal reviews twice-yearly; produces coaching and development plan for each member of the team by holding regular One to Ones
* Provides guidance to team members on career development
* Focuses team on business goals and priorities through a variety of channels, setting team goals and delegating responsibilities as required.
* Manages poor performance, escalating to Manager and HR where necessary
* Uses a variety of channels to ensure information is disseminated to team in most effective manner; follows up with team to ensure information is understood.
* Builds and maintains relationships and communication channels with internal customers.
* Provides regular updates to Management on trends and issues, team performance, escalated issues/ problems, project work.
* Keeps peers in other departments updated on team activities, customer/ risk issues, performance issues and projects.
* Review, organise and coordinate the business contingency plans for Institutional Operations.
* Represents Department/Fidelity in internal and external meetings.
* Undertakes delegated project work, updating management and peers on progress.
* Identify, suggest, review and progress process improvement ideas and customer experience ideas
* Participate actively in recruitment process and support on boarding of right talent
* Understand and comply with Fidelity rules including the Code of Ethics, Information Policy, Data Protection Act guidelines and Treating Customers Fairly.


Experience and Qualifications Required* 3-5 years of relevant experience with sufficient exposure in managing issues.
* Knowledge of UK/Europe financial services industry is a must and prior UK Pensions Knowledge would be an added advantage
* Understanding of regulatory bodies and framework within UK pensions
* Understanding of UK financial services markets and mutual funds and broader understanding of regulatory framework.
* Has demonstrated the 7 principles of customer service in previous roles.


Feel rewarded
For starters, we’ll offer you a comprehensive benefits package. We’ll value your wellbeing and support your development. And we’ll be as flexible as we can about where and when you work – finding a balance that works for all of us. It’s all part of our commitment to making you feel motivated by the work you do and happy to be part of our team. For more about our work, our approach to dynamic working and how you could build your future here, visit careers.fidelityinternational.com.
For more about our work, our approach to dynamic working and how you could build your future here, visit careers.fidelityinternational.com.

title: Team Leader, Investment Solutions
description:
Hello.
We’re Haleon. A new world-leading consumer health company. Shaped by all who join us. Together, we’re improving everyday health for billions of people. By growing and innovating our global portfolio of category-leading brands – including Sensodyne, Panadol, Advil, Voltaren, Theraflu, Otrivin, and Centrum – through a unique combination of deep human understanding and trusted science. What’s more, we’re achieving it in a company that we’re in control of. In an environment that we’re co-creating. And a culture that’s uniquely ours. Care to join us. It isn’t a question.  

With category leading brands such as Sensodyne, Voltaren and Centrum, built on trusted science and human understanding, and combined with our passion, knowledge and expertise, we’re uniquely placed to do this and to grow a strong, successful business.  

In Workplace Solutions (WPS) our unique contribution will accelerate Haleon’s success by transforming the employee experience, inspiring everyone to be their best wherever they work.  

WPS team is responsible for the full lifecycle of planning, execution, Real Estate/Facilities management and operations of Haleon’s real estate portfolio consisting of complex R&D facilities, office buildings, and sales office sites. The sites may be owned, leased, or be occupied through a serviced space arrangement. WPS works in close collaboration with our Global Support Function partners (Tech, HR, EHS, Legal etc) and relies extensively on our network of vendor partners to deliver a safe, productive, and desirable work environment for all users of our sites.  

This is an exciting time to join us and help shape the future. It’s an opportunity to be part of something special.  

Role Overview  

The WPS Lead for India role, part of the APAC Procurement Centre of Excellence (COE) organization, will be responsible for all category management and sourcing activities for Workplace Solutions within India.  

This role is responsible for development and delivery of the E2E real estate, capital improvement and facilities management strategy at all WPS locations within India ensuring business needs, cost, quality, and compliance metrics are achieved.  

The role supports the business with their E2E (Real Estate/Facilities to operations to supplier performance) cycle of facilities and real estate, and it is required to deliver a coherent, joined up approach to employee experience and aligning to their customers business strategy. This role acts as a business partner to the Regional QSC leadership, BU GMs along with the Finance leadership and is required to manage and influence many senior stakeholders within the region.  

This is a high impact, high complexity role with significant scope that spans across multiple areas and suppliers  

In this role you will…* Act as the POC for any Workplace Solutions related topics to the India BU lead.
* Work within the APAC Procurement COE team to strategically develop and evolve WPS strategy for the business for all sites within this region.
* Understand & monitor asset performance against business requirements and suggest suitable interventions to solve any gaps.
* Establish and develop external relationships in the region, to optimize WPS operations, real estate, and capital services to best serve our employees and business units.
* The role is required to manage & influence many senior stakeholders' region-wide.
* Develop and grow a diverse professional team of 3rd party providers accountable for the delivery of a world class end to end Real Estate and Facilities function within assigned Business Unit(s).
* Work closely with cross-functional (e.g. HR, Tech, procurement team etc to ensure WPS's services are integrated as part of a joined up, cohesive approach to employee experience.
* Assume full accountability for the delivery of OPEX and CAPEX budgets, ensuring financial acumen across their organization and responsibility for budget delivery with their reporting WPS Business Unit and Site Leads.
* Responsible for local delivery of all facilities and services within assigned Business Unit, ensuring cost, quality and compliance targets are achieved by key contract partners.
* Develop and embed contract governance processes and structures to ensure value and delivery in the Service provider contracts, and to ensure effective risk management controls are in place.
* Accountable for the prioritization and delivery of a program of capital projects (including minor works, infrastructure, business driven and energy projects) for assigned Business Unit, working closely with the Real Estate and Capital leads and managing 3rd party project managers.
* Align business needs and lead real estate transaction activities for assigned Business Unit in partnership with the Real Estate and Capital leads.
* Lead the onboarding of new sites into WPS management, ensuring thorough due diligence, solution development and service integration.
* Validate performance reporting and to ensure appropriate metrics are delivered by the service providers to key internal stakeholders.
* Uphold and ensure compliance with internal HALEON policies, standards, procedures, alerts and relevant external regulatory requirements with respect to Quality, Statutory and Environmental Health and Safety (EHS) requirements.


Key Responsibilities
Business partnering & stakeholder management in Haleon* Build strategic relationship with a network of senior Haleon local/regional/functional/site stakeholders, to understand business requirements, identify opportunities to create value and to position WPS’s value proposition.
* Influence key stakeholders and business partners to support strategy development endorse recommend strategies, support execution and agree how benefit delivery will be budgeted


Strategy execution  

* Align with broader WPS team and work in collaboration with them to provide local business requirements and market information
* Execute strategies in scope of responsibility aligned with the requirements of stakeholders and business partners

Drive operational efficiency  

* Challenge requirements and educate stakeholder to drive maximum contract and policy compliance, employee experience and strategy alignment
* Drive operational simplification across WPS areas and processes in scope

External supplier relationships  

* Build strategic relationships with key regional/local suppliers at a senior level and lead processes to ensure value is driven from these relationships. Ensure local considerations are accounted global & regional supplier relationships.
* Ensure regional considerations are taken into account in global supplier negotiations and contracts
* Develop and Implement Operational excellence strategies and plans for key regional/local suppliers to drive improvements against KPIs.

Please take a copy of the Job Description, as this will not be available post closure of the advert.  

When applying for this role, please use the cover letter, the online application or your CV to describe how you meet the competencies for this role, as outlined in the job requirements above. The information that you have provided in your cover letter and CV will be used to assess your application.
Qualifications & Skills:
Minimum Level of Education Required: Bachelor’s Degree
Area of Specialisation: Real-Estate/Facilities management, Business, Finance, Supply Chain, Marketing* 10+ years of Hands-on Operational experience Real-Estate/Facilities/Procurement management.
* Hands on knowledge in Vendor Management, Vendor sourcing, quotation analysis, contract negotiation, supplier review, supplier development and others.
* Demonstrated expertise in managing categories, particularly category strategy development and implementation, stakeholder management and supplier relationship management.
* In-depth understanding of external environment and supplier relationship models
* Strong knowledge of finance (cost benchmark, financial audit with key suppliers) and legal matters (contracting)
* Clear understanding of business value, business priorities, and potential implementation risks
* Significant experience working in a matrix (global/ regional) business environment.
* Strong networking skills and a proven ability to build productive and collaborative relationships with stakeholders and business partners.
* Ability to prioritize multiple tasks across multiple projects using project management skills.
* Strong analytical, written and verbal communications, and influencing skills.
* Ability to work in high pressure environment, often under tight deadlines.
* Experience with risk management


Why is this level of experience required?* The role holder is expected to be able to influence senior leaders effectively.
* The role holder is expected to be able to deliver significant transformation and change.
* The role holder is expected to be able to develop and deliver WPS strategies that are aligned with the business’s requirements.
* The role holder is expected to lead Local and some Regional WPS strategy
* The role holder is expected to manage significant projects.
* The role holder is expected to have significant external supplier and market knowledge.
* The role holder is expected to be able to benchmark externally to identify new opportunities and ensure competitive performance and is expected to be able to identify best practices externally and implement them in HALEON.

*Diversity, Equity and Inclusion*
At Haleon we embrace our diverse workforce by creating an inclusive environment that celebrates our unique perspectives, generates curiosity to create unmatched understanding of each other, and promotes fair and equitable outcomes for everyone.
We’re striving to create a climate where we celebrate our diversity in all forms by treating each other with respect, listening to different viewpoints, supporting our communities, and creating a workplace where your authentic self belongs and thrives.
We believe in an agile working culture for all our roles. If flexibility is important to you, we encourage you to explore with our hiring team what the opportunities are.
Care to join us. Find out what life at Haleon is really like www.haleon.com/careers/  

  

At Haleon we embrace our diverse workforce by creating an inclusive environment that celebrates our unique perspectives, generates curiosity to create unmatched understanding of each other, and promotes fair and equitable outcomes for everyone. We're striving to create a climate where we celebrate our diversity in all forms by treating each other with respect, listening to different viewpoints, supporting our communities, and creating a workplace where your authentic self belongs and thrives. We believe in an agile working culture for all our roles. If flexibility is important to you, we encourage you to explore with our hiring team what the opportunities are.  

  

As you apply, we will ask you to share some personal information, which is entirely voluntary. We want to have an opportunity to consider a diverse pool of qualified candidates and this information will assist us in meeting that objective and in understanding how well we are doing against our inclusion and diversity ambitions. We would really appreciate it if you could take a few moments to complete it. Rest assured, Hiring Managers do not have access to this information and we will treat your information confidentially.  

  

Haleon is an Equal Opportunity Employer. All qualified applicants will receive equal consideration for employment without regard to race, color, national origin, religion, sex, pregnancy, marital status, sexual orientation, gender identity/expression, age, disability, genetic information, military service, covered/protected veteran status or any other federal, state or local protected class.  

  

Please note that if you are a US Licensed Healthcare Professional or Healthcare Professional as defined by the laws of the state issuing your license, Haleon may be required to capture and report expenses Haleon incurs, on your behalf, in the event you are afforded an interview for employment. This capture of applicable transfers of value is necessary to ensure Haleon’s compliance to all federal and state US Transparency requirements.

title: Mena Pre-joining-supervising Associate
description:
At EY, you’ll have the chance to build a career as unique as you are, with the global scale, support, inclusive culture and technology to become the best version of you. And we’re counting on your unique voice and perspective to help EY become even better, too. Join us and build an exceptional experience for yourself, and a better working world for all.

 **EY MENA Pre-joining Consultant**

  



You will work as part of the EY MENA Pre-joining Team, providing a high level of support across the MENA region to our new joiners. Your role will be to provide an exceptional pre-joining experience from when a candidate has accepted their offer up until their first day of joining, supporting all new hires from entry level through to partner level.

 **Your key responsibilities:**

  

As a Pre-joining Consultant (PJC), you will be the main point of contact for our new joiners to ensure their pre-joining experience is smooth and efficient. The new joiners will require support in understanding our Immigration, Relocation, and Pre-joining policies and processes.

  

The role requires a high level of stakeholder management with key internal stakeholders such as the Recruitment Team and Hiring Managers as well as different functional teams such as IT, Administration, HR Enablement. You will also be responsible for resolving problems relating to the pre-joining process which will vary by candidate and location.

  



**Other key responsibilities include:**

  

* Provide an exceptional new joiner experience ensuring that when they join EY that their experience lives up to our Employee Value Proposition
* Managing the immigration process for all new joiners across MENA
* Guide team members to resolve challenging situations concerning benefits and legal areas
* Ensure accuracy and attention to detail in all elements of the new joiner process
* Escalate complex or sensitive cases to leadership as appropriate
* Identify potential problems and opportunities related to preboarding
* Be responsible for data and reporting accuracy
* Support and guide internal stakeholders and colleagues in process and structure changes
* Identifying issues and challenges with a solution orientated mindset with always keeping in mind providing an exceptional new joiner experience and enabling continuous improvement within our process and polices
* Understand MENA pre-joining regulations and ensure full compliance
* Provide location knowledge to aid transition and resolve problems relating to the pre-joining process

 **Skills and attributes for success:**

* Excellent English language written and verbal communications skills
* Building positive relationships with all stakeholders (internal and external)
* Ability to learn processes, methodologies, tools, and technologies used, and utilize them in an efficient manner
* Strong MS office skills and a willingness to acquire new skills to effectively leverage internal reporting systems
* Strong eye for detail
* A consultative professional who build relationships based on doing the right thing

 **To qualify for the role, you must have:**

* 3-6 years’ experience of working as part an HR Team including recruitment, immigration, pre-joining, onboarding, or related experience
* Experience of managing complex HR situations and working in a challenging fast-paced environment
* Experience of Microsoft Office applications and Outlook (Mandatory)
* Strong candidate centricity and consultative skills
* Experience in professional email writing as a mode of communication on a day-to-day basis
* Experience in stakeholder management and building strong relationships with support teams
* Experience managing multiple priorities and a high volume of candidate queries
* Exhibit a positive can-do attitude and approach to responsibilities; demonstrate commitment to the role
* Experience working with multi-cultural teams a plus

 **EY | Building a better working world**

  



EY exists to build a better working world, helping to create long-term value for clients, people and society and build trust in the capital markets.

  



Enabled by data and technology, diverse EY teams in over 150 countries provide trust through assurance and help clients grow, transform and operate.

  

Working across assurance, consulting, law, strategy, tax and transactions, EY teams ask better questions to find new answers for the complex issues facing our world today.

title: Floor Supervisor
description:
**Job Brief**
-------------



Job Brief: Floor Supervisor



**Job Brief:** **Floor Supervisor**  

  

**Description:** The Floor Supervisor is responsible for the dedicated supervision of Stateroom Stewards and Assistant Stateroom Stewards. Compliance with all USPH regulations as set out in the VSP manual. Floor Supervisors are usually responsible for keeping hotel premises clean and organized, supervising housekeeping activity, coordinating room attendants, ensuring guest satisfaction and solving complaints.

* Minimum 2 years of experience in 4\\* and 5\\* property as a Floor Supervisor and 2 contracts on board.
* Managing Workflow
* Training new employees
* Creating and overseeing team schedules
* Providing reports to senior management & HR
* Resolving employee disputes and issues

**SKILLS:**
Employers require floor managers to have relevant soft and hard skills. Soft skills are transferable skills that help you interact and connect with colleagues and clients.  


**COMMUNICATION:**
As floor managers typically interact with staff and customers, practical communication skills can help you thrive in the role. In this role, it’s necessary to set clear goals and communicate them to your team. Communication skills also help you provide constructive feedback that can lead to improved employee performance. Communication skills include written skills, so as a floor manager, you may also create reports for senior management and HR.

**ACTIVE LISTENING:**
Listening skills enable you to improve employees' job satisfaction. These skills help you interact with employees and listen to their concerns, which can simplify and improve problem solving. Active listening skills also assist you in understanding customers' needs and complaints. You can then analyze the situation and develop effective strategies to improve customer satisfaction.

**DELEGATION:**
As floor managers oversee employees' activities and tasks, effective delegation skills enable you to assign duties. By understanding your team's strengths and weaknesses, you can assign duties based on their strengths. This helps increase productivity within the workplace and ensure employees are working within their capabilities.

**LEADERSHIP:**
Leadership skills enable you to manage employees and encourage them to achieve their goals. Effective leadership skills can help you maintain a successful workflow and improve employee morale. You can also leverage your leadership skills to instill confidence in employees and promote organizational growth. This helps improve productivity and staff performance.
**FLEXIBILITY:**
Being flexible helps you adjust to unforeseen situations. It’s beneficial to have an in-depth knowledge of company policies but also make necessary modifications in certain situations. Maintaining a calm demeanour during challenging situations helps keep your team calm.  


**WORK ENVIRONMENT OF A FLOOR SUPERVISOR:**
A floor manager's work environment varies depending on the industry. They generally work on the floor with staff and oversee their activities. Floor managers work regular hours and usually operate within the production or work area. They may also work in an office, evaluating employees' performance and holding evaluation sessions. These professionals also visit areas around the workplace, such as storerooms and warehouses.

Qualifications
* Knowledge, experience, skill, and/or ability
* Required
* Fluent in written and spoken English,
* Must be able to communicate effectively with the senior management.
* Ability to lead and make decisions.
* Good administrative skills.
* Experienced in coaching subordinates.
* Must be cost and quality conscious.
* Must adhere to specific scheduled work hours, yet be flexible if circumstances require it.
* Work with international team members.
* Perform assigned duties under pressure (time constraints).
* Preferred
* Fluency in additional language(s)
* Required computer skills
* Education/experience/certifications
* High School education or better.

title: Human Resources Manager
description:
As the HR Manager at QHT Healthcare, you will play a crucial role in managing human resources functions and supporting the organization's overall goals and objectives. You will be responsible for talent acquisition, employee relations, performance management, training and development, HR policies and compliance, benefits administration, employee engagement, payroll management, grievance handling, and ensuring compliance with relevant laws and regulations. We are looking for a dynamic individual with strong HR management skills and a passion for healthcare.

**Key Responsibilities:**

1. **Talent Acquisition:**

· Develop recruitment strategies to attract and retain top talent.

· Conduct interviews, screen candidates, and manage the onboarding process.

· Collaborate with department heads to identify staffing needs and ensure timely hiring.

2. **Employee Relations:**

· Address employee concerns and grievances in a timely and empathetic manner.

· Resolve conflicts and promote a positive workplace culture conducive to collaboration and productivity.

3. **Performance Management:**

· Oversee performance appraisals and provide guidance on performance improvement plans.

· Assist in career development planning and succession management.

4. **Training and Development:**

· Identify training needs and coordinate training sessions to enhance employee skills and knowledge.

· Evaluate the effectiveness of training programs and make recommendations for improvement.

5. **HR Policies and Compliance:**

· Develop and enforce HR policies and procedures in compliance with relevant laws and regulations.

· Conduct periodic audits to ensure adherence to policies and mitigate risks.

· Stay updated on changes in labor laws and regulations and ensure compliance.

6. **Benefits Administration:**

· Administer employee benefit programs, including health insurance, retirement plans, and leave policies.

· Communicate benefit information to employees and assist in resolving benefit-related issues.

7. **Employee Engagement:**

· Implement initiatives to enhance employee engagement and morale.

· Organize employee activities, events, and recognition programs to foster a positive work environment.

8. **Payroll Management:**

· Oversee payroll processes, including salary calculations, deductions, and disbursements.

· Ensure accuracy and timeliness of payroll transactions and compliance with tax regulations.

9. **Grievance Handling:**

· Provide guidance and support to employees in addressing grievances and concerns.

· Investigate employee complaints and take appropriate corrective actions as needed.

**Qualifications:**

· Bachelor's degree in Human Resources Management or a related field.

· Proven experience in HR management roles, preferably in the healthcare industry.

· In-depth knowledge of HR laws, regulations, and best practices.

· Strong interpersonal skills and the ability to build positive relationships at all levels of the organization.

· Excellent problem-solving and conflict resolution abilities.

· Ability to maintain confidentiality and handle sensitive information with discretion.

· HR certification such as SHRM-CP or PHR is advantageous.

**Candidate Must be willing to relocate to Haridwar.**

Join us at QHT Clinic and become an integral part of our team as we strive for excellence in healthcare delivery. If you meet the qualifications and requirements for this role and are ready to contribute your expertise to our mission, we encourage you to apply and take the next step in your HR career.

Please submit your resume and a cover letter detailing your suitability for the position to hrhyd@qhtclinic.com or contact on 9068999093.

We look forward to reviewing your application.

Job Type: Full-time

Salary: ₹25,000.00 - ₹50,000.00 per month

Benefits:

* Provident Fund

Schedule:

* Day shift

Education:

* Bachelor's (Required)

Experience:

* total work: 1 year (Preferred)

* Ensure employee compliance with all company policies and procedures.

title: Human Resources Manager
description:
HR and Administration Manager Job Description:

**Position: HR and Administration Manager**

**Job Summary:**  
The HR and Administration Manager plays a key role in overseeing both human resources and administrative functions within the organization. This position involves managing HR processes, employee relations, and administrative operations to ensure a smooth and efficient workplace.

**Key Responsibilities:**

**Human Resources:**

* Lead the recruitment and onboarding processes, including job posting, candidate screening, interviewing, and orientation.
* Manage employee relations, addressing concerns, and fostering a positive workplace culture.
* Develop and implement HR policies and procedures to ensure compliance with employment laws and industry best practices.
* Conduct performance management activities, including performance reviews, goal-setting, and employee development.
* Administer employee benefits programs, ensuring accurate record-keeping and compliance.
* Handle employee disciplinary actions and terminations in accordance with company policies.
* Facilitate training sessions for employees on HR-related topics.

**Administration:**

* Supervise and lead administrative staff, including receptionists, office assistants, and clerical personnel.
* Develop and implement effective administrative policies and procedures to streamline office operations.
* Manage office supplies, equipment, and facilities to ensure a well-maintained and organized work environment.
* Coordinate with various departments to support their administrative needs and facilitate communication within the organization.
* Handle budgeting and financial tasks related to administrative functions.
* Resolve administrative issues and address employee concerns in a timely and effective manner.
* Stay updated on industry trends and best practices to enhance administrative and HR processes.

**Qualifications:**

* Bachelor's degree in Human Resources, Business Administration, or a related field.
* Proven experience in both HR and administrative management.
* Knowledge of employment laws, regulations, and administrative best practices.
* Strong organizational and leadership skills.
* Excellent communication and interpersonal abilities.
* Ability to handle confidential information with discretion.
* HR certification (e.g., SHRM-CP, PHR) is a plus.

title: Human Resources Manager
description:
**Title: HR Manager** 

**Location- Noida Sector-2 (Nearest Metro Station Noida Sector -15)** 

**Position Overview:** 

We are seeking a skilled HR Manager to join our dynamic team at our Performance marketing agency. The HR Manager will play a crucial role in supporting our employees, fostering a positive work culture, and ensuring compliance with HR policies and procedures. The ideal candidate will have experience in human resources management, excellent interpersonal skills, and a strong understanding of the digital marketing industry.

**Responsibilities:**

**1. Recruitment and Onboarding:** 

● Collaborate with department heads to identify staffing needs and create job descriptions.

● Manage the end-to-end recruitment process, including sourcing candidates, conducting interviews, and making hiring decisions.

● Coordinate employee onboarding activities to ensure a smooth transition for new hires.

**2. Employee Relations:**

● Serve as a point of contact for employee inquiries and concerns, providing guidance and support as needed.

● Foster a positive work environment through effective communication, conflict resolution, and team-building initiatives.

● Conduct regular check-ins with employees to assess job satisfaction and address any issues or concerns.

**3. Performance Management:** 

● Implement and oversee performance management processes, including goal setting, performance evaluations, and feedback sessions.

● Provide coaching and support to managers on performance-related matters, including performance improvement plans and disciplinary actions.

**4. HR Administration and Compliance:**

● Maintain accurate employee records and ensure compliance with relevant employment laws and regulations.

● Administer employee benefits programs, including health insurance, retirement plans, and leave policies.

● Stay up-to-date on HR best practices and industry trends to continuously improve HR processes and procedures.

**Qualifications**:

● Bachelor's degree in Human Resources, Business Administration, or a related field.

● 1.5+ years of experience in human resources management, preferably in the digital marketing or advertising industry.

● Strong understanding of employment laws and regulations.

● Excellent communication and interpersonal skills, with the ability to build relationships at all levels of the organisation.

● Proven ability to manage multiple priorities in a fast-paced environment.

If you're passionate about HR and eager to contribute to the success of a growing digital marketing agency, we encourage you to apply for this exciting opportunity.

**Location:** Noida

**Position Overview:**  
We are seeking a dedicated and detail-oriented HR Executive to join our team. The HR Executive will play a key role in supporting various HR functions, including recruitment, onboarding, employee relations, performance management, and HR administration. The ideal candidate will have a passion for HR, excellent organizational skills, and a strong commitment to delivering exceptional service to our employees.

**Key Responsibilities:**

* **Recruitment and Onboarding:**
* Coordinate recruitment efforts, including job postings, screening resumes, scheduling interviews, and conducting reference checks.
* Assist in the onboarding process for new hires, including preparing offer letters, conducting orientation sessions, and ensuring a smooth transition into the company.
* **Employee Relations:**
* Serve as a point of contact for employees regarding HR-related inquiries, policies, and procedures.
* Address employee concerns and grievances in a timely and professional manner, escalating issues as needed to HR management.
* **Performance Management:**
* Assist in the implementation and administration of performance management processes, including goal setting, performance evaluations, and employee development plans.
* Support managers in identifying performance issues and implementing corrective action plans as necessary.
* **HR Administration:**
* Maintain accurate and up-to-date employee records in HRIS and other HR systems.
* Prepare and maintain HR-related documentation, including employment contracts, HR policies, and employee handbook updates.
* Assist in the coordination of HR-related meetings, trainings, and events.

**Requirements:**

* Bachelor's degree in Human Resources, Business Administration, or related field.
* Prior experience in HR or related roles preferred.
* Strong understanding of HR principles, practices, and procedures.
* Excellent communication and interpersonal skills.

* Ability to maintain confidentiality and handle sensitive information with discretion.

title: Recruiting Coordinator
description:
Hi

Immediate joinee required

exp:2 to 4 years

work from office

good communication, smart person

A Recruiting Coordinator is a talented professional who joins our team to actively engage in the end-to-end hiring process.

You will play a key role in attracting candidates, evaluating resumes, conducting interviews, and managing hiring paperwork.

As a skilled Recruiting Coordinator, you possess in-depth knowledge of HR best practices and bring innovative ideas to the table.

Strong communication skills and a confident approach as a headhunter are highly desired. We value individuals who think outside the box and demonstrate a track record of completing projects in a timely manner.

Your primary responsibility will be to effectively manage our full recruitment cycle, ensuring that we consistently meet our staff requirements and acquire top talent for our organization.

Responsibilities

* Design and implement overall recruiting strategy
* Consult with managers to discover staff requirements and specific job objectives
* Write and post job descriptions on career websites, newspapers and universities boards
* Source candidates by using databases and social media
* Evaluate and screen resumes and cover letters
* Use recruiting tools like tests and assignments to assess candidates’ skills
* Conduct phone, Skype and/or in-person interviews
* Provide a shortlist of qualified candidates to hiring managers
* Help the hiring team with recruiting methods and interview questions
* Contact new employees and prepare onboarding sessions
* Prepare new hire paperwork ensuring legislation requirements are met
* Maintain a complete record of interviews and new hires
* Stay up-to-date with current recruiting methods
* Attend job fairs and careers events

Requirements and skills

* Proven work experience as a Recruiting coordinator or recruiter
* Excellent communication skills
* Ability to prioritize and complete projects within deadline
* Solid knowledge of HR policies and best practices
* Hands on experience with various selection processes like phone interviews and reference checks
* Ability to conduct different types of interviews (e.g. structured, competency based and behavioral)
* Familiarity with HR databases, applicant tracking systems and candidate management systems
* Ability to use psychometric tests and other assessment tools
* Familiarity with social media, especially LinkedIn
* BSc degree in Human Resources Management, Organizational Psychology or relevant field

title: Human Resources Manager
description:
**Position Title: HR-Admin Manager**

**Location: Malad West**

**Reporting to: HR Head**

Job Summary:

The HR-Admin Manager will oversee all aspects of human resources and administrative functions within the food industry. This role involves managing recruitment and staffing, employee relations, including procurement, inventory management, facility maintenance, coordination of office operations compliance with labor laws and regulations, and general administrative support. The HR-Admin Manager will play a key role in fostering a positive work culture, ensuring employee satisfaction, and supporting the overall success of the organization.

Key Responsibilities:

· Employee Relations and Engagement:

Serve as a primary point of contact for employee relations issues, grievances, and conflicts, providing guidance, mediation, and resolution as needed.

Conduct regular employee feedback surveys and exit interviews to gather insights and identify opportunities for improvement.

· Compliance and Legal Requirements:

Ensure compliance with all applicable labor laws, regulations, and company policies related to employment practices, health and safety, and employee benefits.

Maintain accurate and up-to-date employee records, including personnel files, attendance records, and documentation of disciplinary actions or grievances.

Coordinate with legal counsel or external consultants as needed to address legal issues or compliance concerns.

· Procurement and Vendor Management:

Source and procure necessary supplies, materials, and equipment for the organization's operations, ensuring quality, cost-effectiveness, and timely delivery.

Establish and maintain relationships with suppliers and vendors, negotiate contracts and terms, and manage vendor performance to ensure compliance with agreements and standards.

· Inventory Management:

Oversee inventory control processes, including receiving, storage, and distribution of goods, to ensure adequate stock levels and minimize wastage or shortages.

Implement inventory management systems and procedures to track inventory levels, monitor stock movements, and optimize inventory turnover.

· Facility Maintenance and Management:

Coordinate maintenance and repair activities for office facilities, equipment, and machinery, ensuring compliance with health and safety regulations and industry standards.

Manage facility maintenance contracts, schedules, and budgets, and oversee the work of external contractors and service providers.

· Office Operations and Administration:

Supervise administrative staff and oversee day-to-day office operations, including mail handling, filing, record-keeping, and general correspondence.

Develop and implement administrative policies, procedures, and guidelines to streamline processes, improve efficiency, and ensure compliance with organizational standards.

· Financial Management and Budgeting:

Assist in the preparation and management of departmental budgets, monitor expenses, and identify cost-saving opportunities to optimize financial performance.

Qualifications and Skills:

Bachelor's degree in Human Resources Management, Business Administration, or related field. Master's degree or HR certification (e.g., SHRM-CP, PHR) is a plus.

Proven experience in human resources management, preferably in the food industry or a related field.

Strong knowledge of labor laws, regulations, and compliance requirements relevant to the sweets and food industry.

Excellent communication and interpersonal skills, with the ability to build rapport and trust with employees at all levels of the organization.

Strong organizational and time management skills, with the ability to manage multiple priorities and deadlines effectively.

Proficiency in HRIS software, Microsoft Office suite (Word, Excel, PowerPoint), and other relevant software applications.

Attention to detail and accuracy in record-keeping and documentation.

Ability to work independently and collaboratively in a fast-paced, dynamic environment.

Strong problem-solving skills and the ability to anticipate and address issues proactively.

**Required MALE Candidates from Mumbai only.**

Knowledge of regulatory requirements and industry standards relevant to the sweets and food industry, including health and safety regulations, food safety standards, and quality control practices.

title: Human Resources Manager
description:
**Job Title: HR Generalist**

**Job Summary:**  
The HR Generalist plays a crucial role in supporting the overall HR functions and contributing to the development and implementation of HR policies and procedures. This position involves working closely with employees and management to address human resources needs, promote a positive workplace culture, and ensure compliance with relevant regulations.

**Key Responsibilities:**

* **Recruitment and Onboarding:**
* Manage the end-to-end recruitment process, including job postings, screening resumes, conducting interviews, and making job offers.
* Facilitate new employee onboarding, orientation, and training programs.
* **Employee Relations:**
* Address employee inquiries and concerns, providing guidance on HR policies and procedures.
* Mediate and resolve employee relations issues, fostering a positive and inclusive workplace.
* **Performance Management:**
* Assist in the implementation and management of performance appraisal processes.
* Provide guidance on goal setting, feedback, and performance improvement plans.
* **Benefits Administration:**
* Administer employee benefits programs, including health insurance, retirement plans, and other perks.
* Coordinate open enrollment processes and answer employee questions about benefits.
* **HR Compliance:**
* Ensure compliance with local, state, and federal employment laws and regulations.
* Keep abreast of changes in legislation and update policies and procedures accordingly.
* **Training and Development:**
* Identify training needs within the organization and coordinate training programs.
* Support employee development initiatives to enhance skills and knowledge.
* **HR Data Management:**
* Maintain accurate and up-to-date HR records and databases.
* Generate reports on HR metrics and analyze trends.
* **Policy Development:**
* Contribute to the development and updating of HR policies and procedures.
* Communicate changes in policies to employees and ensure understanding.
* **HR Projects:**
* Participate in special HR projects and initiatives as assigned.

**Qualifications:**

* Bachelor's degree in Human Resources, Business Administration, or related field.
* Proven experience as an HR Generalist or in a similar role.
* Knowledge of HR laws, regulations, and best practices.
* Strong interpersonal and communication skills.
* Ability to handle sensitive and confidential information with discretion.
* Proficient in HRIS (Human Resources Information System) and MS Office.

This is a broad overview, and the specific JD may be tailored to the unique needs of the organization. Additionally, as HR is a dynamic field, the responsibilities may evolve with changing business needs and industry trends.

Job Types: Full-time, Permanent

Salary: ₹50,000.00 - ₹60,000.00 per month

title: Assistant Property Manager
description:
**Job Title**


Assistant Property Manager**Job Description Summary**


Successful completion of scheduled activities as per SLA agreed with Client. Prompt and courteous response to Client requests. Management of budget, equipment and materials on behalf of Client/RWA/ Association.**Job Description**


Successful completion of scheduled activities as per SLA agreed with Client. Prompt and courteous response to Client requests. Management of budget, equipment and materials on behalf of Client/RWA/ Association.

**Major Responsibilities:**

* Inspect and monitor the functions of building facilities including lifts, air conditioning, fire services, water supply, electricity supply and building work. Monitor the process of Report and follow up of request & complaints from occupants to management office.
* Report to CLIENT Management in the event of any major/minor breakdown immediately which would adversely impact CLIENT Management’s business operations
* Inspect and monitor the function of Township including HVAC, fan coil units, electrical, cable, Civil, plumbing, water supply, sewage, interior design work & lighting etc.
* To set and monitor process to liaise with contractor for any malfunctions detected. Ensure proper Follow up and completion on rectification works/pending requests and report to CLIENT Management as per SLA by PM team.
* To implement and monitor a process for liaison with supplier regarding any damage, loss found, malfunction of building supplies
* To ensure that proper follow up any requests/complaints from CLIENT employees is done by / Shift Engineers/ Executives.
* To implement a process which ensures all equipment are in good working order. To check that SE monitor the following:-
* Report and send service order to contractor for maintenance and repair.
* Evaluate the service level of the contractor.
* Advise CLIENT from time to time on performance of the equipment’s and help to take repair/purchase decisions
* To ensure that the process of proper cleaning is followed and monitored by APM / Executive.
* To ensure a clean, health & hygienic working environment.
* Responsible for Public Relations including liaison with all local statutory bodies.
* Liaison with telecommunication agencies.
* Payment of property tax.
* Ensure statutory compliance on ESIC/PF/Labor laws by all vendors.
* To liaise with contractors, collect quotations and prepare quotation analysis.
* To make recommendation for approval.
* Follow up on service level and report to the CLIENT Management.
* To keep and revise the existing contracts with different vendors.
* To liaise with vendors on contract renewal.
* To compare, Evaluate and recommend vendors.
* Monthly (or as required) Vendor Meetings to agree Monthly Supplier evaluation and plan for forthcoming month
* To formulate, implement and monitor the inventory control process and ensure supplies are at maintained at preapproved level.
* Control and get the inventory in/out record prepared by SE / Executive on weekly/daily basis.
* To decide, implement and monitor the Procurement process for consumables and goods in agreement with CLIENT policy and procedure.
* To monitor delivery from approved supplier and ensure they are follow the SLA.
* Annual Budgeting and Monthly Accounting
* Maintain an prepare and Implement systems and procedure
* Conduct Risk Assessments of all activities.
* Ensuring Accident Log is kept up to date reporting EH&S statistics and incidents in Monthly Report
* To Coordinate with CLIENT representatives to get the PPM schedules prepared by SE approved and implemented.
* Get the reports on engineering systems operation and maintenance from SE
* To ensure that the Engineering budget is properly made and followed by the engineering team.
* To ensure that C&W team is well trained and motivated at all the times.
* Leave planning/approval
* Coordinate with HR for hiring etc.
* Ensure attendance records are sent to C&W head office on time every month.
* Ensure submission of MMR before 7th of every month for the previous month.
* Ensure Daily/weekly reports are submitted to client on time.

**Qualification**

* Diploma / BE / B Tech. (Electrical/Electronics & Communication / Mechanical) or above OR Graduate (with Minimum 8 Yrs. Experience) with good communication skill & Administration and Technical knowledge.

**Work Experience**

* Minimum Experience – 4-10 Years

**Compensation :** Commensurate with market

  

Cushman & Wakefield is committed to equity in employment and our goal is to have a diverse, inclusive, and barrier-free workplace. If you are a person with a disability and need the job posting in an alternative format or any other accessible accommodations during the hiring process, please email your request to **HRServices@cushwake.com**. Please refer to the job title and job location when you contact us.

* Serve as the primary point of contact for employees seeking guidance on workplace issues and concerns.

JOB DESCRIPTION:

The Amazon Brand Manager will be responsible for end to end P&L management, operations,

promotions etc. on all external marketplaces such as Amazon, Flipkart, Nykaa etc. to deliver strong

revenue growth in line with monthly & annual business targets, manage our business operations on

title: Captain
description:
Brevo, formerly known as Sendinblue, is the leading customer relationship management (CRM) suite designed to fully cultivate long-term customer relationships to empower businesses and expand in a fast-changing digital world. Brevo makes it simple and accessible for businesses to grow their customer relationships with intuitive and scalable marketing and CRM tools such as Email, SMS, WhatsApp, Chat, Marketing Automation, Meetings, and much more.  

We are a rapidly growing team of more than 800+ employees, representing over 67 nationalities spread across eight offices in Paris, Berlin, Sofia, Noida, Bengaluru, Seattle, Vienna, and Toronto.  

At Brevo, all Brevonauts evolve in a multicultural, caring, and flexible environment. We are an international team composed of tech & non-tech profiles looking for talents that share our values: empower the customer, build up together, impact first, humbly open, and people company. **About Captain Wallet**: Captain Wallet (recently acquired by Brevo) is the leading wallet marketing platform in France, enabling clients to engage efficiently with their customers’ mobile wallets at the right time and the right place and allows brands to connect to wallets like Apple Wallet and Google Wallet. For brands, wallets create a highly personalized and effective communication channel directly on their mobile with their consumers. We are a team of 30 employees working with 200 (and growing!) key accounts, such as Intersport, Monoprix, McDonald's, Le Bon Marché, Malakoff Humanis, Sandro, Décathlon, Sephora, Courir, Lacoste, Sarenza, Auchan, L’Occitane. We are serving customers in more than 150 countries!
By joining, Captain Wallet you will be working alongside our Chief Software Engineer to build the Core Services team.  

  

With scalability in mind, the Core Services team will be responsible for identifying key services from Captain Wallet and reengineering them for a wider purpose at Brevo. By exposing these services to both Captain Wallet and Brevo products, the team will be a key player in building the synergy between Captain Wallet and Brevo.
### **As a Reactjs Developer, you will:**

* Competence in writing clean, bug-free code as per defined standards (appropriate variable declaration class/method design, non-redundant and optimized code).
* Ability to write unit test cases and test their code accordingly.
* Awareness of technologies used in their project and coding practices and tools.
* Ability to translate design/program specifications to clean code.
* Knowledge of using code repository tools and build automation.
* Communicating promptly and clearly with all stakeholders.
* Maintaining a cohesive spirit to accomplish team responsibilities.
* Accurately reporting the status of assignments and escalating issues and risks in a timely manner.

### **What will contribute to your success:**

* 3-5 years of relevant experience in ReactJS, Redux, and React Hooks.
* Strong proficiency in JavaScript, Design Patterns & Performance Optimization.
* Familiarity with RESTful APIs and GraphQL.
* Knowledge of modern web development tools and libraries (e.g., Webpack).
* Good to have skills:- Writing unit test cases using Jest, Enzyme, and Mobile Experience
* Excellent communication skills and learning attitude

### **What we offer:**

* A unique opportunity to join an international and collaborative startup environment in a hyper-growth context
* The chance to grow your professional and technical skills, with real room for career progression
* A modern office in a central location with free fruits & drinks & a lot of fun activities
* Amazing referral program where employees can choose a gift item of 1.5 Lac including a bike, flight tickets, and many more.
* 1.4x times your salary if you're working on any week off or holiday due to critical tasks/issues
* An umbrella of leaves and holidays
* Free cab facility for all employees
* Wellness benefit fund up to INR 7500 in a year to each employee
* Budget to support your workspace at home
* Medical Insurance of INR 10 Lacs is borne by the company.
* An employee-friendly compensation structure that includes Tax saving optional components where the employee can save extra tax
* Bi-annual global company offsite; inter-office trips
* Virtual Festival and birthday celebrations, Team parties, & team-building outings

### **Meet us!**

* **Round 1** - HR Screening (20 mins)
* **Round 2** - Technical Team Interview (60 mins)
* **Round 3** - Technical Manager Interview (60 mins)
* **Round 4 -** Techno-Functional Interview (45-60 mins)
* **Final Round** - HR round 30 mins

  

Brevo puts diversity and inclusion at the heart of its values. We examine all applications with treatment based on equal skills and applying the principles of non-discrimination.  

Brevo values work-life balance and offers flexible working hours and remote work. Most of our teams will be working mostly remotely and others will follow a hybrid model depending on the nature of the job. This policy is based on a mutual understanding between the Head of, Managers, and Team Members.

* Kolkata, West Bengal (Required)

Ability to Relocate:

title: Software Engineering Manager
description:
**About Wells Fargo India & Philippines**  

  

Wells Fargo India & Philippines enables global talent capabilities for Wells Fargo Bank NA., by supporting over half of Wells Fargo's business lines and staff functions across Technology, Business Services, Risk Services and Knowledge Services. Wells Fargo India & Philippines operates in Hyderabad, Bengaluru and Chennai in India and in Manila, Philippines. Learn more about Wells Fargo India & Philippines at our International Careers website  

  

**Department Overview**  

  

Enterprise Business Technology is responsible for supporting enterprise technology initiatives related to messaging and collaboration, risk technology, corporate systems data, and various internal systems and tools. Our services include support for database administration, data warehousing, email, Intranet, system development tools, HR systems, and General Ledger systems.  

  

**About this role:**  

  

Wells Fargo is seeking a Software Engineering Senior Manager. In this role you will be responsible to lead and manage a team of Engineers. The team is responsible for ensuring the stability of products designed for Corporate Risk Technology (CRT) - Model Governance and Validation area. This position provides leadership and decision-making for the team; and will work collaboratively with others to continually increase the security, efficiency of processes, and quality of service for our line of business partners, and to meet the demand of changing technologies while reducing complexity and increasing consistency in CRT area.  

  

The position requires a leader who shall collaborate and consult with agile teams and product managers to drive positive outcomes using cloud native solutions and technology. This role requires a clear understanding and technical knowledge of all the components involved in the projects. Position will lead process improvements, operation efficiency, and capacity planning to meet technical and business demands.
  

  

**In this role, you will:*** This individual will be responsible to lead the Model Registration and Validation Technology team. India team development including driving hiring, training, development and retaining of strong analytical capabilities.
* Manage, coach, and develop a team or teams of experienced engineers and engineering managers in roles with moderate complexity and risk, responsible for building high quality capabilities with modern technology
* Ensure adherence to the Banking Platform Architecture, and meeting non-functional requirements with each release
* Partner with, engage and influence architects and experienced engineers to incorporate Wells Fargo Technology technical strategies, while understanding next generation domain architecture and enable application migration paths to target architecture; for example cloud readiness, application modernization, data strategy
* Function as the technical representative for the product during cross-team collaborative efforts and planning
* Identify and recommend opportunities for driving escalated resolution of technology roadblocks including code, build and deployment while also managing overall software development cycle and security standards
* Determine appropriate strategy and actions to act as an escalation partner for scrum masters and the teams to meet moderate to high risk deliverables and help remove impediments, obstacles, and friction while encouraging constant learning, experimentation, and continual improvement
* Build engineering skills side-by-side in the codebase, conduct peer reviews to evaluate quality and solution alignment to technical direction, and guide design, as needed
* Interpret, develop and ensure security, stability, and scalability within functions of technology with moderate complexity, as well as identify, manage and mitigate technology and enterprise risk
* Collaborate with, partner with and influence Product Managers/Product Owners to drive user satisfaction, influence technology requirements and priorities in the product roadmap, promote innovative and intelligent solutions, generate corporate value and articulate technical strategy while being a solid advocate of agile and DevOps practices
* Interact directly with third party vendors and technology service providers
* Manage allocation of people and financial resources to ensure commitments are met and align with strategic objectives in technology engineering
* Hire, build and guide a culture of talent development to have the skills required to effectively design and deliver innovative solutions for product areas and products to meet business objectives and strategy, as well as conduct performance management for engineers and managers

**Required Qualifications:*** Bachelor's degree in a quantitative field such as applied mathematics, statistics, engineering, finance, economics, econometrics, or computer sciences
* Overall 13+ years of IT experience with minimum 10+ experience on Software Development and 5+ years of leadership or supervisory experience.
* Strong business partnering skills with resources across the organization in a matrix environment.
* Experience with Java/J2EE, Spring, Spring MVC, SpringUI, ORM (Hibernate, Spring JDBC, JPA), JDBC, SpringBoot, Messaging Services (Kafka, JMS), Workflow tools
* Experience in developing Cloud native applications using Java stack or any other technology.
* Strong knowledge of Agile
* Strong Experience in working with global delivery teams
* Demonstrated ability to think outside the box and design industry leading solutions
* Excellent leadership, stakeholder management and project management skills. Extremely good in verbal, presentation, written, and interpersonal communication skills. Good negotiation, conflict resolution and decision-making skills.
* Effective people management experience with managing managers and team members
* Able to challenge the status quo and drive innovation by generating creative ideas and solutions
* Keeps up to date on current research and technology in the industry
* Tries new approaches when problem solving, seeking ideas, or suggestions from others as appropriate
* Recognizes the importance of partnership to achieve objectives
* Is clear when explaining ideas and concepts to others, communication is structured and easy to understand.

**Desired Qualifications:*** Ability to prioritize work, meet deadlines, achieve goals, and work under pressure in a dynamic and complex environment.
* Experience with change control processes and governance
* Ability to handle confidential material in a professional manner.

**Posting End Date:**
  

6 Mar 2024  

**\\*Job posting may come down early due to volume of applicants.**
  

  

**We Value Diversity**  

  

At Wells Fargo, we believe in diversity, equity and inclusion in the workplace; accordingly, we welcome applications for employment from all qualified candidates, regardless of race, color, gender, national origin, religion, age, sexual orientation, gender identity, gender expression, genetic information, individuals with disabilities, pregnancy, marital status, status as a protected veteran or any other status protected by applicable law.  

  

Employees support our focus on building strong customer relationships balanced with a strong risk mitigating and compliance-driven culture which firmly establishes those disciplines as critical to the success of our customers and company. They are accountable for execution of all applicable risk programs (Credit, Market, Financial Crimes, Operational, Regulatory Compliance), which includes effectively following and adhering to applicable Wells Fargo policies and procedures, appropriately fulfilling risk and compliance obligations, timely and effective escalation and remediation of issues, and making sound risk decisions. There is emphasis on proactive monitoring, governance, risk identification and escalation, as well as making sound risk decisions commensurate with the business unit's risk appetite and all risk and compliance program requirements.  

  

Candidates applying to job openings posted in US: All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, national origin, disability, status as a protected veteran, or any other legally protected characteristic.  

  

Candidates applying to job openings posted in Canada: Applications for employment are encouraged from all qualified candidates, including women, persons with disabilities, aboriginal peoples and visible minorities. Accommodation for applicants with disabilities is available upon request in connection with the recruitment process.  

  

**Applicants with Disabilities**  

  

To request a medical accommodation during the application or interview process, visit Disability Inclusion at Wells Fargo .  

  

**Drug and Alcohol Policy**  

  

Wells Fargo maintains a drug free workplace. Please see our Drug and Alcohol Policy to learn more.

title: People Partnerships Associate
description:
**Job Title:** People Partnerships Associate


**Reports to:** Sr Manager, People Partnerships


**Location**: Hyderabad, INDIA


**Education**: Master of Business Administration


Electronic Arts (EA) is the world's leading independent developer and publisher of interactive entertainment software for personal computer and consoles. We are now applying its 20 years of experience creating world-leading interactive entertainment experiences to mobile gaming.


**About the Role**


You will work with HR management, partners with EA managers and employees to develop and implement talent strategies at the individual, team, and studio level, that are designed to strengthen employee culture and to support the attainment of EA business objectives. Champion and help manage company-wide programs (e.g., performance review, compensation review, stock/recognition, benefits, workforce planning, succession planning, training, and organizational change). Customizes corporate HR programs to enable local implementation. Coach and recommend solutions to resolve employee relations issues and escalates to senior HR management. Develop both business and HR COE partner relationships to ensure respect and trust.


**Main Responsibilities:**


* Is seen as a trusted advisor by managers at all Responds to employees and management inquiries on a broad range of issues
* Provide guidance to managers on best practices in management and related programs
* Support hiring efforts; coordinates hiring and selection with COE Talent Acquisition partners to ensure a positive candidate experience
* Partner with HR management and COEs to improve our capability through identification and implementation of programs that provide development opportunities to meet our goals.
* Participate and promote employee engagement initiatives and help analyze feedback, related presentations, and may help facilitate meetings to review outcomes and develop action plans.
* Through ongoing relationship with critical talent, identifies retention risks and recommends actions to address and escalates where needed.
* Work with business to foster a culture of ongoing performance feedback and development.
* Liaise with HR management on matters relating to employee engagement, welfare, discipline, and employee satisfaction issues.
* Utilize knowledge of local employment legislation (and may include increasing understanding of global employment law), partners with managers and HR to address workplace issues.
* May also facilitate meetings to address ER issues identified from survey feedback and other sources and partner with management to create action plans to address.

**Skills Required**


* University degree in Human Resources, or Master of Business Administration.
* 1-3 Yrs years of professional experience in Human Resources experience (Recruitment /Generalist) in high-tech industry.
* Experience gained across core HR functions including Recruitment, NHO process Employee Relations, Performance Management, Resourcing, Learning and Development, Change Management, and HRIS.
* Fluent in English (written and spoken).

**Behaviors and Competencies**


* Strong organizational/multitasking and prioritization setting
* Teamwork spirit.
* Project management.
* Good verbal and written communication. Customer focus.
* Experience using data and data-driven insights to support the team by offering appropriate solutions.
* Presentation development and delivery

  

We are a global team of creators, storytellers, technologists, experience originators, innovators and so much more. We believe amazing games and experiences start with teams as diverse as the players and communities we serve. At Electronic Arts, the only limit is your imagination.

title: Administrative Officer
description:
Position: **Senior Officer - HR Admin**

Number of vacancies: 1

Location: Bangalore/ Mumbai

**Summary/ Objective:**

At Gaiagen, we manufacture products that are biological alternatives to chemicals, in the field of pest management.

We are looking for an ambitious and energetic ‘**Sr. Officer - HR Admin ’** to help us with HR administration, payroll management, Labour Contract Management, HR compliance and safety related work. This includes Updating internal payroll databases, coordination with the Payroll Partner, ensuring Statutory compliance related to HR & Factories Act and timely submission of returns, recruitments, addressing employee grievances related to payroll, PF, ESIC, Leaves etc., Management of Labour Contractors & Safety.

**Required Qualification:** 

* MBA in Human Resources or relevant field.
* Minimum experience of 2-3 years in the field of Human Resources.
* Good communication skills in English, Kannada and Hindi.
* Safety related certification will be an added advantage.

**Skills and Attributes:**

* Proven work experience as a Payroll Officer or similar role
* Hands-on experience with HRIS /accounting softwares/ MS Office/ G-suite.
* Strong math skills with an ability to spot numerical errors & good detailing.
* Good knowledge of labor legislations.
* Ability to handle confidential information.

**Job Description:** 

* Compile relevant payroll data and Coordinate with the Payroll partner to ensure timely salary dispersals.
* MIS preparation and sharing relevant reports with the Finance Department.
* Ensure wages and tax withholdings comply with regulations.
* Ability to understand and help in designing compensation, benefits, taxes and insurance deductions.
* Adherence to labour related compliance with regard to Factories Act.
* Ensuring compliance with HR policies, and promoting effective communication within the organization.
* Preliminary screening for Recruitment.
* Organizing onboarding of new employees & Induction.
* Implementing HR policies and working with managers to ensure their enforcement.
* Manage Exit Formalities & Full & Final Calculations.
* Management of Labour Contractors and approval of bills and ensuring overall compliance.
* Visiting Government Departments based on requirement.
* Conduct Fire drills/ POSH Meetings/ Annual Medical Checkup as per requirements.
* Build relationships with key stakeholders.
* Handling Employee Grievances related to HR Administration (PF/ESIC/ Insurance).
* Building Safety Culture within the organization.

**Equality Statement:** Gaiagen is committed to building a diverse workplace. We invite applications from all persons, irrespective of gender, disabilities, and members of religious minorities groups who can contribute through their experience to the diversity and effectiveness of our workplace. Equality and diversity are core to our values as an organization. Staff members are expected to work collectively and individually to promote a constructive and sensitive approach to colleagues from different backgrounds, and value and respect their work.

**Conflict of Interest:** Public or other activity, affiliation to or support for any group or organization, personal association or other factor which may generate a real or perceived conflict of interest with our principles of independence and impartiality, or raise a security concern, or otherwise prevent the candidate from carrying out key functions of the specific post and would therefore disqualify the candidate from being appointed.

**Selection Process:** 

* Shortlisting of candidates based on skills and experience
* Telephonic / Online interview
* Face to face interview

Job Types: Full-time, Permanent

Salary: Up to ₹500,000.00 per year

Benefits:

* Health insurance
* Provident Fund

Schedule:

* Day shift

Supplemental pay types:

* Yearly bonus

Experience:

* HR Admin: 2 years (Required)

Ability to Commute:

* Goregaon East, Mumbai, Maharashtra (Required)

Work Location: In person

**Speak with the employer**  
+91 7353566611  
Expected Start Date: 01/04/2024
